job_description:
About Sourced
Sourced is a rapidly growing global consultancy with offices in multiple regions. Founded in 2010, we provide consulting services to migrate enterprise clients to hyperscale cloud providers. We specialize in organisation-wide cloud transformation and DevOps enablement for a wide range of industries, including financial services, healthcare, aviation, media, and telecommunications. We work with some of the largest and most security-conscious organisations around the world to help them unlock innovation through cloud computing.
Sourced has recently joined forces with Amdocs to accelerate innovation in the cloud. Amdocs, a leading provider of software and professional services to more than 350 communication and media providers in over 80 countries, has more than 40 years of industry experience and welcomes Sourced to join its team of 26,000 employees.
What you'll be responsible for
Working closely with technical leads and client teams to fully demonstrate the benefits of cloud technology
Helping to build & introduce clients to automated delivery pipelines (CI/CD)
Defining and implementing cloud-based solutions in line with industry best practices and enterprise architecture guidelines
Supporting customers in troubleshooting issues in their test and/or production environments and identifying root cause
Presenting case studies and cloud solutions at meetups, conferences and technology events
Providing leadership, mentoring, and coaching to your teams
What you will bring to the role
Proven track record of enterprise IT consulting; experience in financial services is highly regarded
Proven experience architecting and implementing enterprise-scale, secure, and high availability solutions in the AWS Cloud environment
Experience in cloud deployment IaC templating using offerings such as CloudFormation and/or Terraform
A deep understanding of public cloud security principles and experience adhering to compliance standards
Thorough experience writing automation scripts with Python, Powershell, Ruby, NodeJS, Go or other
Experience working with source code management using Git
Deep experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes, and tools, such as Jenkins, CodePipeline, CodeDeploy, Atlassian Stack or other
Experience working with configuration management technologies such as Puppet, Chef, and/or Ansible
Knowledge of backup & recovery procedures and technologies, data storage and retention requirements
Experience with network design, subnetting, and routing
Experience in preparing and presenting technical material to a variety of audiences
Experience working in Agile project delivery teams
Desirable Skills
Experience working in heavily regulated industries, such as the financial services sector
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field
Database experience with SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL or other
Experience with more than one public cloud provider such as GCP and/or Azure
Knowledge of logging & event management tools such as Splunk, ELK or other
Professional and/or Specialty level AWS certifications
Experience in working with microservices or serverless architecture
Experience working with containers using Docker
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, individual career development plans, supportive management and team members, a training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, annual company bonuses, and global relocation packages! job_description:
We are looking for a DevOps Support Engineer are the front-line support for our product teams. This position will act as the face of our DevOps team and will work closely with internal and vendor DevOps Engineers to advance the products, teams, and environments we support. Members in this role support all aspects of the software development process including continuous integration platforms, source control and release management.
Job Purpose
To monitor alerts, improve the efficiency, troubleshooting application and production environment issues and remediating them.
Key Accountabilities
Manage, monitor and operate the system platform to ensure all business functions running smoothly.
Work across teams to continually review, provide feedback, implement best practices to improve the efficiency of the systems and drive future innovation.
Monitor ongoing changes that may impact the application and customers.
Identify root cause for production incidents and lead the relevant operation teams to implement necessary actions to prevent recurrence.
Drive incident management process and support a blameless post-mortems culture.
Provide functional support for client queries when necessary.
Automate the system operations to attain high level of efficiency.
Responsibilities
React to critical issues on a timely basis i.e. troubleshoot, investigate and escalate (if necessary) issues and create or apply appropriate solutions to immediate issues.
Provide off-hour/weekend support for deployment and post-checks.
Maintain awareness of relevant technical and product trends with self-learning and job shadowing.
Troubleshoot problems across a wide range of technical skills.
Create and maintain the operational documents to reflect the changes and upgrades.
Identify pain points and provide recommendations to development teams to streamline the business process as much as possible.
Coordinate and implement the platform and infrastructure upgrades or releases with technical and business teams to meet the overall schedule.
Participate in platform management, and capacity planning.
Ability to communicate effectively and professionally, both verbally and in writing between executive stakeholders and product team for technical and non-technical term.
Taking team support phone in rotating basis and provide 24x7 phone support if any issue.
To work in shift basis occasionally if required and support change implementation and system maintenance during weekend rotating basis (Comp-ff will be provided to offset weekend working hours)
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or Computer Engineering or Computer Application.
At least 2 years of working experience in banking / financial institute environments.
Experience working in a Technical Support environment with good communication skill.
Basic understanding of Equities market and wiling to learn.
Knowledge and/or experience using including Wintel batch scripting, Linux, Oracle/SQL Server/Maria/PostgreSQL Database etc.
Basic understanding of firewalls, load balancers, Tectia and networking concepts.
Hand-on experience in Amazon Cloud Computing (AWS), Pipeline, GIT, CI/CD process etc. is highly desired.
Proactive with good an analytic and organization skills.
Ability to work independently, multi-task, prioritize and deliver in a time pressured environment.
Communication skills with all levels and team-work spirits are essential.

Job Description
Telco SolutionEngineeristhe leader and primary interface to technologists and key decision-makers to our first-tier communication service provider customers. You will be expected to build relationships with technologist in our customers and strategic partners and develop technical solutions for the Radio Access Network (RAN) and/or Mobile Packet Core.
In this capacity you will lead the development, presentation, and positioning of multi-product solutions for customers in the Telco industry and ensure VMware's roadmap and strategy meets customerrequirements.Youwill also be responsible for being the voice of the customer within the VMware product and development teams.
You are a thought leader driving technical and business requirements with large Mobile and CommunicationsProviders.Youhave worked in the Telco and/or Cloud ecosystem of Vendors and/or Partners to drive end to end strategy for customers.
*** This position is part of VMware Future of Work and fully remote. Candidates can be located anywhere in the United States!
Industry Specific Knowledge:
Knowledgeable in 3G/4G and 5G Radio network architecture and ecosystem
Detailed understanding of 3GPP packet core domain and specifications as related to 4G EPC and 5G core.
Functions: SMF, UPF,AMF, MME, SAEGW, ePDG
Subscriber and Policy (PCRF/PCF,AUSF,SDM,HSS,HLR)
Knowledgeable in Radio Access Network (RAN) design and RAN virtualization
Strong technical knowledge of 3GPP specifications as related to CU and DU and RRU protocol interfaces
RAN Technologies (vRAN, Small Cells, MIMO, Timing and Sync with GPS, IEEE 1588v2)
Knowledge of O-RAN specs, TIP/OpenRAN projects, and/or ONF SD-RAN.
Mobile Private LTE, Small Cell, and Wi-Fi Industry experience
Data Center networking, Virtualization, NFV and SDN
Layer 1-3 functionality
Cloud Native Container orchestration via Kubernetes.
MEC and Edge Computing
Management and Orchestration (e.g., MANO), Network Management, OSS/BSS, and TM Forum standards

Should also have:
Consultative selling skills
Outstanding communication and presentation skills
Experience working with virtual teams in order to develop and deliver customer solutions
Communications Service Provide domain knowledge

Responsibilities:
You will present VMware vision, strategy and product roadmaps to executives and technical management and illustrate relevant Mobility and Service Provider use cases for VMware products
You will drive the adoption and usage of VMware products within strategic Telco and Service Provider accounts
Develop technical aspects of the sales strategy to ensure alignment with business objectives in Telco RAN and/or Packet Core
You will provide technical leadership and business support for strategic opportunities involving the VMware core NFV, SDDC, SD-WAN, SDN, SDS, IoT, security, and mobile / device client solution sets
You will act as the advocate in driving the customer agenda engaging with internal entities at VMware, including leadership, product, engineering, marketing and R&D groups
You will maintain technical and business knowledge of industry directions, trends, relevant standards, trade associations, industry consortia, etc. and present on behalf of VMware when appropriate
You will maintain working knowledge of applicable competitor products and offerings
You will actively participate in regular professional development, training, and certification activities that are relevant to your job role
You will provide consultative support and collaboration on factory driven development programs, working with product, marketing, support or training organizations representing the voice and point of view of the customer

Expectations:
You will have 10-15 years of experience in the Telco industry with a major portion selling to or working directly for companies in the telco or mobile communications, media and entertainment sector(s) in a technical, engineering, or development capacity
You have pertinent professional credentials in the field, such as undergraduate and / or graduate degrees or equivalent, professional certifications, etc.
You will have direct knowledge of and exposure to the technologies, architectures, and products used throughout the networks and operational environment of communications and media service providers
You are an enthusiastic self-starter with a friendly demeanor, and the desire / ability to work effectively within a team comprised of a range of personality types, backgrounds, and skill sets
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral are required along with excellent presentation skills and strong customer facing and relationship building skills. The ability to present extemporaneously is desirable
You are self-driven and must be effective in working both independently and in a team setting
You have strong listening and question based selling skills with the ability to uncover business challenges and develop solutions to tackle those challenges
You can demonstrate a history of embracing the EPIC2 values of VMware () and are prepared to lead by example in upholding the positive culture and workplace environment that has made VMware a destination employer

job_description:
Cloud Engineers in IBM Client Engineering are part of a cross-functional team delivering a unique client co-creation experience to accelerate client transformation. As part of an entrepreneurial team, you will use contemporary technologies and approaches to design, develop, test, and deliver solutions. You will apply a user-centric approach to ensure all features add value for the user and achieve the desired client impact. You understand the nuances of different cloud solutions (hybrid, public, private, multi-cloud, on-prem) and implications for solution design. You understand the relationship among various technologies and architectures and how they contribute to the overall solution. You will develop a deep understanding of complex, large scale multi-region solutions which utilize multiple independent life cycle microservices. An ideal candidate will be familiar with Design Thinking, Behavior and Test-Driven Development, and application of Agile methodologies.

The responsibility includes:
- Uses contemporary technologies and approaches to design, develop, test and deliver Cloud-based solutions
- Applies a user-centric approach to ensure all included features and value for the user and achieve desired client impact
- Understands the nuances of different cloud solutions and implications for solution design
- Understands the relationship among various technologies and architectures and how they contribute to an overall solution
- Deep understanding of complex large scale multi region solutions that are utilizing multiple independent life cycle microservices

To be successful in this role you will need to:

- Employ IBM's Design Thinking to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability; ensure that the implemented solutions are unit tested and ready to be integrated into their product
- Demonstrate a growth mindset and continuous learning; stay current on IBM strategy and offerings with understanding of technical principles of Docker and Kubernetes
- Demonstrate strong analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skills combined with keen desire to develop quality code in an Agile process
- Design, code, and test innovative component-level solutions in areas such as cloud foundation, cloud services, cloud management applications, machine learning, computational linguistics, natural language processing and security applications
- Use DevOps practices and methods to plan and create software applications
- Partners with the client and IBM Client Engineering team to enable a continuous integration environment leading to successful Minimum Viable Product (MVP) development
- Analyzes client development environment to champion DevOps and CI/CD practices

Are you a seasoned technical program manager, who is passionate about cloud and the benefits it can bring to support the largest and most complex government customers in their journey to the cloud Azure is the fastest-growing business in Microsoft's history and is the foundation of Microsoft's Cloud Services. Continuing this success, Azure has expanded into the Government space with its mission-critical cloud, delivering breakthrough innovation and security to those customers and their partners. With world-class security, protection, and compliance, agencies can accelerate cloud adoption with confidence, in a consistent hybrid environment designed for flexibility and scale. Azure for Government enables innovation with deeply integrated cloud services, advanced analytics, and an open application platform, that provides the building blocks to rapidly develop, deploy and manage intelligent solutions. Government customers can leverage the vast network of Microsoft's technology partners and diverse marketplace offerings, to advance their mission and serve their citizens.
As we drive to be the leading cloud platform in the world, Azure Global Government Engineering team is hiring an exceptional Government Expansion Director to help accelerate our most strategic government customers adoption of Microsoft Azure by connecting our technical experience, along with our customers vision and challenges directly to the engineering product teams, and as a result help to ensure Azure is the most compelling solution on the market. We work across the broad range of Azure technologies understanding customer mission scenarios, cloud patterns and adoption blockers.
The Azure Global Government (AGG) Team is looking for a seasoned and experienced engineering leader to help define and execute on our Government expansion strategy. You will partner closely with your colleagues, engineering, and infrastructure teams, as well as country leadership to drive adoption of Azure.
We have exciting opportunities for you to innovate, influence, transform and grow within our organization and to shape the adoption of Azure. We encourage you to apply to learn more.

The successful candidate must be customer obsessed, collaborative, and be able to apply principle-based thinking to critical problems to create outcome-oriented strategies. As a Program Manager, it will be critical to influence, engender trust and leverage long-term relationships at a time when the Government's going through one of the most complex transformations in history, especially in this secure environment and the challenge that adds.
You will engage directly with key business partners and government customers up to the CXO level, supporting partnerships and opportunities with tier one customers, whilst also driving large strategic and complex projects. Additionally, the successful candidate will establish partnerships and a unified strategy and execution model with the local subsidiary and provide transparency and situational awareness of Azure Engineering investments and priorities through regular engagement and reporting.
You will be accountable to lead engagements with new Senior Government Stakeholders to understand and support their national strategy from an all-up Microsoft perspective, to include the following scope of responsibilities: Customer Success Management, Technical Leadership, and Winning New Business.
This is a senior role and is responsible for leading the cyber security activity in country for the provision of higher classification network and workload capability. This person will be accountable for ensuring the successful security operations and assurance of the program.
Define and deliver the cyber security program to help our customers prepare, protect, detect, respond and recover along all points of the security lifecycle.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of government policy for threat and risk, and deliver operational documentations in compliance with relevant security framework(s) to gain authority to operate in conjunction with relevant customer stakeholders.
Working with Azure Engineering teams and external security consultants to translate security policy into actionable designs to achieve compliance to the requirements and specifications.
Create and communicate knowledge of Information Security and Assurance processes
Cyber controls and frameworks for deployment of secure enclaves, gateways and restricted administrative environments, Mission Critical Platform modernization
Contribute directly to engineering product teams helping to ensure Azure is the most aligned compelling mission workloads for the Defense and Intelligence sector
Provide security and architectural guidance for solutions on azure through engagement with security risk and compliance personnel

job_description:
About Sourced
Sourced is a rapidly growing global consultancy with offices in multiple regions. Founded in 2010, we provide consulting services to migrate enterprise clients to hyperscale cloud providers. We specialize in organization-wide cloud transformation and DevOps enablement for a wide range of industries, including financial services, healthcare, aviation, media, and telecommunications. We work with some of the largest and most security-conscious organisations around the world to help them unlock innovation through cloud computing.
Sourced has recently joined forces with Amdocs to accelerate innovation in the cloud. Amdocs, a leading provider of software and professional services to more than 350 communication and media providers in over 80 countries, has more than 40 years of industry experience and welcomes Sourced to join its team of 26,000 employees.
What you'll be responsible for
Working closely with technical leads and client teams to fully demonstrate the benefits of cloud technology
Helping to build & introduce clients to automated delivery pipelines (CI/CD)
Defining and implementing cloud-based solutions in line with industry best practices and enterprise architecture guidelines
Supporting customers in troubleshooting issues in their test and/or production environments and identifying root cause
Presenting case studies and cloud solutions at meetups, conferences and technology events
Providing leadership, mentoring, and coaching to your teams
What you will bring to the role
Proven track record of enterprise IT consulting; experience in financial services is highly regarded
Proven experience architecting and implementing enterprise-scale, secure, and high availability solutions in the AWS Cloud environment
Experience in cloud deployment IaC templating using offerings such as CloudFormation and/or Terraform
A deep understanding of public cloud security principles and experience adhering to compliance standards
Thorough experience writing automation scripts with Python, Powershell, Ruby, NodeJS, Go or other
Experience working with source code management using Git
Deep experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes, and tools, such as Jenkins, CodePipeline, CodeDeploy, Atlassian Stack or other
Experience working with configuration management technologies such as Puppet, Chef, and/or Ansible
Knowledge of backup & recovery procedures and technologies, data storage and retention requirements
Experience with network design, subnetting, and routing
Experience in preparing and presenting technical material to a variety of audiences
Experience working in Agile project delivery teams
Desirable Skills
Experience working in heavily regulated industries, such as the financial services sector
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field
Database experience with SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL or other
Experience with more than one public cloud provider such as GCP and/or Azure
Knowledge of logging & event management tools such as Splunk, ELK or other
Professional and/or Specialty level AWS certifications
Experience in working with microservices or serverless architecture
Experience working with containers using Docker
Why Sourced

job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, and headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Sourced Group is the market leader in providing cloud transformation services to the most highly regulated, security-conscious organizations globally. With operations in Australia, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, New Zealand, and the United States, we work with the Global 200 to drive business transformation through the cloud and I.T. services. Sourced Group is an AWS Premier Partner, Microsoft Azure Gold Managed Partner, Google Premier Partner and have worked with extensive financial services and regulated enterprises such as the top banks in Canada, Australia and Singapore, as well as airlines and telecommunications companies. After recent successes, Sourced Group is continuing to expand its footprint around the world. Sourced was acquired this year by Amdocs.
Sourced Values
Here at Sourced, we are committed to providing a rewarding, enjoyable, balanced workplace and career path for our employees. We value authentic, self-driven people, who aspire to grow personally and professionally, and are committed to delivering excellence in all areas.
Our company Values are Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, and Sustainability.
Role
The Lead Delivery Consultant position offers an excellent career and growth opportunity for a talented and highly-motivated professional with significant prior experience in operations, management consulting and technical cloud operations. This role is part of a newly formed Solutions Enablement team in Singapore.
Sourced is a company that makes a tremendous impact and has specific knowledge and experience working in sophisticated, often complicated, and generally extensive, regulated environments. Our people are fearless and work in partnership with both client leadership and engineering teams to build world-class public cloud solutions in regulated and security-conscious verticals.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Enablement, this newly created position is responsible for leading agile cloud transformation projects for customers in ASEAN.
As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we need passionate leaders to help our largest customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud platform operations. You will work one-on-one with our top-tier customers and partners, supporting not only the software development lifecycle as it applies to the cloud services but also the operations management of active services, and business relationships between the Customer, Sourced Group, and partners (such as Microsoft, AWS, and application development partners).
As a Lead Agile Delivery Consultant, you will be the primary operational point of contact for one or more customers, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business-critical applications. Whilst this role is business-focused, you will coordinate technical teams to deliver enterprise public cloud projects (with AWS, Azure and GCP).
You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers to build mature, stable and secure operational cloud platforms. You will leverage your broad experience in management consulting focusing on the delivery of large-scale projects across industries such as Finance, Consumer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications.
You will also be responsible for driving Cloud change program into our clients and develop the Governance and Change Management offerings.
With your team of Delivery consultants, you will be our Cloud Consultants and Site leads advocate and you will support their workload by managing timelines, scope and customers expectations. You must possess customer-facing skills that enable you to represent the Sourced team, our capabilities, and our services within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. Each day will bring new challenges to which you will need to adapt and respond. Customer centricity, tenacity, and a sense of urgency will all contribute to your success in this role. You will:
Act with a sense of urgency, be agile and pragmatic, and foster cross-team collaboration;
Support the Head of Solutions Enablement, Head of Consulting and Head of Sales assist with account management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations with clients, and manage resource allocation
Supervise technical issues resolution, work directly with your team of delivery consultants, as well as escalate to subject-matter experts, and work directly with the cloud service provider(s) (GCP, AWS and Azure) to ensure customer issues are mitigated and resolved in an expeditious manner;
Facilitate discussions to ensure solutions are designed for long term successful deployment and operational stability;
As required, define I.T. and business processes and tools that work well with customers expectations to streamline the performance of the services which we provide;
Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans, as well as to provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, and detailed prelaunch planning;
Analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership, as well as roadmap and service improvement plans;
Desired Skills and Experience
While specific responsibilities will vary based on previous experience, to be successful in the role, the ideal candidate will have the following:
8 years plus of relevant experience in I.T. operations, consulting or related industry experience in digital transformation, preferably in verticals such as Financial services, Telecommunications or the Public sector.
Familiarity with Enterprise operations including ITSM, ITIL v3+, as well as SAFe/Scaled Agile and Agile product ownership & management (Scrum, Kanban, Sprints etc)
A natural problem-solving mindset, be detail-oriented with a creative flair and a bias for action
Relevant experience in project-based, team-oriented environments and a track record of leading or working in teams and delivering against tight deadlines in fast-paced and demanding environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to conduct and leverage sophisticated analyses to identify trends, draw conclusions and present recommendations.
Outstanding facilitation and communication skills; confidence in presenting to senior executives.
Graduate or advanced degree from a top academic program, ideally being a Bachelor's or Master degree in Business, Information Technology, or related field;
A thorough understanding of staffing, capacity planning, and performance engagement for internal teams
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Change Management principles as applied to service delivery in an international setting would be highly regarded.
Ability to lead scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases
If possible, the candidate would have large programs transformation experience, including cloud compliance, security and risk experience in regulated industries, especially the Financial and Services Industry.
Basic understanding of cloud computing. Understanding of DevOps practices would be a plus.
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, personalised career development plans, supportive management and team members, training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, global relocation packages, as well as a company bonus! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.
Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know

job_description:
Your Purpose
Quantum Security was born with a simple mission to protect from threats whilst preparing for the worst. Cyber threats are vast and continue to advance in technique and motivation to steal sensitive data, extort companies, negatively impact reputation, and cause harm. We meet with many organizations who have chosen to defend themselves by purchasing tools they hope are effective against these many threats. At Quantum, we start with a strategic risk-based approach and spend the appropriate energy and resources improving the security posture of our clients. Additionally, our managed SecOps solution ensures they have the risk and compliance posture needed for continuous protection.
We fully understand that no matter how much cybersecurity defense is in front of your data a breach can occur. Quantum Security is extremely effective at reducing the likelihood for an incident, but in the unfortunate case of an incident, we have a focus to ensure we have the proper capabilities to limit its impact and blast radius. This is achieved with our fully integrated platform, smart queries and rulesets, coupled with the use of ML and a knowledgeable team that is obsessed with ensuring the protection of our clients data.
We are looking for a talented Business Development Rep. This role requires you to possess high energy, motivation and passion to build our business across a portfolio of accounts. You are extremely results-driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and adept at building relationships and partnerships to hunt for valuable business in the market.
Responsibilities
Achieve the sales, revenue and gross margin targets.
Utilise all elements of the marketing mix to identify, qualify, develop and close new customer opportunities.
Responsible for prospecting, lead/demand generation as well as qualifying leads from direct customer engagements not channels
Own the full business development ife cycle from prospecting to closure.
Drive new business opportunities within mid-market and enterprise accounts.
Owning all lead generation (outbound) reporting to senior management.
Build and manage relationships with critical market influencers to achieve your objectives.
Collaborate with internal teams e.g. Client Services / Strategic Alliances to execute on a successful go-to-market strategy.
Understand the market needs for cybersecurity.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Computer Engineering, Business Specializations, or other equivalents.
5 years of extensive sales experience as Sales or Business Development role or similar position in IT centric.
Experience in applying solution-selling methodologies to improve revenue growth.
Experience in solutioning and sales in Cybersecurity products and services.
Technical aptitude and agile minded to learn new business and technical concepts quickly.
Strong presentation skills in conducting solutions demonstrations, both in person and via virtual channels.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, high-energy environment.

job_title: APJ Cloud Sales Centre (CSC) Strategy & Operations Manager
job_description:
Job Description :
Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world's leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing start-ups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.

At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as a Business Analyst in the Cloud Sales Center (CSC) at AWS.

As a the Strategy & Operations Manager for the Cloud Sales Centre you will lead our most strategic initiatives to uncover new opportunities or solve our biggest challenges. You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically to identify problems and gaps, collect and analyze data, generate insights, and come up with solutions. You will execute on your proposed business strategies to solve difficult problems and remove blockers for our customers and our business. To do so, you will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders such as sales, operations, product, and marketing teams. Through leading initiatives across APJ, you will gain a unique insight into the internal workings of the world's fastest growing billion dollar IT organization, as you learn and explore your passion.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
In this role, you will demonstrate strong bias for action, but also must have the ability to Dive Deep (see Amazon Leadership Principles). You will drive the management cadence, administration and execution of the team's goals, measurement of goal attainment, evolving and driving various sales processes, involving alignment with the customer sales team and proposing improvements to the business to increase its effectiveness in driving desired results.

The successful candidate must be able to roll-up their sleeves, work in a fast-paced start-up organization, and operate with significant autonomy and discretion.

The ideal candidate will possess a keen business sense and exceptional analytical skills, is able to articulate and communicate a clear value proposition across customers, partners, and within the AWS organization, and its comfortable working across internal functions and geographies. The candidate will be naturally curious, going beyond the obvious to discover unexpected insights and translate those into tangible business value, demonstrating Customer Obsession. Want to know more about what it's like to be part of our Team at AWS Hear from our builders: AWS Builder Stories

Basic Qualifications :
. At least 10+ years experience working in Sales operations, Business operations areas directly engaging with sales force
. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
. Proven experience with the development and implementation of systems/tool utilized for SFDC, variable compensation, revenue reporting, forecasting etc
. Expert level in Excel and Data query tools and Strong business-process design experience

Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial
. Experience working with Cloud Computing

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com

Job Description :

Our customers, clients and communities matter to us at JPMC, and we recognize that in order to deliver a first class service, it's our people that do this, without exception, in a first class way.
There's never been a more exciting time to work in Technology and with our investment in Digital and Cloud native technologies, at JMPC we want to give talented people like you, an opportunity to work with us at the leading edge.
The teams we build are as diverse and culture rich as the communities we serve and we consider that to be a foundation stone for our thriving working environment.
We're really excited to be expanding our Production Management team in Singapore, and we're looking for hands on full stack minded engineers from all technical disciplines who are commercial, intellectually curious, customer obsessed, and love solving complex problems. In return we'll help you expand your skills as you'll be working as part of a Global team, supporting an innovative cloud based technology platform for the firm.
As part of JPMorgan Chase & Co.s global team of technologists and innovators, your work will have a massive impact, both on us as a company, as well as our clients and our business partners around the world.
Responsibilities:
Working alongside our team of technologists from around the world, you will become a member of our expanding Global Production Management function supporting dedicated lines of business for the firm.
It is our passion to collaborate with our colleagues who are developing our technology platforms to deliver legendary service in a secure, value-adding, scalable and resilient way. This means with your deep knowledge of product design, development, coding, analytics, cyber security and chaos engineering, we'll bring out the best in you to help solve complex and mission critical problems, internally and externally.
In practical terms, this means supporting the platform on a day to day basis at an infrastructure, application and customer journey level.
We do this proactively through regular failure mode analysis and chaos testing, supporting change development and delivery through the CI/CD pipeline and reactively through eyes on glass, incident and problem management whilst constantly looking for opportunities to drive forward automation and improvements.
We also Own and drive incident management bridge calls and chats with application development, infrastructure teams, and senior leadership with the purpose of remediating customer impacting incidents quickly. Production Management establishes strong command and control of an Incident, establishing clear accountability and methodical evaluation of complex issue scenarios.
We provide competent and reliable adherence to critical process and procedure, and appropriate escalations in support of production incidents. Applying technical and environmental knowledge and experience to develop and drive appropriate work streams, forming paths to resolution.
We are also responsible for the distribution of clear and concise communications, summarizing incidents and the business/customer experience to a wide group of technical and non-technical audiences.
Core Requirements:
Minimum 5 years of experience within a technology environment is required
MinimumBachelor's degree preferably in Engineering or Information Technology
Demonstrated ability in command centeroperations and incident management
Proven ability to lead with influence, work calmly under pressure, and collaborate with colleagues throughout the firm, to deliver for our customers and clients
Proven experience of working with ITIL disciplines, (Event, Incident, Problem, Change & CSI) ideally in Financial Services context.
Major Incident Management Experience
Extensive customer service and client interaction skills
Experience conducting root cause analysis, documenting findings, and designing plans to rectify production issues
Possess critical thinking and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to think and act independently to resolve production issues.
Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills necessary to work effectively with a variety of individuals and organizations
Working knowledge and experience with cloud-based technologies and solutions including but not limited to AWS, GCP and Azure, with experience in the following AWS-based technologies:
EC2
S3
RDS
EKS
Route 53
AWS Networking and Routing
IAM
Amazon KMS
Exposure to modern database technologies including CockroachDB is desirable.
Working knowledge of cloud-native monitoring platforms including:
Prometheus
Thanos
Grafana
ElasticSearch
Able to work a 12 hour shift pattern as determined by the hiring manager (work schedule will include a weekend).

Secondary Skills
Experience and knowledge of any of the following would be an advantage:
Financial Services products, services and the digital and mobile technologies used to deliver them.
Working in an SRE construct
Agile and DevOps principles
Service Level and Vendor Management
Highly available, high scalable application/service/database support
Architecture, design and business processes
Application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines
Service Management tools such as ServiceNow and related processes
Distributed Tracing, particularly the OpenTracing standards and associated technology stack (Jaeger etc.)
Financial control and budget management

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech organizations. In our global technology centers, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

It also provides the information-protection and technology infrastructure that secures KPMG's technology environment and connects its network of member firms. We work with the other pillars in the GT&K group to provide technology solutions that leverage world-leading partnerships and disruptive digital capabilities, and that provide access to the firm's collective intelligence.
The Cloud Enterprise Chapter Lead is responsible for developing a high performing Cloud Operations team within their region to drive the ITS Global group's agenda and achieve its business objectives. This role focuses on Azure Infrastructure, Platform Services using SRE Principles.

Develop and motivate others: Engages teams, instills confidence, and coaches and mentors the team to find meaning in their work and achieve exceptional results through automation
Foster innovation: Embraces a culture of innovation and experimentation to create value
Ability to build constructive working relations across the different teams, functions, cultures, & genders
Deliver high-quality products and exceptional service that provide value and exceed client expectations
Demonstrate KPMG behavior and values: Integrity, Excellence, Courage, Together, For Better.
Ability to interact professionally with a wide range of customers ranging from end-users and IT staff to management and external service providers.

Experience leading a team of highly skilled professionals

job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At foodpanda we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected operating in 12 countries worldwide. Our team is working on big challenges and complex scalability problems as we grow 6X annually processing millions of orders a year. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.
We work on a large scale, complex systems where you can reach users on a global scale whilst enjoying a high level of autonomy and influence and a flexible working environment. Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer.
Senior Cloud Engineer, APAC
We are looking for a versed Senior Cloud Engineer, APAC to be part of our APAC Tech and Product hub headquartered in Singapore. You will be part of an international team of highly talented and motivated engineers.
What's on the menu:
Work as part of the existing local team in Singapore and in conjunction with the Infrastructure team in Berlin to build, maintain and improve Terraform IaaC and other sort of automation in place.
Propose and implement improvements to the platform to increase resilience and uptime
Perform root cause analysis of incidents and contribute to post-mortem evaluations
Design and develop systems and tools to automate and orchestrate the cloud environment
Work with the development and security teams to ensure best-practices are being followed
What you can bring to the table:
Minimum 3 years experience in designing and implementing Cloud Infrastructure
Required experience in AWS with Terraform. Creation of modules, improvements, lifecycle, etc.
Excellent knowledge of AWS services like RDS, SNS, SQS, DynamoDB, S3, etc (from infrastructure and operations perspective) always under IaaC principles.
Knowledge of one or more programming or scripting languages (such as Python, C++, NodeJS or Golang)
Automation comes naturally to you and is your first instinct, automating yourself out of the job is your mission.
You have strong troubleshooting, monitoring and critical thinking skills and you see yourself as an out-of-the-box thinker.
You're not afraid to take ownership of big problems and deliver solutions to them.
The ideal candidate is someone who holds AWS, Terraform and Kubernetes certifications. But on-the-field experience will be positively valued.
About foodpanda
foodpanda (small f) is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries.

job_description:
About Neo4j:
Neo4j is the world's leading graph data platform. We help organizations including Comcast, ICIJ, NASA, UBS, and Volvo Cars capture the rich context of the real world that exists in their data to solve challenges of any size and scale. Our customers transform their industries by curbing financial fraud and cybercrime, optimizing global networks, accelerating breakthrough research, and providing better recommendations. Neo4j delivers real-time transaction processing, advanced AI/ML, intuitive data visualization, and more. Find out more at neo4j.com and follow us at @Neo4j.
Our Vision:
At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.
As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we're disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.
Responsibilities
Work with the APAC cloud channel director as a two-person team. Build partner funnel and revenue in the region by identifying co-sell opportunities, then nurturing them with our direct sales team. Drive millions in revenue through those partnerships.
Own the technical side of the AWS, Azure, and GCP partnerships for APAC. Become a trusted advisor for Neo4j direct sales and the architects at our cloud partners.
Develop new integrations to cloud services like AWS SageMaker and GCP Vertex AI. Improve existing integrations in IaC technologies like Terraform, CloudFormation, and Azure Resource Manager.
Present at industry events like AWS Summits, blog about integration work and generally work to build awareness of the Neo4j partnerships with AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Up to 30% travel
Qualifications
Experience - Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or a related field. 5+ years of experience in partner architecture, presales, or consulting roles.
Learning - Demonstrated history of ongoing learning.
Communication - Ability to persuasively communicate in written and oral form to a variety of audiences in a variety of mediums (outbound marketing events, blogs, and white papers).
Co-Sell - Ability to determine the technical fit for new cloud partner originated co-sell opportunities and support our solutions engineering team.
Enterprise Software Expertise - Architect for high availability, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery. Familiarity with the software infrastructure ecosystem.
Cloud Expertise - Expertise in cloud services like EC2, S3, Lambda and DynamoDB. Knowledge of IaC technologies like Terraform and CloudFormation
Linux/UNIX skills - Hands-on knowledge of the terminal. Ability to write scripts in languages like bash and python.

Job Description :
Are you an experienced cloud architect/developer who can assist our customers in architecting, developing and re-engineering applications that can fully leverage the AWS Cloud Do you like to work on a variety of game changing projects, at the forefront of application development and cloud technology adoption

In order for applications to be cloud optimized they need to be architected correctly enabling them to reap the benefits of elasticity, horizontal scalability, automation and high availability. On the AWS platform services such as Amazon EC2, Auto Scaling, Elastic Load Balancing, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, Amazon Elastic Container Services to name just a few, provide opportunities to design and build cloud ready applications.

Amazon Web Services is looking for highly talented hands on technical architects to help accelerate our growing Professional Services business. This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

We are looking for hands on architects/developers who are passionate about:
. Helping customers architect scalable, highly available application solutions that leverage AWS services
. Architecting and developing customer applications to be cloud optimized
. Working as a technical leader along side customer business, development and infrastructure teams.
. Providing deep software development knowledge with respect cloud architecture, design patterns and programming
. Leading customer projects in refactoring and re:platform applications
. Advising and implementing AWS best practices
. Working as both an infrastructure and application development specialist
. Agile software development and DevOps
. Implementing DevOps practices such as infrastructure as code, continuous integration and automated deployment
Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants must have the ability to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Basic Qualifications :
. BA/BS degree or equivalent experience
. 10+ or more years of IT implementation experience
. Experience working with customers face to face, driving discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
. Deep hands-on experience leading the design, development and deployment of business software at scale or current hands on technology infrastructure, network, compute, storage, and virtualization experience
. Hands-on technical application architect
. 5+ years of an application programming . Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. security, privacy, etc.)
Preferred Qualifications :
. Extensive experience architecting, designing and programming applications in an AWS Cloud environment
. Experience with designing and building application using AWS services such as EC2, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, AWS OpsWorks
. Designing and building application using Container and serverless technologies
. Experience architecting highly available systems that utilize load balancing, horizontal scalability and high availability
. Experience with continuous integration tools (e.g. Jenkins)
. Hands on familiarity with CloudFormation.
. Experience with configuration management platforms (e.g. Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible)
. Strong scripting skills (e.g. Powershell, Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc.)
. Strong practical application development experience on Linux and Windows-based systems
. Extra curricula software development passion (e.g. active open source contributor)

job_description:
Looking for hands-on Cloud Architects to join the cloud transformation team to support our customers. We are looking for experienced cloud architects who have worked on cloud-native applications development and large-scale cloud migration projects. The candidate must also have experience in application development and migrating workloads to Azure.

This customer-facing position is a hands-on technical role spanning across assessment, design, build, migration, and re-engineering applications to the cloud. Being a trusted technical advisor, you will use your interpersonal skills to advise, recommend, and influence various stakeholders, be technical teams to executives, ensure and meet their short-term technology decisions aligned with their long-term goals.

On the soft-skills side, we are looking for a candidate with strong communications skills, problem-solving and individuals who are passionate about technology. The ability to drive projects and overcome obstacles is an essential aspect we look for in a candidate.
Location: Singapore

Key Responsibilities

Work with the customer directly to define and recommend solutions based on the business requirements.
Bring thought leadership in assessing and defining architecture and design solutions for cloud
Providing deep software development knowledge concerning cloud architecture, patterns, and blueprints.
Apply technical knowledge and insights to create a migration and modernization roadmap for Cloud Adoption. Architect solutions to meet business and IT needs, ensuring technical viability of new projects and successful deployments.
Mentor cloud engineers & application teams on cloud adoption
Evaluate and propose new cloud technologies suited for business solutions.
Assess existing applications and vendor products used to create a targeted roadmap for the cloud.
Ensure cyber security controls as required by standards are realized in the cloud architecture and design.
Ensure the applications are designed to meet the standards on resiliency and recovery and other non-functional requirements.
Define best engineering practices through solid design decisions, processes, and tools.
Introduce the automation (IaC) and best practices and guide cloud engineers.
Champion Agile best practices, processes, and tools supporting DevOps processes.
Be an Azure Platform evangelist with customers, partners, and external communities.
Develop deep relationships with key customer IT decision-makers, who drive long-term cloud adoption within their company to enable them to be cloud advocates.

Technology Competencies
Knowledgeable in Azure core services (Compute, Networking, Storage, Database, Security)
Experience and understanding of large-scale application portfolios in enterprise-wide environments (including migration of on-premise workloads to the cloud)
Experience with architecting, designing, and developing cloud-native applications in an Azure Cloud environment
Experience in software development practices like DevOps and CI/CD toolchains (i.e., Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure DevOps, GitHub, IDE's). Preferred
Experience with cloud-native application and scalable architectures using Azure App Service, API management (RESTful APIs), serverless technologies, container orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Azure Kubernetes Service, GitHub, etc.), API management, microservice frameworks, SDKs, etc.
Experience in one or more of the following programming languages preferred: .Net, Java, Node.js, Python
Required deep expertise in networking: virtual networks, VPN, Azure express routes, Firewall, ALB, Traffic manager, Front Door.
Required expertise with RDBMS and No-SQL database/in-memory database/warehousing services implementation on cloud
Experience in implementing Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC); Terraform or ARM templates
Strong advantageous for expertise in assessment and migration tools.
Strong advantageous for deep expertise in cloud security.
Strong advantageous for data and analytics services implementation on Azure.

Qualification
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field preferred.
10+ or more years of cloud and application development experience.
Deep hands-on experience leading the design, development, and deployment of business software at scale or current hands on technology infrastructure, network, compute, storage, and virtualization experience
Azure Certifications
Preferred Expert /minimum associate-level Azure certified.
Azure Certified Solutions Architect
Azure Certified Developer/ DevOps Engineer

job_title: Consultant - Advertising, Marketing and Commerce (Salesforce Marketing Cloud) - SG
job_description:
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Whatever your aspirations, Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.
Work you will do

This role sits within the Customer and Marketing (C&M) team of Deloitte Southeast Asia, which is a part of Deloitte that uses technology and creativity to better connect the customer with the business.
Better known as Deloitte Digital, we use emergent technology to imagine, deliver, and run entirely new business futures. We create innovative ventures, digital platforms, and more meaningful experiences.

As part of Advertising Marketing and Commerce (AMC), you will work with the team to help our clients optimize their Digital Marketing initiatives, leveraging data, technology and marketing strategy.
You will:
Bring Salesforce Marketing Cloud technical & product expertise to deliver best-in-class marketing automation solutions to clients.
Be part of dynamic client team that will be responsible for driving marketing automation solutions at a client site.
Leading the solution design process with Marketing Cloud including building journeys, writing queries, building data extensions, writing AMPScripts and knowledge of SSJS.
Debug campaign automation solutions as well as maintaining and troubleshooting in-flight solutions.
Assist in the design of marketing automation programs including triggered sends, automation activities, platform configuration, multi-channel integrations, audience segmentation, and other components needed for marketing campaigns.
Partner with project teams to design solutions for cross-platform interaction and create data models with CRM/service platforms to pass engagement data back and forth.
Assist with the implement of marketing automation & CRM solutions and provide recommendations that drive results for client campaigns and larger business objectives.
Solve challenging business problems creatively, efficiently, and independently, especially when faced with time and operational constraints or ambiguity.
Deliver on multiple initiatives in the same time frame with minimal supervision.
Enough about us, let's talk about you


If you are someone with:
Bachelor's Degree
3+ years of experience in digital marketing campaign execution and/or marketing automation/CRM experience
Salesforce Development/Customizations (APEX, Visual Force) experience
2+ years developing and integrating Marketing Cloud with different Salesforce applications
2+ years of experience with REST, Salesforce, database and SFTP connectors
Preferably to have Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist & Salesforce Marketing Cloud Consultant Certifications
Experience in implementing marketing automation platforms & integration with CRM/service platforms
Experience with other marketing technologies and analytics tools (i.e. Adobe, Oracle, Sprinklr, Google, etc.)
Ability to learn fast & work in a face paced, dynamic work environment
Good understanding of Web Services (SOAP & REST), XML and JSON formats document schemas
Knowledge of AMPScript, SSJS

Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
tech_stack: Scalability  Azure  Cloud Computing  Vmware  Vblock  Google Cloud Platform  Saas  Virtualization  CRM  Customer Experience  experimentation  Customer Contact  Sales Engineering  Advocacy  Audit
job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life.
The role: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
Our team inspires leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like G Suite, Search, and Chrome. You reach out proactively to show customers how Google Cloud solutions can help them become more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
Additional Role Description:
The Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales team focuses on business development in relation to small and medium-sized businesses, a critical segment for the Cloud business. The Sales team's priority is to maximize business growth from the SMB segment, predominantly through strategic pitching and advocacy, and cultivation of partners. The team also participates in research and experimentation with data-driven, scalable solutions intended to improve conversion rate and customer lifetime value.
As a Sales Representative focused on the Indonesian Market, you are an expert blend of sales, technology and strategy. Much of your time will be spent talking with customers, discussing and advocating for the value of Google Cloud solutions, particularly Google Workspace. In addition to having a passion for sales, you also possess analytical and creative skills. As you talk with many customers and partners each month, you will have ideas for how we can improve our product or enhance the customer experience.
In this role, you will manage new initiatives or experiments, while also using your ability to manage stakeholders across many different functional teams in order to execute quickly and to drive success. You will also work to develop the business growth of your assigned territory through campaigns, partner development and marketing events.
Responsibilities:
- Manage opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary. Serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption-related activities.
- Deliver against assigned strategic goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our customers.
- Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
- Work with our Sales Engineers and trusted Google Cloud Partners as a critical member of the Sales team in order to maximize business results and to cultivate opportunities with small and medium businesses.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience discussing platform and infrastructure-as-a-service
- Experience with the cloud computing market.
- Educate and advocate for Google and our products when presenting to Bahasa-speaking clients and agencies on new products, campaign results, and performance.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce.com). Demonstrated track record in reaching and exceeding strategic goals in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products.
- Technical or Sales Engineering experience in Computer Science or Information Systems.
- Technically minded, with an in-depth understanding of the technology and cloud computing market, and a passion for Google Cloud products (Workspace, Google Cloud Platform).
- Ability to build influential relationships and to deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
- Ability to effectively operate with enthusiasm and flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.

job_description:
We invite highly motivated, dynamic professionals to join our growing ITS Global Team.
ITS Global (Information Technology Services Global) is one of the four pillars within KPMG's Global Technology & Knowledge (GT&K) group. We provide innovative components that KPMG's business functions and Member Firms use to deliver state-of-the-art client-facing solutions. It also provides the information-protection and technology infrastructure that secures KPMG's technology environment and connects its network of member firms. We work with the other pillars in the GT&K group to provide technology solutions that leverage world-leading partnerships and disruptive digital capabilities, and that provide access to the firm's collective intelligence.
KPMG uses Microsoft Azure and with a highly skilled cloud workforce has successfully embraced cloud transformation journey and endeavors to continually evolve in this space.
The Cloud Enterprise DevOps Sr Engineer is well rounded in Azure IaaS and PaaS offerings and will form part of the team that owns the KPMG AKS Production environment. You will work with other teams and vendors to improve our Operations environment. You must have a strong background in Azure Kubernetes Services and Linux; and have solid automation experience with either PowerShell and/or Python. Agile experience preferred..

The role involves:
Managing and supporting the Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) environment
Supporting Azure Iaas & Paas Products
Using Site Reliability Principals, increase Observability in the environment (Azure Monitor, SCOM, Dashboarding)
Ability to build constructive working relations across the different teams, functions, cultures, & genders
Deliver high-quality products and exceptional service that provide value and exceed client expectations
Demonstrate KPMG behavior and values: Integrity, Excellence, Courage, Together, For Better.
Ability to interact professionally with a wide range of customers ranging from end-users and IT staff to management and external service providers.

The ideal candidate should possess:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or an equivalent experience in the related discipline.
Strong Azure DevOps knowledge (+3 yrs): CI/CD Pipelines, Repositories, Boards, YAML
Strong understanding of Kubernetes / AKS in a Production environment
Solid recent experience building and supporting Iaas and Paas solutions in a cloud environment
Strong scripting capability in one or more of: PowerShell, Phyton, Bash, etc.
Should possess at least AZ-104, AZ-204 and AZ-400 certifications.
Ability to analyze situations rigorously, logically, and systematically
Must possess a solid understanding of Linux OS and Windows OS.
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, PowerShell Desired State - DSC).
Able to clearly articulate the importance and expectations regarding support work and results, impact, time effort and timelines to team member, vendors, and KPMG management
Proven ability to dynamically prioritize work efforts to meet deadlines and work effectively with minimal supervision in a team environment and to diagnose interrelationships between data center facility, network, server, and application issues.
Experience in managing small projects
Understands Agile Framework
Good understanding of Site Reliability Engineering Principals: e.g., Monitoring, Release Automation, Eliminate Toil.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

At KPMG in Singapore we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, gender identity or expression, colour, marital status, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or other non-merit factors. We celebrate the different talents that our people bring and support every staff member in their journey to achieve personal and professional growth. One of the ways we do this is through Take Charge: Flexi-work, our flexible working framework which enables agile and innovative teams to help deliver our business goals.

Job Description :
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for hands on technical architects to help accelerate our growing Application Modernisation business. As an expert, you'll help them make decisions on their cloud journey which will ultimately disrupt their business. This role combines thought leadership across the globe with cutting code, designing architectures, and helping our customers build system components as they modernise and build new applications in the cloud.

AWS Professional Services engages in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, spanning diverse technologies across multiple industries. The Application Modernization Practice collaborates across the entire AWS organization to deliver the best solutions for customers, connect with AWS product and service teams, and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs. As trusted customer advocates, the Practice helps organisations understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate and/or re-develop existing workloads in the cloud. You will help shape, execute, and deliver solutions for a broad range of customer use cases primarily from large enterprise customers.

In this role as an experienced Application Architect, you will work with our customers in architecting, developing and re-engineering applications that can fully leverage the AWS Cloud. We are looking for hands on architects/developers who are passionate about:
. Helping customers architect scalable, highly available application solutions that leverage AWS services
. Architecting and developing customer applications to be cloud optimized
. Working as a technical leader alongside cross functional teams of customer business, development and infrastructure teams
. Providing deep software development knowledge with respect cloud architecture, design patterns and programming
. Advising and implementing AWS best practices
. Working as both an infrastructure and application development specialist
. Implementing DevOps practices such as infrastructure as Code, Continuous Integration and Automated Deployment.
Basic Qualifications :
. Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer's environment and drive discussions with technical personnel regarding design, development and architecting best practices
. Strong practical application development experience on Linux and Windows-based systems
. IT consulting experience as a technical specialist in enterprise CIO / CTO customer-facing roles
. Hands-on experience in design/implementation/consulting of distributed applications at scale
. Prior Leadership experience in leading engineering or technical teams
. Strong practical application development experience on Linux and Windows-based systems
. Strong technical acumen, including the ability to understand the customer or partner IT landscape, identify opportunities and overcome any technical obstacles, ultimately influencing the adoption of AWS platform in conjunction with business requirements
. Strong leadership capabilities, having the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse set of customers or partners, across multiple disciplines.
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience working directly with customers, partners or third-party developers
. Architecting, designing and developing applications on the AWS platform
. Designing and building applications using Container and serverless technologies
. Good exposure to Agile software development and DevOps practices such as Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Continuous Integration and automated deployment
. Continuous Integration (CI) tools (e.g. Jenkins)
. Experience with configuration management platforms (e.g. Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible).
