About Us
Ready to build So arewe.Come join VMware's exciting Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU) Team, made up of products and services under the Tanzu portfolio to help customers build, run and manage their most important applications. We build applications with velocity to run in a cloud-native environment, run Kubernetes and Cloud Foundry with consistency, and manage our customers entire footprint with confidence to help them achieve their business outcomes.To learn more about Tanzu watch this#TeamTanzu
AboutYou
You are unique: as an exceptional, passionate, customer facing, hands-on Solution Architect you will help customers transform to realize the benefits of modern applications and architectures on the VMware Tanzu portfolio. You will also work closely with the Tanzu engineering and Solution Engineer (SE) teams to transform the way our customers build and run their software. You are a problem solver and the thought of collaborating with a team to help companies transform to meet the challenges of tomorrow excites you.

The Team
At VMware we believe that Kubernetes, and by extension Modern Applications, will transform the next generation of enterprise infrastructure and applications the way Virtualisation and Java have in the past. Customers are looking to containers to avoid lock in with public clouds and the industry has aligned around Kubernetes as the orchestration enginefor these containers. The complete Tanzu portfolio consists of products and services that transform how enterprises build and operate modern applications on Kubernetes. The Platform Services team helps customers derive the value of Tanzu technology to deliver the benefits of container application platforms through DevSecOps.

What You'll Be Doing:

Executingon customer engagements both as a member of a team for complex engagements and solo for engagements

Drivingplatform adoption by working with application teams to embrace modern practices around developer workflow, application enhancements, build and packaging, application lifecycle, and observability

Deploying and operationalising platforms built on Kubernetes by designing for storage integration, container networking, service routing, observability, and platform security

Promote the adoption of automation techniques and DevSecOps practices to improve the infrastructure and software life cycle including infrastructure and application uptime, availability, and time-to-market

Participate in mentoring and knowledge transfer to your customers

Support a written culture and contribute to our technical content library

Serve asan effective member of the broader Open Source and Modern Applications ecosystem, contributing to Kubernetes SIG's, Meetups and similar

Work effectively with a remote and distributed team

REQUIRED SKILLS / EXPERIENCE

2+ years experience with design and implementation of distributed systems architectures on private or public cloud infrastructure

2+ years of experience designing container-based solutions and DevOps

5+ years of experience in consulting, pre-sales function.

Robust proficiency in Linux & CLIwith3+years of experience in VM infrastructure

Understanding ofthe latestcloud trends and best practices, including Cloud-Native, DevSecOps and infrastructure-as-code principles

Experience in a customer-facing capacity, support, or consulting role

Strong written and oral communication skills

Ability to travel approximately 50%

PREFERREDor HELPFULSKILLS / EXPERIENCE

Experience presenting to small and large audiences (Executives, Management & Developers)

Experience with cloud service provider offerings like Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

The ideal candidate will have familiarity with virtualisation technologies such as Hyper-V, vSphere, and vCenter.

It would be crucial if you had experience implementing a continuous integration (CI) or continuous development (CD) pipeline.

job_description:

Security certifications like CISSP, CCSP, CISM, CISA, SANS (at least 1)
Strategy
Review the implementation of controls to improve Security posture for Cloud Native applications (including but not limited to microservices based architecture) conforming to the Bank's Global Information Security Policies and Standards
Work with various security service lines, product owners and Public Cloud Infrastructure services providers to evaluate various security solutions to be implemented for the Bank's cloud and container environments
Business
Create seamless development experience for our developers working with application and engineering team
Facilitate the implementation of container platform services with adequate security
Provide guidance on implementation of container service designs conforming to Global Information Security Policies and Standards
Processes
Responsible for building and operationalizing security review of Cloud Native and Containerized Applications utilizing Public Cloud Infrastructure (IaaS and PaaS services from AWS and Azure) as well on-premise microservice based platforms
Perform the Threat Modelling for critical Cloud Applications, including Crown Jewels, using MITRE ATT&CK Framework or STRIDE as applicable.
Support internal and external audits
Support cloud delivery teams in building security controls delivered as code
Support security architecture and design reviews for Cloud Native applications, including microservices based architecture
Support the validation of service design implementation for containerized and non-containerized services
Support the review and onboarding of security monitoring use cases for various security events
Have a good understanding of Network Connectivity for Hybrid and Multi-Cloud environments
Have good understanding of Cloud and On-premise Network Patterns, resiliency models, and high availability
Have a good understanding of end to end Network Security for defence in depth
People and Talent
Provide thought leadership in supporting the Bank's cloud security requirements and providing suitable solutions
Risk Management
This role has key responsibility for continuous improvements in the Domain(s)s approach to risk identification and mitigation, control management and audit engagement within the framework set out by the relevant authorities.
Governance
Process includes the procedures and protocols on Domain Risk Meetings, MOM Templates, Audit Engagements, Risk Approvals, Risk Extensions, Risk Assessments and Risk reviews done by UORM's and ensure consistency across domains.
Maintain central data pertaining to Applications Support Risk & Control.
Ensure Awareness of Rules of Engagement w.r.t Risk Management to all PSS Managers, stakeholders either directly or through UORM's and Leadership to ensure consistency across domains Work with internal and external auditors support auditing requirements
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.

job_description:
DESCRIPTION/RESPONSIBILITIES:
Our customers, clients and communities matter to us at JPMC, and we recognize that in order to deliver a first class service, it's our people that do this, without exception, in a first class way.
There's never been a more exciting time to work in Technology; and with our investment in Digital and Cloud native technologies, at JMPC we want to give talented people like you, an opportunity to work with us at the leading edge.
The teams we build are as diverse and culture rich as the communities we serve and we consider that to be a foundation stone for our thriving working environment.
We're really excited to be expanding our Production Management team in Singapore, and we're looking for hands on full stack minded engineers from all technical disciplines who are commercial, intellectually curious, customer obsessed, and love solving complex problems. In return we'll help you expand your skills as you'll be working as part of a Global team, supporting an innovative cloud based technology platform for the firm.
As part of JPMorgan Chase & Co.s global team of technologists and innovators, your work will have a massive impact, both on us as a company, as well as our clients and our business partners around the world.
Responsibilities:
Working alongside our team of technologists from around the world, you will become a member of our expanding Global Production Management function supporting dedicated lines of business for the firm.
It is our passion to collaborate with our colleagues who are developing our technology platforms to deliver legendary service in a secure, value-adding, scalable and resilient way. This means with your deep knowledge of product design, development, coding, analytics, cyber security and chaos engineering, we'll bring out the best in you to help solve complex and mission critical problems, internally and externally.
In practical terms, this means supporting the platform on a day to day basis at an infrastructure, application and customer journey level.
We do this proactively through regular failure mode analysis and chaos testing, supporting change development and delivery through the CI/CD pipeline and reactively through eyes on glass, incident and problem management whilst constantly looking for opportunities to drive forward automation and improvements.
We also Own and drive incident management bridge calls and chats with application development, infrastructure teams, and senior leadership with the purpose of remediating customer impacting incidents quickly. Production Management establishes strong command and control of an Incident, establishing clear accountability and methodical evaluation of complex issue scenarios.
We provide competent and reliable adherence to critical process and procedure, and appropriate escalations in support of production incidents. Applying technical and environmental knowledge and experience to develop and drive appropriate work streams, forming paths to resolution.
We are also responsible for the distribution of clear and concise communications, summarizing incidents and the business/customer experience to a wide group of technical and non-technical audiences.
Core Requirements:
Minimum 5 years of experience within a technology environment is required
Minimum Bachelor's degree preferably in Engineering or Information Technology
Demonstrated ability in command center operations and incident management
Proven ability to lead with influence, work calmly under pressure, and collaborate with colleagues throughout the firm, to deliver for our customers and clients
Proven experience of working with ITIL disciplines, (Event, Incident, Problem, Change & CSI) ideally in Financial Services context.
Major Incident Management Experience
Extensive customer service and client interaction skills
Experience conducting root cause analysis, documenting findings, and designing plans to rectify production issues
Possess critical thinking and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to think and act independently to resolve production issues.
Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills necessary to work effectively with a variety of individuals and organizations
Working knowledge and experience with cloud-based technologies and solutions including but not limited to; AWS, GCP and Azure, with experience in the following AWS-based technologies:
+ EC2
+ S3
+ RDS
+ EKS
+ Route 53
+ AWS Networking and Routing
+ IAM
+ Amazon KMS
Exposure to modern database technologies including CockroachDB is desirable.
Working knowledge of cloud-native monitoring platforms including:
+ Prometheus
+ Thanos
+ Grafana
+ ElasticSearch
Able to work a 12 hour shift pattern as determined by the hiring manager (work schedule will include a weekend).
Secondary Skills
Experience and knowledge of any of the following would be an advantage:
Financial Services products, services and the digital and mobile technologies used to deliver them.
Working in an SRE construct
Agile and DevOps principles
Service Level and Vendor Management
Highly available, high scalable application/service/database support
Architecture, design and business processes
Application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines
Service Management tools such as ServiceNow and related processes
Distributed Tracing, particularly the OpenTracing standards and associated technology stack (Jaeger etc.)
Financial control and budget management
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech organizations. In our global technology centers, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.

Designs, analyzes, plans and modifies internal company networks. Ensures optimum integration level of software products, infrastructure, and data based on business needs, communications systems, and evolving technologies. Develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods.

Provides technical expertise in the management of company networks; tests and analyzes network facilities, including network control software, routers, switches, lines, modems, adapters and servers.

job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At foodpanda, we're on a mission to redefine how technology, food, people and culture all connect across the 150 cities and 12 countries we operate in. Our Tech & Product teams are working on big challenges and complex scalability problems that come with processing upwards of 500 million orders annually. You'll play a key role within highly collaborative, cross-functional and agile squads comprised of frontend, backend and mobile engineers, in partnership with design and product owners.
Our tribes and squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment, with flat structures where everyone has a say. We are building large scale and complex systems where you can impact users on a global level whilst enjoying autonomy to influence within a flexible working environment. Here you can learn, thrive and grow to become a better engineer, designer or product manager.
Product Analytics Manager, APAC
We are looking for a Senior / Product Analytics Manager, APAC to join the product organisation that builds and scales the consumer-facing platform used by some of our most successful brands (foodpanda, foodora, mjam among others). The product team is split between Berlin and Singapore and is organised as cross-functional tribes that focus on different aspects of our user experience. This role is a leadership position within the analytics team that supports the tribes (Marketing & Partnerships, New Business etc.) in Singapore.
What's on the menu:
Lead a team of analysts supporting your domain; manage their motivation, growth and performance
Work with data engineering, experimentation, data scientists and other technical counterparts in optimising analytics infrastructure and simplifying workflows
Build strong working relationships with all key functional leads (Design, Engineering, Product, UX Research) for your domain
Support your analysts in delivering high quality work products; build and maintain the credibility of the analytics team as a key partner in product development
Work with senior product leadership to shaping product strategy, refine requests and understand how analytics can support in driving a lot of these initiatives
Educate product and business stakeholders on analytics/experimentation best-practices and contribute to data-based decision-making
Combine quantitative and qualitative insight to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why.
What you can bring to the table:
You love to learn, are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You help team members to grow in their career path and help guide individuals towards achieving their goals
8+ years experience in the Analytics space in fast-paced and dynamic environments, with at least some experience directly managing teams
You should love engaging people across the company at all levels with your enthusiasm for making positive change
Demonstrated experience with scientific methods in statistics, physics, economics, mathematics, data science or similar.
Solid experience in analysis and data wrangling skills, ideally in a big data ecosystem - SQL, python/R
Good to have:
Google Analytics - mastery in other tracking technologies can be used as an alternative (e.g. Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different backgrounds in an international environment.
Experience with BigQuery and Google Cloud Platform
Good english communication skills
About foodpanda
foodpanda (small f) is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology, efficiency and simplicity as much as we do, there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.
We always genuinely care about experience, efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda's operations with the best tools on hand.

tech_stack: Osi Model  Cloud Security  Scripting  Customer Success  Pci Dss  Ipsec  Troubleshooting  Technical Customer Support  Customer Relationship Management  Cross Functional Relationships  Excellent Interpersonal Communication Skills
job_description:
About Us
At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.
We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!
Job Description
As an Onboarding Consultant (OC), you will be the technical lead starting from the project kick-off until the customer is fully utilizing their contracted products and services. You will oversee and support technical implementation tasks for new and existing customers. You are a product expert and will leverage your knowledge to ensure our Enterprise customers understand and utilize the Cloudflare platform to its fullest extent. Your goal is to help customers be successful and derive the most value possible from their Cloudflare investment.
As an OC, you strive to understand customer requirements and issues at the molecular level. No matter your background, you have a natural curiosity to uncover a customer's use case and help navigate to the most elegant and efficient solution. Fundamentally, you are enamored with how the internet works.
In addition, you will serve as the project manager of the onboarding experience and work closely with every other team at Cloudflare, from Sales and Product to Engineering and Customer Support. Customer success will drive you through the entire organization as you seek out and implement scalable solutions for your customer's needs.
Responsibilities
As a critical member of the Customer Success team you will be responsible for onboarding new customers, additional products for existing customers and customers who come to us when their applications and networks are being attacked
You will be part of a global team and will work closely with Sales and Customer Success
From a technical perspective, your primary responsibilities will be to deliver a timely and organized onboarding for customers through effective project management, ensure customers see the full value in Cloudflare's products, and advise on technical best practices
Position the customer for future retention and expansion through a successful onboarding experience
Provide customers with clear proactive technical guidance and expertise across all our products
Collaborate with Customer Support, Engineering, and other teams to assist with technical escalations during onboarding
Contribute towards the success of the CSE organization through knowledge-sharing activities such as contributing to internal and external documentation, answering technical Q&A, and helping iterate on best practices
The role requires up to 50% travel to attend conferences, and other industry events, meet with customers when required and to collaborate with your Cloudflare teammates (post-COVID)
Experiences might include a combination of the skills below:
5-8 years of prior post-sales customer relationship management
Deep understanding of how the internet works and the desire to expand that knowledge. For example:Layers and protocols of the OSI model, such as TCP/IP, TLS, DNS, HTTP
Reverse and forward proxies and the applications of both
Security aspects of an internet property, such as Firewalls, WAFs, Bot Management, Rate Limiting, (M)TLS, Zero Trust
Performance aspects of an internet property, such as Speed, Latency, Caching, HTTP/2, TLSv1.3
Enjoying the adventure of troubleshooting and solving technical problems
Understanding why Cloudflare plays an increasingly important role on today's internet
Demonstrated experience with:Software distribution in Microsoft, Mac and Linux environments
Software distribution via Mobile Device Management platforms
Deep understanding of SSO, ADFS, LDAP and SAML
Deep understanding of the role of the IDP for SSO
Experience working with Forward Proxy, Content Filtering & DLP solutions
Windows & Linux server system administration
Familiarity with IPSec and SSL/TLS VPN appliance & services
Security skills and certifications: CISSP, GCIA GCIH, GCFA, GCFE, etc.
Ability to proactively identify and solve problems then build sustainable solutions to prevent recurrence
Demonstrated experience with a scripting language (e.g. Python, JavaScript, Bash) and a desire to expand those skills
Technical curiosity and passion: Cloudflare is at the cutting edge of internet technology, and our OCs are viewed as subject-matter experts. It's incumbent on us to stay up to date not only with Cloudflare's specific products, but with industry trends.
Ability to manage a project, work to deadlines, and prioritize between competing demands
Ability to work with all levels of an organization (both internally and externally) with experience of both working cross-functionally and geographically.
Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills.
Highly motivated, driven and passionate about technology and customer success.
Bonus!
Understanding of, or experience with, regulatory requirements such a PCI DSS, HIPAA, and SOC-2
What Makes Cloudflare Special
We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.
Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.
Athenian Project: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.
Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.
1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.
Sound like something you'd like to be a part of We'd love to hear from you!
This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.
Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.
Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at [HIDDEN TEXT] or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

We are seeking proven sales performers to help us grow our loyal customer base for our Commercial division. This is a role for someone who is a hunter and hungry for new business success. Responsibilities include generating new business in new accounts and also expanding the footprint inside existing customers, as well as playing a key role as you drive strategic CRM initiatives for our customers. This is a role for someone who can see the value of Cloud Computing and who can be a combination salesperson and evangelist to get the Salesforce penetration into the sector growing even more. On top of your own business development, we provide a range of support functions to help create and drive opportunities from internal sales support to highly skilled pre-sales so it is not just you against the world.

Responsibilities:
Developing and managing relationships within our Commercial segment focusing on customers in Vietnam.
Managing complex sales-cycles and presenting to C-level executives the value of our enterprise suite of applications.
Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement in Salesforce while creating satisfied and reference-able customers.
Demonstrating our product via the Web.
Requirements:
5-8 years of experience carrying quota and closing deals in software (business applications preferred) or technology sales.
Extensive experience selling to customers in Vietnam.
Consistently over-achieved quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions.
Successful track-record managing complex deals from lead to close.
Must speak highly fluent Vietnamese as this person will be selling to customers in Vietnam.
Desired Skills
Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communications skills.
Previous Sales Methodology training preferred.
CRM experience preferred.
Ability to work in a fast pace, team environment.
Strong customer references.
Strong computer skills, including CRM, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel

job_description:
About Infosys:
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.
Short Description:
If your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for you.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Senior Support Analyst with Cloud Migration (Application migration to Cloud) so need expert in Production Support with Cloud Migration experience
Your role :
A technically brilliant application support analyst who is passionate about delivering high quality application services to the
Application Migration and Deployment to Cloud environment ( Azure or AWS )
Take part in Major Incident Management, Problem Management and Request Management
utilize their IT and business skills to interact with internal and external clients
support the Service & Product Manager across several technical domains
uphold high standards for timely issue resolution
contribute expertise to the management of existing and new IT products and services
optimize the service issues and gaps and implement service quality
Optimize operational procedures to improve efficiency, reduce time to restore and minimize costs
Perform the full spectrum of Production Support responsibilities, based on the ITIL Framework: Incident and Problem Management, Release Management, Risk Management
Incident Management: Ability to assess the impact and urgency, diagnose the application issues using logs, coordinate with relevant teams to resolve the incidents, keep the stake holders updated with the progress.
Problem Management: Ability to deep-dive into the recurring issues and find the root cause by analysing the log files, symptoms, timing, etc. Ability to articulate and influence the development team, infrastructure team and others to provide a solution to fix the root cause and prevent the recurrence of issues.
Change Management: Well versed with ITIL processes , procedures and ability to act as a strong gate keeper to the production environment. We expect the person to be able to assess the changes from all dimensions impact, risk, performance and help to implement the changes in a controlled manner
Business Continuity Management: Understand the purpose of BCM, participate in BCM tests, experience in handling real time fail over activities.
1.Skills /Competencies:
a.Essential Skills:
Minimum 10 years of work experience in IT with experience in Service Delivery Transition i.e. Cloud Migration
Minimum 2 years of experience in any cloud technologies (preferably in AWS / Azure)
Experience in Technology Production Support processes (ITIL)
Expertise in open system technologies (Unix / Linux, Database)
Good understanding of banking domain
b.Additional Skills:
Automation and efficiency Improvement : A person who is passionate about the new tools ( SPLUNK, APPDYNAMIC, etc.), technologies ( Unix, Oracle, Java, Informatica etc.), and processes ( ITIL, DevOps, Agile) and adopt them in the working environment to increase the efficiency and effectiveness.
Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender or other attribute covered by equal opportunity legislation.

Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. All recruitment activity must be coordinated through the Talent Acquisition department.
All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About Our Client
Our client is a well-established organisation within the technology solutions space. They are looking to hire a Cloud Data Engineer to partner with the technical stakeholders for the successful delivery of large-scale projects.
Job Description
As a Cloud Data Engineer, you will be responsible for the following:
Designing and building data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines using either cloud services (AWS/GCP/Azure) or using open-source tools (like Airflow and Python)
Designing, implementing, and supporting an Enterprise Data platform (Data Lake, Data Warehouse, etc.) that can provide ad-hoc access to large scale structured, semi-structured, and/or unstructured datasets

Participating in project planning; identifying milestones, deliverable and resource requirements tracks activities and task execution
The Successful Applicant
As a successful candidate you will have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent with at least 5+ years of working experience in using cloud data lake, data warehouse and databases services like Azure Data Lake, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Cosmos DB, AWS S3, AWS RedShift, etc.

You will also be familiar with ETL and data streaming pipeline like Kafka, Informatica, Talend, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, AWS Kinesis, etc. You will have hands on experience with one or more of the follow scripting languages: Python, SQL, Kafka and/or other

job_description:
Globally we throw away about 1.6 billion tons or 1/3 of all the food we produce. At Lumitics, we believe that we're called to be guardians and good stewards of what has been given to us Mother Earth. That is why we are passionate about helping kitchens leverage on technology to reduce their food waste, cost and environmental footprint. We need to save today to save tomorrow.
We are looking for a driven, self-motivated computer vision engineer who wishes to work on meaningful products for good and take Lumitics to the next level.
A Computer Vision Engineer is responsible for building and maintaining Lumitics food waste image recognition system. Their duties include researching to design, build and optimise the image recognition system using different computer vision techniques and to monitor and maintain the system to ensure a high prediction accuracy.
Roles and Responsibilities
Research, design, build, evaluate, and deploy computer vision applications (classification/detection) of deep learning models for food waste detection.
Training and fine-tuning models to address business problems.
Develop image processing pipeline and model evaluation tools to be used for model training, data analysis and visualization.
Work closely with the software and client success teams to manage deployment/retraining of models
Be able to communicate to the management team the theoretical concepts and approaches used, implementation plan and timeline
Must keep up to date with the latest computer vision and machine learnings related research and techniques
Skills And Qualifications
Education level: PhD/Masters or bachelor's degree relevant to computer science, statistics, or fields related to Machine learning and computer vision
Experience: 2 years of relevant experience.
Hands-on experience with TensorFlow/Keras or any other relevant deep learning libraries
Thorough knowledge in Python, OpenCV, Numpy, Matplotlib
Have hands-on experience in implementing CNNs/GANs/FasterRCNN models
Knowledge in git, docker, google cloud platform (or any other platform)
Knowledge of few-shot learning/representation learning will be a plus
Personal Characteristics
Team player
Self-motivated
Fast learner
Takes initiative

job_title: Technical Solutions Specialist, Hybrid Cloud, Google Cloud - Singapore
tech_stack: Kubernetes  Cloud Computing  Vblock  Google Cloud Platform  Web Technologies  Logging  Networking  System Administration  Debugging  Virtualization  security clearance  Troubleshooting  Web Developers  Articulate  Disposition  Brand Awareness
job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Technical Solutions Specialist, Hybrid Cloud, Google Cloud - Singapore
The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You swiftly problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Google Cloud business and in bringing our product portfolio into companies around the world.
Additional Role Description:
The Hybrid Cloud services team is building a new offering for Google Cloud customers that require more than just break/fix support. We assist with the entire hardware/software lifecycle, including planning, deployment, maintenance, upgrading, monitoring, and capacity planning. Our services are especially crucial for hybrid customer engagements where Google Cloud is delivering and maintaining infrastructure inside the customer's on-premises environment. These deployments can incorporate requirements such as disconnected mode, security clearance, sovereign and geographical constraints.
This is a customer facing role; you must enjoy working directly with customers.
You will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and when needed, coding/scripting. You will help drive the success of Google Cloud by understanding and advocating for our customers issues. This will include a need to sometimes work non-standard work hours or shifts. This will include a rotation on weekend work.
Responsibilities:
- Manage the customer's problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of new investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on Google Cloud Platform products.
- Develop an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis.
- Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in engineering, sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.
- Work as part of a team of engineers/consultants that globally ensure 24 hour customer support. This will include a need to sometimes work non-standard work hours or shifts.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience configuring and troubleshooting Kubernetes infrastructure
- Experience with networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, Routing, VPNs, VLANs, Peering, Load Balancing, etc.)
- Experience with web technologies (HTTP, HTML, DNS, etc.)
Preferred qualifications:
- Have Government G50 Security Clearance with industry experience working in Government, dealing with sensitive/classified workloads.
- Experience working directly in a customer facing role
- Experience with any of the following IaaS solutions: system virtualization, on-premise and/or hybrid cloud computing, cloud identity and security system, cloud monitoring and logging and/or local and cloud storage.
- Excellent attention to detail, troubleshooting, and written and verbal communication skills.

job_description:
Dell Technologies unites technology leaders - Dell, Dell EMC, Secureworks, Virtustream and VMware - in one company with the power to drive digital transformation and generate real results every day for the customers and people who partner with us.

VMware combines platform, tools, and methodology to help the world's largest companies transform the way they build software and run their most strategic applications. Our technology is used by Global 2000 companies and developers to give software development and IT operations a strategic advantage.

You
Responsible to challenge the status quo in enterprise software ecosystem using modern cloud-native techniques, technologies, and mindsets.
Have expertise in leading organisation change and keen to drive the next wave of cloud-native applications.
Have extensive knowledge of the Singapore and regional landscape to level up the cloud-native knowledge and skills of our partners and clients, including container orchestration systems, devops adoption, and microservices architectures.

Above all, have a customer-focused mindset and are able to drive thought in the modern applications field.
Has a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive customer interest in Dell Technologies and VMware.

Us
There is a paradigm shift towards cloud-native technologies and methodologies calling for new capabilities. As part of Dell Technologies, this initiative focuses on uplifting the Cloud Native Ecosystem in Singapore and enabling our enterprise customers in Singapore and the regional economies.
Your Day
Work with multiple stakeholders, including educational institutes, clients and partners in raising the level of cloud native knowledge and skills in Singapore and regionally.
Provide thought leadership in the cloud-native space, and present Dell Technologies/ VMware vision, strategy & product roadmaps to executives
Enrich the cloud native awareness communications, drive more value by creating engaging digital content, presentations, attestations, training rollouts, events and use of internal social media platforms , vendors, consultants and boutiques companies to bring new and creative ideas and energy to the program by staying current with the cloud native community
Conduct workshops and webinars to evangelise and promote the use and understanding of cloud-native technologies and techniques.
Deploy and measure effectiveness of cloud native awareness to a global audience, leveraging LMS, webcasts, and other technology.
Form complex communications / messages in a simple, clear and concise manner to the various communities within our organization. This can include different cultures, nationalities, international locations and languages.
Work with the wider cloud native team to assist on opportunities which fall outside primary responsibilities where required.

Requirements
Minimum of 8 years of experience (preferably 10+).
Strong networks and relationships in the education space, including institutes of higher learning and training institutes.
Bachelor's degree or higher, and be fluent in spoken and written English (business level).
Ability to work closely with customers and partners and deal with them in a professional manner
Demonstrated ability to think creatively while accounting for multiple perspectives and stakeholders in any given scenario.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to produce clear and detailed pre-sales and technical documentation.
Strong presentation skills, able to articulate both the technical and business value propositions of proposed solutions.
Familiarity with public clouds: Microsoft, Amazon, Google Cloud

Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Preference will be given to individuals with working experience in DevOps and hybrid cloud operations. The eventual appointment will commensurate with relevant work experience.

Design and implement hybrid cloud platforms in accordance with corporate security guidelines.
Lead the internal IT teams in transitioning to adopt DevOps, automation, data analytics and other digital solution initiatives.
Develop and operate continuous integration and deployment pipelines for production systems.
Manage and support the delivery of in-house and outsourced IT projects and services.
Plan, design, implement, manage and maintain the server, storage and virtualized infrastructure deployed in the data centre.
Manage system availability, capacity, incident, problem resolution and asset lifecycle management.
Evaluate, recommend and acquire systems and products for the Institute.
Participate in developing and implementing business continuity and disaster recovery plans.
Qualification & Skills
A University Degree in Computer/Electronics Engineering or its equivalent.
2 to 3 years of working experience in DevOps automation, containerisation and orchestration.

job_description:
Job Title: Systems/Hybrid Cloud Engineer
Job Description
The Systems/Hybrid Cloud Engineer focuses on delivering secure, stable, efficient, reliable and scalable infrastructures. He/She supports the design, testing and implementation of routine installations, configuration and fine-tuning of hardware and software. He may lead important projects that require providing team members with instruction, guidance and advice. He resolves simple to complex issues and conducts fault analysis. He applies a critical and analytical approach to resolving technical problems. He works well with his team and is able to guide them to ensure infrastructure projects are well implemented.
He/She possesses a natural knack for investigating infrastructure related issues while taking a methodical approach towards performance monitoring. He/She maintains high standards of customer service and works well with his team. He/She must be passionate about helping customers in resolving their pain points and is natural of going above and beyond.
Responsibilities
In this role, you are expected to cover majority the following:
Responsible for the day-to-day operational aspects of systems administration to meet the business needs and service level.
Manage systems changes through change request process & provide status reports to the relevant parties.
Provide 1st and 2nd level operational systems support.
Assist and respond promptly to incident, investigate & provide temporary &/or permanent resolution of incidents escalated. Provide timely status updates to relevant parties.
Monitor & measure the performance & availability of systems proactively; implement corrective actions identified to improve performance & availability.
Monitor the agreed service level, document & maintain the configuration of the systems; provide regular reporting to relevant parties.
Ensure service level meet requirement. Propose and implement action plan when required.
Monitor systems according to standard operations procedures.
Involve in the implementation of service continuity measures, i.e., backup/restore procedures & disaster recovery plan, to ensure continuous operation of the business.
Deliver Hyperconverged Infrastructure (HCI), Public and Private Cloud infrastructures.
Qualifications
To succeed with this role, you must have the required qualifications in the following:
At least 2 years of experience in Windows Server or Linux Server administration, hardening and fine-tuning - required
Good knowledge and experience in systems design and implementation - nice to have
Good knowledge and experience on implementing/managing backup and recovery solutions - required
Basic Networking knowledge - required
Experience in building and administering Microsoft AD, DNS, DHCP, ADCS, WSUS and Hyper-V - required
Experience in building and administering monitoring solutions - nice to have
Experience in building and administering Nutanix or VMware clusters - required
Experience supporting Singapore government agencies with security clearance - nice to have
Experience creating/using Infrastructure-as-Code - nice to have
Azure Administrator certification - required
AWS Solutions Architect - Associate certification - required
Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA) - nice to have
*We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Program Manager - Cloud Migration, Executive Director (92816)
tech_stack: Requirements Analysis  Software Development  Business Requirements  Leadership  Ability To Work Independently  Investment Banking  Securities  Strategy  Program Management  Compliance  Project Management  Attention To Detail  Internal Audit  Product Development  Scheduling
job_description:
We are continuing our journey focusing on applying a product mentality to the way we build our products and ensure that we focus on our clients and their needs to build the right product at the right time. This role will be responsible for working with engineers to accelerate our ongoing migration of hundreds and thousands of cores to the public cloud. The set of products comprise of lightweight custom containers and a control plane for providing of compute in the public cloud.
Your Impact
We are looking for an experienced program manager who will maintain close relationships with our users and engineering teams. This team manages highly reliable, cloud enabled core scheduling platforms, managed file transfer service, grid compute platform, software distribution service and stateless compute platforms. We adopt the most appropriate approach to drive the firm and our clients towards desired growth. We want to apply the same approach to the way we build products and deliver customer-centric, best-in-class products.
HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
You will be an experienced and seasoned program manager, working cross-functionally to guide programs from conception through launch, growth and maturity by connecting different technical worlds to meet our customers at their needs. You will break down complex problems into steps that drive product development and release adopting the principals of growth from MVP / PoC
This role offers a high profile opportunity to lead projects which involve various businesses and entities within the firm. You will have the opportunity to work with various teams in Technology, Securities, IMD, IBD, Technology Risk, Compliance and Internal Audit
This role requires an experienced professional with proven program management and program delivery skills. Strong communication skills are equally important, as the role will involve working closely with team members in many other groups in the firm
Managing the program end to end lifecycle from concept to design, PoC, testing, support and finally product end of life
Be a ruthless prioritiser while balancing the needs of customers and stakeholders while being transparent about your prioritization and roadmap process
Managing the initiation, planning, execution, monitor/control, and close out of workstreams
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
STEM degree and equivalent practical experience building/shipping technical programs
7+ years of technical program delivery experience, including experience driving the product vision, design, and go-to-market strategy
Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex problems and technical solutions to all stakeholders
Demonstrated success collaborating with design and engineering peers
Proven ability to influence cross-functional technical teams
Demonstrated experience in understanding the customer, product development, requirements analysis, planning and program strategy
Must have experience with managing client expectations and communicating effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization
Ability to translate business requirements into a product roadmap
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Highly organized, attention to detail and excellent follow through skills
Ability to work independently and with a team
Preferred Qualifications
Program management formal qualification
Solid technical foundation in software development and delivery
Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction

job_description:
About OneConnect Financial Technology
OneConnect is a fast-growing financial technology company, focusing on providing cloud computing and other technology services to small- and medium-sized financial institutions. OneConnect has developed world-class technology innovations in areas, such as facial recognition, voiceprint, micro-expression recognition, and blockchain. To date, OneConnect has served over 400 banks and over 2,000 non-bank financial institutions.
At OneConnect we've worked hard to create a culture that will challenge, excite, and support your professional development. With frequent team events, extensive mentoring and training, and collaboration opportunities you'll instantly become part of the well-respected sourced family. Providing a strong work/life balance is one of our core values and we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace with flexible working arrangements. We welcome discussion about how this role could be flexible for you.
About Us
We are a young fintech company located in Singapore.
The Singapore office is the regional office for a NYE-listed entity.
Role and Responsibilities
Reports to Head Legal and Head of Compliance and Internal Control with direct access to other key stakeholders or business partners.
Providing legal advice or opinion to the relevant stakeholders.
Reviewing, amending or drafting of business contracts and letters, where necessary.
Working hand-in-hand with other members in the Legal and Compliance team on any compliance or legal related matters in the Singapore office and related subsidiaries.
Handling, resolution and management of disputes, if need be.
Engagement and management of external counsel, if need be.
Review and amendment of existing legal or compliance policies.
Support in drafting and review of board of director resolutions, and other corporate secretariat related matters.
Requirements
LLB (Singapore or other common law jurisdictions preferred).
At least 4 to 5 years PQE either in private practice in a reputable law firm (disputes welcome) or as an in-house counsel in similar industry.
Keen interest in technological solutions and the fintech industry.
Strong initiative and motivation in working in a fast-paced, flexible, robust environment.
Possess business acumen grounded with a touch of practicality and pragmatism.
Prior exposure to various areas of law, regulations and polices including but not limited to the banking industry is a plus.
Analytical and logical with ability to work and make decisions under time pressure.
Ability to work in a team environment and possess leadership skills.

tech_stack: Big Data  Cloud Computing  Enterprise Architecture  Databases  Business Requirements  Customerfacing  Architect  Architectural  architects  Investment Banking  Private Equity  thought leadership  Hedge Funds  Consulting  acquisitions
job_description:
Job summary
Would you like to help the largest Private Equity (PE) firms and their portfolio companies leverage new technologies to improve their operations Would you like to use your IT leadership experience to build relationships with technical leaders, C-level executives, and influencers at all levels across the PE segment

As a Private Equity Solutions Architect, you will work directly with Private Equity firms, their portfolio companies, and consulting partners to help them adopt new technologies and build new solutions to make the most of the Cloud. You will be at the crossroads of business and technology, engaging with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. You will provide thought leadership in terms of looking beyond the technology and considering the value that technology creates for our customers. You will practice your creativity by linking technology to tangible solutions and business outcomes. You will educate PE firms and their portfolio companies about the art of the possible, defining and developing cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. You will have the opportunity to present publicly at AWS conferences and industry events.

The ideal candidate will possess a technical background that enables them to drive customer engagement with business, finance or IT executives at the highest levels of our PE customers. You will have experience working with complex IT environments including applications, middleware, storage, networks, information security, and operations. You will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of businesses

The Private Equity Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a balanced technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will develop deep expertise in AWS technologies, as well as a broad set of tools and methodologies of how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform.

At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of your customers. We value your passion to discover, invent, and build on behalf of customers. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones so you can make impactful contributions to architecture discussions with customers.

Amazon has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.

Key job responsibilities
As a Private Equity Solutions Architect, you will work directly with Private Equity Firms and/or executives of their portfolio companies to design technology solutions to solve specific business challenges or accelerate business initiatives.
Scoping and understand specific use cases to design appropriate AWS-based technical solutions (including, integrations with third party solutions).
Own the technical relationship with PE firms and the C-suite of portfolio companies and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
Serve as a key technical member of the AWS PE team to help ensure customer success in architecting, building, migrating, or optimizing applications and services on the AWS platform.
Build rapport with Executives at both PE firms and their portcos leveraging your understanding of enterprise architecture, merger and acquisitions, migration and cost optimisation of IT infrastructure and other key technologies
Establish technical credibility with PE firms and their portcos to lead discussions with CTOs, CIOs, Chief Architects, Senior Developers, etc. from both customer and partners across the PE segment.
Provide technical and architectural guidance to PE firms and their portcs and help develop cost optimisation strategies by deploying the right architecture given their budget constraints.
Evangelise and educate key stakeholders with the Private Equity ecosystem about AWS technologies.
Influence AWS's roadmap of new features and services based on customer feedback.
Create and capture best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organisation by hiring, coaching and mentoring others.
Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, related field OR equivalent technical work experience.
Experience working directly with customers (internal or external) in either technical pre-sales, post-sales, consulting, or customer support function.
7-10 years of experience as a technical leader architecting, building, consulting, and/or operating large scale distributed applications and infrastructure.
Willingness to travel to customer locations as needed
Passion for technology and for learning
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working in a customer-facing role interacting with senior levels stakeholders include C-suite.
Experience collaborating effectively with internal or external stakeholder groups (Customers, System Integrators, ISVs, etc.) at multiple levels.
Experience working in (or with) Private Equity firms, Hedge Funds, or Investment Banking specifically defining technology strategy or IT implementations/integrations related to Mergers and Acquisitions.
Working knowledge of cloud native architectures and experience architecting, developing, deploying, and/or operating IT applications or infrastructure on AWS services (or other related cloud computing technologies).
Broad technical knowledge of enterprise IT including: overall enterprise architecture, application development, database systems, server and desktop virtualisation, storage, data centre operations, networking, security, integrating enterprise applications etc.
Working knowledge in a technology domain, distributed web or mobile applications, DevOps, serverless, big data, analytics, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
Experience introducing cloud or new technologies to meet or exceed business requirements.
Experience presenting in one to many public forums.
AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional).
Continued or advanced learning (Master, MBA, PhD or equivalent) in Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics or related technical field.

job_description:
This role will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is rapidly expanding its presence in the enterprise arena with a focus on financial services. AWS offers global public cloud offerings with a diversity of compliance programs and attestations to enable AWS customer base. AWS is looking for independent, passionate, and deeply experienced professionals in the global financial services compliance and governance arena to provide thought leadership in assisting financial institutions to move regulated workloads and data into the cloud by addressing their specific security, regulatory, compliance and governance requirements. This candidate should be an experienced and innovative security/compliance/governance professional who has the ability to handle a wide range of compliance requirements and can translate those requirements into applications for cloud computing. The Compliance Specialist will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

This key position requires specialized experience supporting financial services sector compliance efforts and will have high visibility at the most senior levels of government agencies, institutions, and AWS including frequent interaction with CISOs, CTOs, CCOs, CROs, their staffs, and AWS senior leadership. The position, as part of the AWS Worldwide Financial Services team, will act as the primary Governance/Compliance interface for Financial Services institutions. The candidate will already have, and continue to foster, key relationships, and be able to interpret the impacts of policy changes, and track and report on industry trends.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participate in financial services regulatory compliance assessments and relevant control discussions with AWS teams. This includes synthesizing control requirements, and recommending and pursuing alternative approaches assisting customers in developing compliance roadmaps
Develop industry leading compliance related, customer-facing resources based on projected customer needs and current demand
Assist the AWS Security Assurance team in determining the strategic direction of the various AWS compliance programs based on customer interaction and demonstrative metrics
Be and remain connected with industry trends and events. Develop and maintain relationships with key leaders in governance, risk, and compliance at Financial Services institutions
Collaborate with service teams on industry specific requirements that impact components of AWS services
Assist the work of Financial Services institutions internal and external auditors or advisors as needed
Keep the AWS Worldwide Financial Services leadership team fully informed of customer engagement status, issues, and activities.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or other related business fields
Progressive experience in Financial Services compliance, legal, or governance
Personal, hands-on experience in developing compliance/regulatory documentation
Experience in working directly with senior corporate/government officials and/or auditors
Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must
Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Travel may be required for this role, up to 50%.





PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Familiarity with technical assessments and audit methodologies for technical systems (network, operating systems, application security) as well as IT auditing processes
Familiarity with cloud computing services/deployment architecture
Demonstration of innovative compliance approaches in non-traditional IT environments (cloud)
Experience and proficiency in public speaking
Deep understanding of relevant regulatory guidance Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP), National Institute for Science and Technology (NIST) guidelines, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), FCA guidance FG16/5 (Guidance for firms outsourcing to the cloud and other third party IT services), EBA Recommendations on Outsourcing to Cloud Providers, C5 requirements of the Federal Office of Information Security of Germany and other applicable standards and requirements
Experience in building successful compliance programs
Experience defining compliance roadmaps based on customer requirements, compliance documentation, and ensuring that committed assessments are delivered on schedule
Have a record of delivery of onboarding compliance financial services workloads
Intermediate or better level of knowledge of certification requirements of an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) under the aforementioned compliance programs
Ability to think critically and be responsive to time sensitive requests

job_description:
Are you passionate about leading strategic customers on their cloud adoption journey Do you have experience in building strategic partnerships with customers and partners in Southeast Asia (SEA) and have both a business and engineering background If so, this role may be the one for you.
Azure is the fastest-growing business in Microsoft's history and is the foundation of Microsoft's commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade Cloud that has a true hybrid story. Customers and analysts recognize Azure's tremendous momentum which continues month over month. To help customers achieve their goals, Azure continues to build the largest global footprint of any Cloud provider.
As we drive to be the leading cloud platform in the world, Azure Global is hiring an exceptional Program Manager Lead to help drive our hyper-scale business forward in SEA. Azure will be the best cloud for every customer in this hyper growth market as our landscape evolves, come make that happen with us.
When strategic customers in Emerging Markets such as SEA choose Azure as their cloud of choice, they have unique needs the way they view the economics of partnerships; their risk assessment and execution plan; their high bar for security, privacy and data residency; their specialized compute and storage requirements all contribute to the need for specialization, requiring a tailored approach. This role touches all these facets and requires a seasoned Program Manager that can lead a team, and embody a CEO mindset, scoped to a growing SEA business with a select set of customers within Azure.
Responsibilities
Build and deliver the strategic plan for engineering engagement in SEA in partnership with the regional subsidiary leadership.
Engage with key customers at the CxO level, driving co-innovation partnerships in critical industries
Effectively lead a team of Program Managers to positively impact the regional business while insuring the team is the bridge between SEA businesses with Engineering teams
Experience in executive communication and ability to communicate with senior internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to identify patterns that can be replicated to create scale.
Qualifications
Required qualifications:
BS or higher degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent industry experience
12+ years of experience in ICT related industry
3+ years of experience in Cloud Computing specifically in Azure will be a plus
5+ years of experience in technical Business Development or Sales working with strategic customers in Southeast Asia
5+ years of experience in people management
Preferred Qualifications:
Deep experience working with strategic customers in Southeast Asia
Demonstrates strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills
Experience in being able to collaborate with multiple stakeholders
Ability to analyze and operate at various levels of abstraction
Ability to balance what is strategically right with what is practically realistic
Ability to innovate and drive change
Passion and focus on delivering the right customer experience
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job_description:
About Us
Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS) is a university with a rich heritage in inspiring lifelong education, and transforming society through social sciences. As one of Singapore's six autonomous universities, we champion inclusivity, bringing education to all regardless of age, qualification, experience and background; ensuring that lifelong learners are given equal opportunities to develop to their fullest potential.
Grounded in our core philosophy of Head, Heart, Habit (3H), we value our people's involvement and contributions in making a difference through the many stages of our graduates journey. Working at SUSS provides you with a fulfilling career, and professional development to bring out the best in you!
About Role
The Lab Support Officer is responsible for providing reliable IT support solutions and services to the schools lab-based programmes in the university, including maintenance.

Main Responsibilities
Plan and manage the computers deployment during the upgrade/replacement cycle for all the labs.
Manage and perform software installations in all the labs computers including the application/software support.
Maintain and ensure labs computers are in good condition and available for class use and/or bookings for admission tests/trainings/events organised by other schools.
Provide software end-user support for teaching faculties/students/staff.
Assist in the technical and administrative setup (e.g. Management of Zoom platform, set up of classes on learning management system) of online sessions.
Work closely with internal teams and technology partners to manage and maintain various digital learning platforms.
Provide technical support on implemented systems/ platforms
Support Cloud platform. E.g. AWS, Azure, etc.
Liaise with other departments/schools within the university for the respective programmes and examinations (e.g. spss, translation, law, etc) software installations.
General responsibilities
Participate in university-wide events, e.g. examination invigilation duties, convocation, online learning, open house, orientation, associate appreciation event, etc.
Facilitate in the maintenance and loan of IT assets to teaching faculty/students/staff.
Assist with administrative support and technical ad hoc duties when required.
Coordinate/plan school events and associate/alumni events.
Support and provide resources for divisional activities (Audits/Disaster Recovery/Business Continuity/etc).
Job Requirements
Diploma in Computing/Information Technology.
Fresh graduate, at least 1 year of relevant working experience preferably in higher institute laboratory.
Must be computer-literate and possess Microsoft Office skills.
Experience with cloud technologies, such as AWS, Azure, DevOps and e-learning (e.g. Zoom), multimedia technology and learning management systems is an added advantage.
