job_description:
Your Purpose
Reporting to the Chief People Officer, this role is responsible for full-spectrum of HR management, ranging from HR policies and processes design to daily HR operations, and post-M&A unification.
The ideal candidate will have a collaborative leadership style with the ability to influence others into action and to think creatively about solutions. The right person for this role must have a passion for the business and be driven to accomplish business objectives, not just HR-specific targets. This role is keen on establishing progressive HR practices for great employee experiences. Through behaviours and words, this person will embody our culture and build a great workplace at STT Cloud.
Your Responsibilities
HR Management Policies, Procedures & Objectives
Formulate, review, and implement effective HR policies and procedures that are in line with the organization's goals and objectives
Ensure compliance to Employment Act legislation changes and update policies, and reporting requirements by various government authorities.
Maintain knowledge of employment laws, industry trends, and innovative HR best practices; ensure compliance and excellence in all aspects of the employment relationship.
HR Operations
Oversee day-to-day HR operations to ensure smooth operations relating to employees life cycle, from on-boarding to off-boarding, employee benefits, payroll, insurances, work passes, etc.
Identify and execute improvements to current programmes and process(es).
Responsible for manpower reporting.
Administration of the performance management cycle.
Maintain and administer the company's rewards programmes, eg. variable incentives, Long-Term incentives.
Drive employee engagement and wellness programmes.
Is a culture champion and drives culture-embedment programmes.
Recruitment & Onboarding
Partner with hiring managers and/or recruiters on hiring and selection of candidates from junior to mid-level positions.
Design and manage the graduate recruitment programme.
Manage the new joiner's orientation programme.
HR Business Partnering
Act as a business partner to provide people solutions to business problems.
Vendor Management
Oversee the end-to-end process of proposal, quotation, contracting, management and payment.
Performance manage vendors according to requirements to close gaps/competencies
Post-M&A Unification
Participate in M&A pre-transaction work, where necessary
Assess current state readiness, identify implementation plan, and lead/participate in implementation
Ad-hoc duties assigned by the management.
Requirements
Degree in related field (i.e. Human Resources, Business Administration)
At least 5 years of related HR work experience, especially in HR management and operations, including rewards, employment practices, regulations, performance management, etc.
Ability to excel in a start-up, fast-paced and demanding environment.
Demonstrates excellent multi-tasking, organisation and prioritisation skills.
Structured-thinking and detail-oriented, yet able to see the big picture and skilfully manage projects
Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skills

job_description:

First Page Digital prides itself on being a leader, not only in Singapore but also in Australasia in the field of digital marketing & design. We've won numerous awards because we love what we do! Passion breeds success!
The candidate should have experience guiding a small team of experienced designers to conceptualise, design and create final creative artworks which meets the requirements of both the agency and its clients. He/she will work alongside the Head of Content and the team's content producers, as well as colleagues across various departments, to create visual and creative concepts using a variety of software such as Adobe Illustrator, Premiere Pro, Photoshop, and more, to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate target audiences. Knowledge in video and photography production is a strong plus.
Rewards you deserve:
Medical benefits upon confirmation
Collaborate with a strong, dynamic team.
Working side by side with a fun, creative team. Freedom to run with your ideas!
Always new and exciting projects.
What you'll be doing:
Be the main person to put ideas together in a visually striking and presentable manner to stakeholders.
Conceptualisation and mood boarding.
Understand, crunch, and deliver design and creative briefs to the team of designers.
Design engaging responsive web landing pages for clients and for the agency.
Building positive digital customer journey through compelling and engaging interfaces and landing pages.
Designing proposals for our account management & new business team.

Layout content for websites and proposals.
Lead the creative direction of all creative projects, including video production and photography.
Coordinate and manage the creative process together with the campaign management team for client's projects.

Liaise between graphics design team, campaign managing team and technical team.

What we need:
At least a Diploma in Arts, Graphics Design or related field.
Someone who values quality; you care about craftsmanship and take pride in their work.

job_description:
Job Purpose:
To lead the Information Technology (IT) Audit Department (ITAD) which is responsible for carrying out IT audits to support the audit of the Government Financial Statements (GFS), other Financial Statement audits, and selective audits of public sector entities.
These IT audits are to ascertain the adequacy and effectiveness of controls in Government ICT systems and processes.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop a good understanding of the Government ICT environment, key developments and growing trends relevant to client's audits (eg control requirements in the Government Instruction Manual on IT Management, use of cloud computing, greater automation of processes, block chain technology etc.) and recommend to senior management ITAD's key audit strategies and focal areas
Lead and implement the overall direction of ITAD's annual and 5-year audit strategy and plans
Demonstrates strong ability to understand complex ICT systems. Uses this knowledge to guide ITAD's IT auditors in their conduct of IT audit projects.
Lead ITAD in continuous innovation and harness the power of data and technology to deliver high quality IT audit services.
Provide overall direction to company in upskilling the IT audit competences across all auditors in the company, such as for the conduct of IT application control audits by financial auditors. Provide technical assistance to the Audit Groups
Vet and review audit reports drafted by ITAD before they are sent to Senior Management for approval, to ensure that audit observations, concerns and recommendations are clearly articulated.
Attend Audit Committee meetings of the auditee, to clarify on company's audit observations and recommendations
Assist senior management in talent management, recruitment and retention of IT audit specialists, while actively drive the use of CAATs and automated auditing tools to enhance ITAD's productivity and efficiency.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by senior management.
Job Requirements:
Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems studies or equivalent.
At least 15 years of relevant experience in IT systems audit, including at least 8 years of experience in leading and overseeing audit teams.
Possess strong knowledge in the principles of IT governance, risks and controls.
Possess a good understanding of Operating Systems, Databases, Networks or Enterprise Applications. A good understanding of the IT environment/key systems of Government and public entities would be an advantage
Possess CISA, CRISC and/or CISSP Certifications
Possess strong leadership, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills.
Remuneration offered will depend on the candidate's qualifications and experience.
Working Days: 5-day work week (Mon to Fri)
Working Hours: TBC
Location: Novena
Contract Period: 2 years (chance for permanent establishment)
Salary: $12,000 to $14,000/month

Job Description :

As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.
Cloud computing allows the Athena platform to modernize the infrastructure, pursue next-generation innovation and reduce the compute footprint. To continue on this transformation, we are seeking an experienced software engineer with expertise in the strategy, design, development and implementation of large-scale distributed systems.
Athena is a cross-asset platform transforming technology at JP Morgan. It delivers innovative and efficient applications to a wide range of the firm's businesses, including sales, trading, operations, risk and research. Athena combined the best of open source technologies with innovative components developed internally, which gives you the ability to contribute to a wide range of exciting projects. Our developers enjoy working with front office, quants and other technology teams. Our modernization strategy for Athena is to re-engineer parts of the runtime, infrastructure and applications platform to take advantage of elastic compute and as a service offerings from internal and external cloud providers.
The people who thrive in Athena are hands-on developers who enjoy solving challenging technical problems. You're someone who has strong computer science foundations and is comfortable working across different platforms and languages. You're inspired by working in a collaborative, fast-changing environment with a high degree of code sharing and reuse.
If this sounds like you, then Athena could be the perfect place to grow your career.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
BS/BA degree
Minimum 5 years of experience
Experience in distributed systems
Proficiency in modern programming languages
Experience in cloud based services, Database technologies, Functional/Reactive Programming
Knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices
Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals
Passionate about building an innovative culture

job_title: Manager, Inside Sales Representative - Cloud Sales Center
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Manager, Inside Sales Representative - Cloud Sales Center
AWS is where innovation, risks, and ideas are celebrated. We are builders, we try new things, and imagine big dreams. It is still Day 1 for us, and we are looking for curious and passionate people to be part of our diverse teams of thinkers, testers, and doers. Come join us and work with the latest cloud technologies that enable our customers to adopt cloud based solutions. At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams within the Cloud Sales Center (CSC). AWS is committed to be the most customer obsessed organization on the planet.

ABOUT THE TEAM
This role is within the ASEAN CSC team. The CSC is the inside sales organization of AWS and is focused on new customer acquisitions across APJ at scale. You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically, as you collaborate with internal stakeholders across sales, operations, partner, and marketing teams, while being part of an entirely new concept at AWS.

ABOUT US
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

THE ROLE
As an Inside Sales Manager in the Cloud Sales Center, you will lead a team of talented and customer obsessed Inside Sales Representatives to achieve our sales and talent development goals within your assigned territory for AWS. You will be responsible for setting the direction and empowering your Inside Sales team, who are responsible for: new customer acquisition, existing account management, and working with our channel partners to accelerate growth.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY
As a trusted advisor, you'll use your interpersonal skills to influence a variety of stakeholders across a variety of LOBs. You'll help ensure their short-term technology decisions are aligned with their long-term goals. Speeding up the adoption of our services will be part of your day to day.

You'll also act as an evangelist in the wider community. This includes taking part in educating and sharing best practices. You won't just want to be part of an industry movement you'll want to be leading it.

THE RESPONSIBILITIES
* Hire, coach, and develop the best team of Sales Reps to deliver against your sales goals
* Invest in recruiting and growing the best talent, set employees up for a great onboarding experience, and provide candid feedback for continuous development.
* Drive strong internal and external relationships in service of an outstanding customer experience and continued rapid growth.
* Set the tone for your team: Champion a culture of strong achievement, inclusiveness, collaboration, creativity, and accountability while being a champion for your team's career development
* Build and drive territory strategy and priorities and communicate them clearly with your team. Continuously optimize our sales methodology and share ideas to improve efficiency and focus, enable greater scale, and yield better results.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to maximize results (partner, field sales, solutions architects, marketing, specialists, etc.).
* Collaborate with Sales Enablement and People Operations to develop and execute individual and group training opportunities, identify development needs, and implement process improvement initiatives.
* Use metrics and data to continually assess both sales performance and talent performance/retention to fully understand underlying drivers.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
* 5+ years of successful sales/relationship management experience
* Previous OR current Team Lead/Management experience
* Executive presence and ability to collaborate cross-departmentally
* Examples of demonstrating Amazon Leadership Principles: https://amazon.jobs/en/internal/principles
* Examples of working collaboratively with peers to solve complex problems for the betterment of the team
* Organizational and project management capabilities with the ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines
* Proven relationship building skills, tenacity, resilience and interpersonal skills
* Track record of quota achievement and YoY growth

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
* Strategic selling experience
* 2+ years of experience managing a team in B2B sales, operations, or a similar environment with a proven track record of overachieving goals
* Experience building relationships/interfacing with LOB, Business Partners and internal key stakeholders
* BA/BS degree preferred, and technology sales experience is a plus
* Understanding of cloud domain of benefit

What if I'm not an expert in all qualifications That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning and are curious. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry today.

At AWS, we don't mind being called peculiar. We see beauty in simplifying the complex, and we're comfortable being misunderstood. That might sound unorthodox. We believe in removing obstacles so builders can build which is why our people enjoy working in AWS.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS
We're passionate about supporting the needs of our people and their family. This may include:
* Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
* Paid Maternity and Parental Leave
* Flexible workplace: flexible daily working hours, we value work-life-harmony
* Amazon Employee Discount on product and services (NOT APPLICABLE IN INDIA)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Want to Come Build the Future with us Don't wait, apply today!
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 5+ years of successful sales/relationship management experience
* Previous OR current Team Lead/Management experience
* Executive presence and ability to collaborate cross-departmentally
* Examples of demonstrating Amazon Leadership Principles: https://amazon.jobs/en/internal/principles
* Examples of working collaboratively with peers to solve complex problems for the betterment of the team
* Organizational and project management capabilities with the ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines
* Proven relationship building skills, tenacity, resilience and interpersonal skills
* Track record of quota achievement and YoY growth
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Strategic selling experience
* 2+ years of experience managing a team in B2B sales, operations, or a similar environment with a proven track record of overachieving goals
* Experience building relationships/interfacing with LOB, Business Partners and internal key stakeholders
* BA/BS degree preferred, and technology sales experience is a plus
* Understanding of cloud domain of benefit

The role is responsible for enhancing stability, scalability & performance of our IT network and security operations, design and projects at regional level while mitigating risks and ensuring standards, best practices and policies with business perspective.
Your assignment
Lead the long-term planning, design and implementation of IT network (Local/Wide Area/ Wireless) at regional level with due diligence and considerations for the future needs of the organisation, ensuring adherence to policies and procedures in relation to network growth, security and upgrades on proactive basis.
Analyse the benefits, costs, opportunities and risks associated with IT network operations and security infrastructure planning, and champion a balanced approach with a focus to support business growth, scalability, stability, high availability, operational functionality and capacity utilization with overall cost effectiveness.
Develop and drive the IT enterprise grade IT network and security infrastructure roadmap and initiatives including standardization, modernization and common operating model across the region
Work closely with IT Infra Admin Engineers to ensure effective measurement, monitoring, administration and operations with centralized delivery while reducing dependence on external vendors and develop our own internal competence
Engage with business and project stakeholders to understand IT network & security related system requirements and support stakeholders on options, risks, business impacts and cost-benefits.

At least 5 years of hands-on experience in enterprise-grade design and documentation of IT network and security architecture using CISCO Networks, Checkpoint/Fortinet Firewall and Azure Cloud
Experience in managing large scale regional projects from design to implementation in the area of Enterprise IT network and information security with proven results with high quality and business benefits.

Service oriented and self-driven. Able to work with flexible hours and travel regionally.

job_description:
To support and integrate Global Relations Office's communications, publicity, marketing, branding and outreach efforts, in order to promote NUS global programmes, alliances/networks and leadership.
Duties & Responsibilities
Conceptualise and implement integrated communications, marketing, publicity, and stakeholder engagement initiatives
Design and produce digital and print publicity content and materials, EDMs, brochures, slides, templates, exhibition booths, signage, collaterals, gifts, mascot, etc
Develop audience-targeted and media-specific strategies and content for the publicity of programmes, news, activities, events, etc
Manage/support management of marketing/publicity assets, e.g. website, telegram, emails, etc
Manage/support management of social media assets, including the production and curation of platform appropriate content, and community management
Manage/support management of events and outreach activities, and ad hoc projects
Qualifications
Degree or experience in Communications, Marketing, Graphic Design or other relevant fields
4-5 years of experience in communications or public relations, preferably in higher education
Excellent command of English communication skills, both spoken and written
Strong interpersonal, time management and organisational skills
Ability to produce effective and creative communications materials across various mediums
Proficient in use of social media tools and experience in managing online marketing/community engagement campaigns
Excellent graphic design skills and proficient in use of relevant Adobe Creative Cloud tools
Experience in events management preferred
Competency, experience or interest in UX/UI/web design, photography, and/or video production would be advantageous

Covid-19 Message
At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required.

job_description:
Application Owner and developer for Data Warehousing solutions as part of the global Applied Intelligence/Advance Analytics Data Solutions Group. The Data Solutions Group is responsible for integrating Corporate, manufacturing, and engineering data out of a high variety of source systems used in the semiconductor engineering and production process. The data warehouse solutions are used in the GLOBALFOUNDRIES in the US, Dresden, and in Singapore, and the Data Solutions Group is responsible to conceptualize and provide timely, high-quality solutions that address the analysis needs of Business users and engineers in a leading-edge semiconductor foundry. The person in this role will be responsible for the design, implementation, optimization, and support of enhancements and deficiency corrections, as well as the coordination of new releases. Responsibilities will also include activities to streamline and further standardize the architecture in the data warehouse space and provide technical consulting to projects with data warehouse related scope. A thorough understanding of Data Warehousing and Software Development Lifecycle concepts, strong communication skills, and a process-oriented mindset are required in addition to very good technical and documentation skills.
Roles & Responsibilities
Understand the business case and translate to a holistic solution involving AWS Cloud Services (Data Ingestion, PySpark, Python,Airflow) & Cloud DB Snowflake/Redshift
Proactively working with internal and external users to resolve system notifications and support issues timely with adherence to SLA standards.
Required to work on Project Development work, User Co-ordination, E2E project handling and involvement of multiple projects
Required to work closely with business/functional analysts and subject matter experts to analyze support issues trends and implement initiatives to continuously reduce support issues with sound root cause analysis, corrective actions, and preventive measures.
Understand and suggest data model requirements for ETL needs.
High-level & detailed design of AWS ETL & Snowflake Solution.
Expected to perform Application/operational support(L3)
Required Qualification:
Degree / Masters in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related discipline
8 years or more proven experience in developing solutions in Data warehouse & Cloud Technologies (Python, PySpark, Jenkins, Airflow etc..)
Good experience in AWS Services, Big data, PySpark, Python, Cloud DB Snowflake/RedShift
Proven experience with large, complex database projects in environments producing high-volume data
Experience in preparing data warehouse design artifacts based on given requirements (ETL framework design, data modeling, source-target-mapping)
Strong in communication, analysis, problem-solving, and articulation skills.
Excellent conceptual abilities paired with very good technical documentation skills, e.g. ability to understand and document complex data flows as part of business/production processes, infrastructure.- Familiarity with SDLC concepts and process
Ability to work independently and as a team player within a global organization.
Expected to work and collaborate with teams from US, EU & APAC regions.

job_description:
Shape the future of commercial transportation with us!
Truck Connectivity is looking to hire you, as a Tribe Product Owner who wants to build our large-scale connectivity platform.
Our vision is to create the future Connectivity Experience for Daimler Trucks and Buses by providing a highly scalable, reliable and secure connectivity platform.
We are looking for a highly-self motivated, committed and enthusiastic talent that want to build cutting-edge solutions. Join us by building the new IoT platform to connect Daimler Trucks and Buses and bring them into the cloud. With our state-of-the-art Cloud Vehicle Connectivity Solution, we enable our customers to gain the maximum out of their fleets while facing an increasingly competitive landscape. Our technology will be the driver for new data-driven business models within Daimler Truck.
Who we are:
We are an energetic team that is responsible for the architecture, development, delivery and operations of the new global Connectivity Backend for Daimler Trucks and Buses. We work with latest cloud technologies, organize ourselves in DevSecOps teams and use agile practices. We as a team value collaboration, openness, our users, good coding practices, and we do get things done.
Connectivity plays a central role within Daimler Trucks and Buses. Many innovative services like MB Uptime, Detroid Connect or Autonomous Driving build upon connectivity and rely on data from the trucks. Together with our international colleagues we connect all our trucks and buses around the globe 24/7 and shape commercial transportation of tomorrow.
Responsibilities:
As a Tribe Product Owner, you will help us to develop and run our own cloud services to connects our trucks and buses to the internet and process data at large scale:
You and your DevOps teams will have the ownership of data and streaming services within our global IoT platform
You create value for our customers by delivering data services on a global scale
You will be responsible for the product lifecycle within your domain, like product roadmap, planning, and prioritization together with the Crew Product Owners as well as other aspects of the product like product operations and delivery
You will work closely with Product Mangers and partners around the world and the global truck and bus organization to prioritize features and releases
You will work in an agile environment
You will work with a great team of internal software engineers and latest cloud technologies
Qualifications:
You love helping our customers to create value with new features
You love working with diverse software engineering teams
You are able to take over responsibilities as a tribe product owner
You possess great communication and love to communicate and collaborate amongst other teams in a global setup
You are open-minded towards new challenges
You have experience with data management
You have experience with connectivity services and data in the B2B environment
You have at least 5 years of work experience within the automotive industry and knowledge of relevant industry standards
You have experience in working within an agile environment as a product owner
You are a certified SCRUM Product Owner
You have experience in working with Microsoft Azure technologies such as IoT Hub, Data Explorer and Event Hubs
You have knowledge of the relevant security and data protection regulations in our main markets (EU/US/JP)

job_description:
Meet Our Team:
Be part of a rapidly growing and dynamic client success organization and help shape the future of our company. As a Senior Portfolio Success Manager, you will be a key point of contact and trusted advisor for our clients in helping them to realize their dream of digital transformation.
Picture Yourself at Pega:
A Senior Portfolio Success Manager is responsible for maintaining and expanding relationships and provide technical expertise, where applicable, within a set of defined accounts that are of critical importance to Pega based on reference engagement, and ongoing revenue stream. These accounts will also require a high level of vertical expertise as well as ongoing program adoption management and leadership.
What You'll Do at Pega:
Develop a trusted advisor relationship with multiple people in the account to expand engagement with stakeholders across the client organization
Serve as the account's advocate within Pega, managing escalations quickly and effectively and coordinating with other organizations at Pega to take action on behalf of the client
Use discrete and aggregate measures of client health to drive insights, to identify and mitigate areas of risk, and to take proactive action
Engage as a Pega thought leader during the execution of strategic programs to encourage the client and partner to embrace the Pega delivery best practices
Leverage proven techniques to assess the value clients have achieved through the use of Pega technology and then turn those insights in to recommendations to enhance value realization
Leverage industry and product knowledge to share insights about how client can maximize license to drive business benefits.
Who You Are:
As a client satisfaction and revenue driver, the Senior Portfolio Success Manager leverages data and relationships to help Pega clients achieve their business objectives after the initial sale and continuing through the client lifecycle.
Comfortably engages with front-line teams and C-suite leaders, employing the Challenger model to drive business insights. They understand Pega best practices and how to adapt them within each client's environment to achieve faster time to value.
Has an analytics orientation. Client Success requires analysis of available data to determine client health and identification of new data - to drive proactive outreach, which in turn increases client satisfaction and lowers sales and delivery risks.
Drives for results. Contribute to account plans, and organize resources required to execute the plans and achieve desired outcomes. They measure progress against KPIs, successfully balancing the client's needs and value to Pega.
Is a thought leader. They leverage their deep domain experience, product knowledge, and industry trends to home in on quantifiable benefits and focus intently on realizing them.
Is service-oriented. They are the primary post-sale point of contact for the client. They address root causes of dissatisfaction, and proactively coordinate with specialists in Pega to smooth the client journey and help ensure that Pega's applications are best in class.
What You've Accomplished:
BA/BS Degree or equivalent business experience
10+ experience with at least 5+ years experience in Consulting or consultative sales strongly preferred
Technical aptitude, either gained from a formal computer science education, or alternative practical experience
Proficiency-level understanding of systems development lifecycle, including agile methods
Executive-level communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively navigate and mediate conflict and foster honest dialogue
Consulting skills and proven results working as a trusted advisor to drive business value for clients or stakeholders
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure
Strong knowledge of software business processes (Sales, Marketing, Service, Support), business applications and automation
Additional Preferred Qualifications (based on account portfolio):
Strongly prefer existing knowledge of Pega product and platform features, capabilities, and best use
Experience implementing Customer Relationship Management solutions (CRM) or other complex IT projects within large enterprises
Skilled at Program Management within large organizations, helping to effectively drive change across groups by engaging key stakeholders
Proven effectiveness at leading and facilitating executive meetings and workshops
Experience with account portfolio planning and prioritization
Familiarity with Cloud Computing technologies, concepts and benefits
Pega Offers You:
Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products
Continuous learning and development opportunities
An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company
A career in the rapidly growing profession of Customer/Client Success in the Software as a service industry.

Job Description :

We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Infrastructure Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) focusing on Azure Infrastructure Innovation to join the Customer Success Unit. This customer-facing position is a hands-on technical role spanning across design, build, and operations with a focus on issue resolution to remove customer technical obstacles and adoption challenges.
As part of this role, you will be responsible for technical customer engagements, working with the most challenging and exciting projects. You will work with select customers to lead deep technical architecture discussions with senior customer executives, Enterprise Architects, IT Management and Developers. You will collaborate with a variety of internal and external teams to develop pilots and oversee implementation projects, ensuring technical blockers are removed on adoption. You will drive technical intensity of developers and create communities within customers. And you will collaborate with Product engineering to share feedback into the development of Microsoft products and help develop Azure platforms.
Understand customers overall cloud portfolio, IT and business priorities, and success measures to design implementation architectures and scalable cloud solutions leveraging expertise in cloud infrastructure solutions (Windows and Linux IaaS, SAP, VMware, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, OSS, HPC, containers and Infra as a code technologies).
Apply technical knowledge and customer insights to create a migration and modernization roadmap with customers using the Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF). Ensure all solutions leverage thedesign and operations guidance according to the Well-Architected framework across all pillars, including performance efficiency, security, operational excellence, reliability, and cost optimization
Run Architectural Design Sessions to build plan for implementing solution -governing design in line with customer business goals and their technical environment. Outcome is consensus on solution design and next steps toward production.Use CAF Landing Zones to rapidly prototype and deliver proof-of-concepts that accelerate production deployment
Develop deep relationships with key customer IT decision makers, who drive long-term cloud adoption within their company to enable them to be cloudadvocates

Troubleshoot technical issues to prove the value of implementation of Azuretechnologies
Assess the customer knowledge of Azure platform and overall cloud readiness to support customers through a structured learning plan and ensure delivery through partners . Collaborate with othersin developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform

At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.
Work you will do
Cloud is transforming the way technology enables the business. It represents a radical shift in how IT services are obtained, used, and managed. Companies are navigating through the various cloud options and deciding between private, public, or a combination across different and dynamic provider ecosystems. Our cloud specialists guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of cloud - business alignment, technology architecture and design, cloud application on-boarding, and transforming their operating model - to help solve our client's most complex issues with the focus on value creation.
Our practitioners work collaboratively within integrated, cross-functional teams to deliver comprehensive strategies that enable Cloud and Infrastructure transformations. Teamwork is crucial as teams are composed of a diverse group of specialists across multiple disciplines from both within our consulting practice and from our clients, helping drive towards a successful outcome. Our practitioners are expected to own and deliver their respective deliverables while managing different clients and other stakeholders.
In partnership with other leaders in the firm, you will focus on selling and delivering cloud solutions using AWS. As Cloud Architect, you will drive the design and delivery of world-class cloud solutions for our clients, providing expertise on cloud infrastructure services including design, build and migrate. This includes taking a lead role in the cloud architecture and engineering practice. You will be challenged to find approaches that enable rapid adoption of new cloud services and drive transformation for our client's business and IT processes.
Oversee the architecture and engineering of cloud back-end, including serverless solutions, APIs, database, storage, devops and CI/CD
Ensure that the entire stack is built for speed and scalability
Partner with development team to guide the front-end and back-end technical strategy
Manage available resources to help the team meet tight deadlines.
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
Lead processes and protocols for security and quality assurance, including the protection of sensitive data

Your role as a leader
At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values, challenging themselves everyday to identify issues that are most important to our clients, our people and the communities, and to make an impact that matters. In addition to living our purpose, Managers across our Firm are expected to:
Understand the goals of Deloitte, align our people to these objectives by setting clear priorities and direction by establishing a positive relationship with a senior stakeholders.
Influence teams, and individuals positively. Lead by example and provide equal opportunity for people to grow, develop and succeed.
Delivers exceptional client service. Maximizes results and drives high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and geographies.
Manage diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where people are respected and valued for their contribution.
Develop high-performing teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities and recognize them for the impact that they make.

Enough about us, let's talk about you
If you are someone with:
A good honors Degree, preferably at postgraduate level, in Information Technology, Business Information Systems, Business, Engineering, Mathematics or related disciplines.
10+ years of overall work experience in software engineering and architecture, including full stack development in Azure environments
Experience building exceptional cloud-based software from the ground-up
Experienced at leading and motivating teams of developers, devops engineers, infrastructure engineers and managing complex software projects
Outstanding communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with remote teams of developers, as well as with clients and partners
Relevant certification in AWS, Google or Azure is preferred
6+ years project experience migrating and deploying cloud based solutions (GCP, Azure or AWS)
Technical proficiency including systems experience, strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, and issue management in a multi-platform environment
Experience with deploying cloud based solutions and workload migration strategy using tools
Experience with Enterprise application and database architecture is an advantage
Demonstrated skills in communication (oral, written, presentation), analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, ability to handle diverse situations, multiple initiatives and rapidly changing priorities
An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment.

Next Steps
So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now.
Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description:
About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.
The Role Responsibilities

As a Senior Cloud Architect in one of the leading Global Banks, you will have extensive experience with IaaS and PaaS. You love to Build, Test, Deploy and Manage things with new Technologies in the Cloud. We eat, breathe and sleep Agile methodologies and best DevSecOps Practices!

Go, Python, Perl, PHP, Ruby, Shell-scripting, or C

Automation experience, we will Automate everything that can be Automated

Experience with a Testing framework and writing your own Unit and System tests

A commitment to DevSecOps best practices

A solid understanding designing solutions and troubleshooting Internet Technologies and protocols such as TCP/IP, HTTPS, DNS, etc.


You would love to be in a high performing team and enjoy working with smart colleagues. We are open to new ideas and embrace collaboration and sharing in our Kanban/Scrum teams. Most of our days consist of Daily's, Sprint planning, Retrospections and most importantly to Getting Things Done. We are bunch of cool Engineers committed to Build and Operate world class Cloud Technologies.
If this sounds like an environment where You would thrive, We would Love to hear from You!

Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.
To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Customer oriented mindset.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

tech_stack: it security policies  Asset Management  Mac Os  Cloud Security  It Operations  Windows Server  Network Security  Technical Support  Security Audits  Troubleshooting  WiFi  Oncology  Purchasing  LAN/WAN  Software  Audit Compliance  Computer Science  Lims  Laboratory  Erp Software
job_description:
Lucence is a precision oncology company with offices in Singapore, California, Hong Kong and Suzhou. We are looking for an IT Support Engineer who believes in our mission to fight cancer and has a keen interest in IT operations. You will play an important role in ensuring that our IT systems function smoothly for the company's work.

Key responsibilities:
Functioning as the company's internal IT helpdesk to ensure that troubleshooting and investigation of issues related to network (WiFi and LAN), IT software (desktop and website applications) and hardware (laptop, desktop, printers, scanners) are done in a way that safeguards the security and integrity of connections in all these areas.
Monitoring and maintaining the security of our networks, IT software and hardware.
Conducting internal compliance and security audits periodically.
Liaising with external IT support vendors to investigate and solve any issues related to network, software and hardware.
Setting up new user devices according to Lucence's security standards and managing identity and access for the company's account users.
Assisting with instrument and application integration where relevant, e.g. Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Production Management System (PMS).
Coordinating the asset management of IT hardware, including the purchasing and disposal of IT equipment, to ensure that information confidentiality is safeguarded.
Providing IT support remotely to Lucence's overseas offices if needed.
To be a good fit for this role, you would have:
At least a Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology/systems, software engineering or a related field. Diploma holders with relevant working experience are also welcome.
The ability to think creatively for novel solutions to day-to-day challenges.
The ability to think ahead and implement measures to mitigate any potential risks.
A roll-up-your-sleeves attitude to tackle issues if they arise.
Flexibility to troubleshoot vissues outside of fixed working hours if urgent unforeseen issues arise and flexibility to (occasionally) cover US hours on a rotational basis with other team members if needed.
The ability to lead and work with others in a positive and collaborative manner to set and meet organizational goals.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Fully vaccinated status against COVID-19.

job_title: Senior Consultant - Cloud Infra Architect - SG
job_description:
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.
Work you will do
Cloud is transforming the way technology enables the business. It represents a radical shift in how IT services are obtained, used, and managed. Companies are navigating through the various cloud options and deciding between private, public, or a combination across different and dynamic provider ecosystems. Our cloud specialists guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of cloud - business alignment, technology architecture and design, cloud application on-boarding, and transforming their operating model - to help solve our client's most complex issues with the focus on value creation.
Our practitioners work collaboratively within integrated, cross-functional teams to deliver comprehensive strategies that enable Cloud and Infrastructure transformations. Teamwork is crucial as teams are composed of a diverse group of specialists across multiple disciplines from both within our consulting practice and from our clients, helping drive towards a successful outcome. Our practitioners are expected to own and deliver their respective deliverables while managing different clients and other stakeholders.
In partnership with other leaders in the firm, you will focus on selling and delivering cloud solutions using AWS. As Cloud Architect, you will drive the design and delivery of world-class cloud solutions for our clients, providing expertise on cloud infrastructure services including design, build and migrate. This includes taking a lead role in the cloud architecture and engineering practice. You will be challenged to find approaches that enable rapid adoption of new cloud services and drive transformation for our client's business and IT processes.
Promote public cloud internally to sales and delivery teams to drive growth.
Be the go to person for Cloud Network engineering. You should have a deep understanding and hands on experience of services offered on Public Cloud platforms and understand how to configure these services to support the building of complex solutions.
Support the solution architects, and delivery teams in design, build, configuration, testing and deployment on Public Cloud
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the Public Cloud solutions architect community
Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates, and provide advisory around integration of on-premises environments with Public Cloud
Act as a technical liaison between customers, delivery teams and support.

Enough about us, let's talk about you
If you are someone with:
A good honors Degree, preferably at postgraduate level, in Information Technology, Business Information Systems, Business, Engineering, Mathematics or related disciplines.
The right person will be detailed, highly technical, having 5+ years of current cloud infrastructure experience, including consulting and implementation for hybrid, and non-hybrid solutions. Demonstrated experience in an enterprise environment, and experience with AWS is an advantage
Relevant certification in AWS, Google or Azure is preferred
6+ years project experience migrating and deploying cloud based solutions (GCP, Azure or AWS)
6+ years architecting, implementing and supporting Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform infrastructure and topologies
Experience with infrastructure as code is a must
Experience with building, configuring and supporting network infrastructure solutions (on-premises, virtualization, Public Cloud) using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, & storage architectures
Technical proficiency including systems experience, strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, and issue management in a multi-platform environment
Experience with deploying cloud based solutions and workload migration strategy using tools
Experience with Enterprise application and database architecture is an advantage
Demonstrated skills in communication (oral, written, presentation), analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, ability to handle diverse situations, multiple initiatives and rapidly changing priorities
An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment.

Next Steps
So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now.
Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: DI&C Technical Analyst (Digital Identity and Consent)
tech_stack: Identity Management  Typescript  Google Cloud Platform  Javascript  Information Technology  Technical Training  Object Oriented Design  Api  Web Development  Software Development  foot  Healthcare  Cv Writing  Administration  Strategy  Identity & Access Management  Digital Marketing  Team Player  Identity Management System  Master Data Management
job_description:
DI&C Technical Analyst (Digital Identity and Consent)
THE OPPORTUNITY
Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on The Straits Times and Statista's list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021).
Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years.
Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
As our Company goes more Digital, there is significant transformation required to realize value through digital marketing capabilities. We are shifting from projects and large programs to products and agile delivery teams. We have 3 primary goals in this transformation:
Increase commercial efficiency by complementing and augmenting impact of promotional activities and field forces through digital capabilities
Increase customer engagement by delivering data-driven experiences that are relevant, personalized and intuitive.
Build highly flexible, rapid and scaled agile teams who can pivot on priorities and customer needs
The Digital Marketing Execution product team provides campaign management, marketing automation, omnichannel campaign orchestration, personalization, digital identity, and consent capabilities to our local and regional marketers and their partners. Success is highly dependent on the integration of products and services provided by all of the value teams, as well as our marketing execution platform partners (i.e. Veeva, Salesforce, Akamai, Aktana, ZS, AWS etc).
Technical Analyst for Digital Identity & Consent (DI&C) in the Digital Marketing Execution product team participates in creation of technical designs in the Digital Identity Hub and Consent Hub; interfaces and coordinates with Delivery Teams to communicate architecture & delivery strategy; identifies opportunities for refactoring and improvement.
Responsibilities:
Support design and development of existing and new features in DI&C
Understand product vision and business needs to define product requirements and contribute to architectural and technical solutions
Work with Product Manager in planning and execution of new feature releases in DI&C
Consult business management team to clarify objectives and functional requirements for new or modified features in DI&C
Work with product owners and product teams in solution demonstrations in DI&C
Work with product owners and product teams in the solution engineering efforts in DI&C
Provide support and consultancy to DevOps teams for incidents and problem resolutions for customers in DI&C
Develop broad domain knowledge in the Identity & Consent area
WHAT YOU MUST HAVE
To be successful in this role, you will have:
Required Experience and Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Information Science, Math, Computer Science, or related field of study
Experience with cloud-based platform Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform
Overall knowledge with commercial capabilities that support digital marketing (i.e. Master Data Management, Digital Identity solutions, Veeva, Salesforce Solutions or Marketing Automation solutions)
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into easily understandable recommendations
Experience from working in agile environment understanding of MVP and build-measure-learn concept and principles
Proven success in delivering and supporting user facing products, services, and integrations
Ability to balance business and user needs while considering technical limitations
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a globally dispersed team
Ability to self-learn, develop, and apply business and technical knowledge quickly
Strong analytical thinker and problem-solving skills
Motivated team player with excellent interpersonal skills
Preferred Experience and Skills:
Certifications in one or more cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a strong plus
Working knowledge of web-based API (REST, SOAP)
Experience with digital identity and consent management technologies IAM, AD, OAuth, SAML
Proficiency with technologies and programming languages used in web development is also a strong plus, especially JavaScript & TypeScript
Demonstrable enthusiasm for development of capabilities in Marketing and sales in the Healthcare space
Ability and desire to work independently as part of remote, interdisciplinary teams
Strong oral and written communication skills
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT
Opportunities across various functional group within biopharmaceutical manufacturing
Diverse and dynamic team that focuses on development and success.
Our Support Functions deliver services and makes recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the experience of working at our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.
WHO WE ARE
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join usand start making your impact today.
We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another's thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

tech_stack: Cloud Security  Agile Methodology  Quality Control  Inventory  Risk Management  Internal Controls  Compliance  Written Skills  It Audit  Team Lead  Threat & Vulnerability Management  Audit
job_description:
Collaborate with various technology teams in the maintenance of effective internal controls;
Liaise with the Group Audit, Group Legal and Compliance and Technology ORM teams on a regular basis;
Support team lead to manage internal/external audit engagements
Raise issues/concerns, and provide constructive advice to the management so that significant IT risk and control issues are escalated and resolved properly
Execute risk assessments and perform controls testing to ensure their effectiveness;
Track process improvements and issues corrective actions to ensure timely closure;
Work closely with stakeholders and security teams to mitigate/resolve reported security vulnerabilities
Provide support and review on the privilege ID usage and conduct review to ensure adherence to access controls standards, including investigate on reported exceptions
Perform data analysis or procedure reviews to ensure compliance to the bank security standards;
Work with internal stakeholders and vendor to review and streamline the work processes of the bank and vendors
Requirements
Minimum a degree in Information Technology, Engineering or related discipline
4-7 years of working experience in Risk Management within IT.
Experience in IT audit, Cloud Security will be an advantage
Good understanding of Secure Software Development Life Cycle, Threat and Vulnerabilities Assessment, Agile Methodology and IT General Controls
Good understanding of technology and operational risks, regulatory requirements
Strong communication, interpersonal and written skills
Able to work independently with minimal supervision and with a positive attitude
Willing to learn and take new challenges with an open-mind.

Description
This job position is suitable for individuals who are constant learners, problem solvers and multi-taskers. Partake in efforts that shape the organization's security policies and standards for use in the cloud environment.
Extensive experience in using AWS Cloud Services (EC2, DynamoDB, API Gateway, RDS, Lambda, CloudFront, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, Route 53, etc.)

job_title: Senior Consultant - Cloud Engineering - Government & Public Services - SG
job_description:
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.
Work you will do
This role sits within the industry-leading cloud professionals will enable our public sector client's end-to-end journey from on premise legacy systems to the cloud, from design through deployment, and leading to a transformed organisation primed for growth.
You'll work alongside our clients to help them achieve success in the Cloud, with reference to the following areas:
Create a strategy for how their organisations can exploit the Cloud, create a business case, design a Cloud architecture and put in place governance and policies to manage the new world.
Architect the migration approach. Think about which of their existing on-premise applications to migrate to the Cloud, which applications should be re-built using Cloud native technologies and which should be bought from Cloud SaaS providers.
Re-imagine ways of working. Engage the entire businesses to re-imagine the way work gets done and how new products and services are brought to market, all enabled by Cloud technologies.
Innovate in delivery. Embrace new agile ways of working, enabled by new Cloud tools, to deliver your Cloud solutions.
Integrate. Consider how to integrate the Cloud into their enterprise through infrastructure and networking solutions to connect, optimise, and manage Cloud solutions across a wide choice of platforms.
Managed services. Ensure their use of the Cloud is secure, resilient, compliant, cost effective, and properly service managed, consider the use of a Cloud Managed Service Provider.

Enough about us, let's talk about you
If you are someone with:
Tertiary qualification in a technology or engineering discipline with a well ranked institution and/or currently enrolled in a MBA program.
Minimum 6 years of professional experience in cloud transformation.
Ability to deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large organisations, preferably in public sector.
You are people minded, nimble and sensitive to your environment, fascinated by the public sector, relish industry trends and market dynamics.
Experience with budgetary responsibilities related to projects or resources.
Exceptional interpersonal, team-building, and communication skills, with demonstrated ability to write clearly, succinctly, and in a manner that appeals to a wide audience.
Ability to build consensus and foster change in ambiguous settings.
Commitment to professional excellence, as well as personal and professional growth.
Drive, tenacity, client focused and results oriented.
An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a prerequisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment.
Willingness to work outside of office base.

Next Steps
So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now.
Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description:
Salesforce is seeking an engineering candidate to join the Site Reliability organisation in Singapore. Working closely with counterparts in the Infrastructure and R&D organisations, this organisation provides a global team of engineers monitoring cloud service availability and ready to swiftly repair any service-impacting issues. Seven days a week, 24 hours a day, in a follow-the-sun model, the Site Reliability team keeps the Salesforce cloud and our customers protected. As a member of the Site Reliability team, you will be responsible for the primary task of detecting and resolving incidents within minutes. This objective is met by monitoring the services, reacting to problems, and proactively addressing issues before they affect performance or availability.

When not fighting fires, the team is responsible for fire prevention through monitoring, automation, self-healing and resiliency initiatives, destructive testing, and game day exercises. The incumbent in this role would demonstrate a strong focus on tactical operations, as well as large-scale production engineering and orchestration.

Role Description:
Keep the customer-facing services available at top performance by maintaining the constant health of the supporting systems.
Incident management - Act in key support roles during major incidents e.g. Sev0, Sev1. Also, participate in the technical review of the incident for problem management
Problem Management - populate and participate in RCAs and hand them off to the Global Solutions team
Ensuring that work carried out by the Site Reliability team is executed in such a way as to comply with the company's internal compliance policy and directives
Being available to discuss and resolve technical issues and escalations with other technical staff as required
Work with and lead other members of the team in staying on top of key industry innovation and technology, and assist in team development growth
Identifying work opportunities and preparing or assisting with the preparation of technical proposals as required
Ability to operate in the high-pressure environment and troubleshoot complex issues quickly successfully handle multiple priorities
Work to automate detection and resolution of recurring issues in the production environment

Basic Requirements:
Systems engineering experience in enterprise scale internet service engineering or support role
Experience in container based architectures: Docker/ Kubernetes etc.
Experience in support of distributed systems, with strong Linux/UNIX knowledge and significant exposure to Red Hat Enterprise Linux
Good knowledge of basic large-scale Internet service architectures (DNS, HTTP, Load Balancing, ...)
Experience in some of the following programming languages: Python/Java/C++, good knowledge of BASH scripting.
Strong understanding of monitoring implementations and administration
Strong communication skills (Written and Oral)
Past experience in Incident Management and good understanding of ITIL service operations
Experience in a role with hands on complex Technical Problem Solving and troubleshooting
Experience in working in a 24/7 team managing large data centres
Be curious and ask questions
Education:
BS or higher degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering plus relevant job-related experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Python certification
Red Hat Certification
AWS/GCP
Prior Chef/Puppet or automated deployment experience

tech_stack: Cloud solutions  Oracle  Cloud Computing  Cloud  Sales & Marketing  Leadership  Business Acumen  Good Communication Skills  Business Development  strategic partnerships
job_description:
Interested in taking your career to the next level driving the market success of a strategic priority for Oracle in Cloud
Why this role
Dedicated Region Cloud@Customer is Oracle's strategic offering for a managed private cloud/distributed cloud i.e. OCI commercial region dedicated to a single customer deployed in their datacentre. To drive market success of this offering, we are investing in building a team of highly talented individuals in Asia Pacific.
What You'll Do
You will own & drive OCI-Dedicated Region opportunities from inception to close, working closely with the in-region Geo Managing Directors, Cloud Sales Leaders and Key Account Leaders.
Manage all aspects of opportunity lifecycle and orchestrate the alignment of key resources at the relevant stages of the lifecycle.
Support identification to qualification of opportunities. For qualified opportunities, lead the business case development (TCO models, workload identification- existing & new), solution architecture, commercial constructs- Overall proposition development and articulation.
You will pitch the overall proposition at not only the customer CXO level (CEO, COO etc) but also at technical level (Architect teams, Infrastructure teams etc).
Pull all stops from the sale.
Who You'll Work With
Primarily with our customers but working with extended teams internally is very vital for this role. You will work extensively with Insight, TCE, Industry Architects, Cloud Pursuit & OCI Product management teams.
Who You Are
If you enjoy taking on challenges in Technical-Business Development & exploring unchartered territories, this role is for you.
To be successful in this role, you will need a strong background in Datacentre transformation/Hyperconverged Infrastructure/Private Cloud/Large cloud migrations in a presales or an implementer role. Strong understanding of OCI (Oracle Cloud Infrastructure) or other cloud hyperscaler is a must. Experience in Distributed Cloud (AWS Outpost, Azure Stack, GCP Anthos, Nutanix, Openshift) is preferred.
You have over 15 years of rich experience having worked on multiple technologies, managed/implemented large deals or pursuits & become a trusted advisor to customers.
You have witnessed the data centre evolution from converged infrastructure to hyper converged infrastructure to software defined datacentre. This experience will help pitch the value of OCI platform & software defined infrastructure when deployed in the customers datacenter.
You have experience migrating workloads to public clouds This will help engage with customers and identify suitable workloads in the datacentre to migrate to OCI- Dedicated region.
You have experience managing large deals & pitching to C-Level This will help you lead & manage the OCI-Dedicated Region opportunity through the lifecycle that can span 2-4 quarters. Your experience pitching to C-Level will come handy articulating the overall OCI-Dedicated region proposition.
You have experience in Digital transformation initiatives This will help you convince customers to leverage OCI- Dedicated region as a platform for innovation. This experience is desirable and not mandatory, you would know this terminology having managed responses to multiple RFI/RFPs.
You exude a strong technical aptitude, high motivation to develop new business & a positive attitude that is contagious. You are passionate in pursuit of success & building positive relationships with customers and colleagues. You possess strong business acumen to spot opportunities for OCI- Dedicated region where others see none. You are articulate & have phenomenal communication/presentation skills. You thrive in a team environment & have a flair bringing large teams together for a shared purpose. You enjoy sharing ideas and best practices.
Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It's when everyone's voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what's been done before. That's why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

We are assisting our client, in the public sector to look for Cloud Security Architects.

The Cloud Security Architect provides in depth technical Point-of-View of advanced security technologies and emerging technologies to support better use of technologies in Government and the Smart Nation initiatives.
What you will be working on:
Lead in the development and implementation of cloud security architecture and technology to meet business functions while addressing cybersecurity threats and compliance requirements.
Involve in the provision of cybersecurity consulting services for large, national or Whole-of-Government projects or systems.
Support business initiatives through risk management, which involves performing security risk assessment to identify and analyse security risks, recommending risk treatment and mitigation measures, and assess residual risks.
Ensure that key security requirements are defined and designed into the systems, implemented in accordance to the security design, and in compliance with prevailing ICT security policies and standards.
Develop and review project specific security specifications and ensure alignment to assessed security risks, security requirements, prevailing ICT security policies and standards.
Review security architectures, designs and implementations to ensure compliance with prevailing ICT security policies and standards. Identify design gaps and recommend security enhancements.
Involve in designing artefacts (spanning design, development, and implementation) into enterprise systems that aligns to security principles and overall Enterprise System Architecture.
Stay abreast of current and emerging cloud security technologies and the associated security threats.
Align security architecture frameworks and standards with business strategies and functions.
Partner with Ministry/Agency CISO, stakeholders, project teams, and outsourced vendors to ensure security objectives are achieved.
What we are looking for:
Degree in Infocomm Security, Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or equalavant
Possess at least 8 years of IT experience in security roles with in-depth hands-on knowledge of security practice.
At least 6 years of cloud security architecture experience with a demonstrated ability as a trusted advisor in understanding business needs and security risks.
At least 2 years of hands-on experience in one or more of the following security areas: network design, applications development, Internet of Things, wireless communications, cryptography, hardware design protection, mobile management, cloud hosting design and implementation, DevSecOps consulting, design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines, etc.
Possess CISSP and/or CCSP, CISM, CISA certifications. Cloud related certifications are of added advantage
Knowledge and experience in cloud design and architecture, and security practices/techniques to mitigate cloud security risks.
Knowledge and experience of risk management methodologies and risk evaluation techniques.

job_description:
Position Summary
As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for infrastructure design, capacity planning, and optimizing applications on various cloud platforms. You will analyse complex business problems and propose technical solutions that will address these. This role combines technical leadership and in helping clients design resilient cloud architecture as they move and build applications in the cloud. Working closely with decision makers, you will become a trusted advisor to them.
Context
Cloud Comrade is a cloud native high growth business with strong partnerships with cloud service providers. We plan, design, build and manage cloud migration and related projects in the professional services and managed services segments. We are approaching 100 skilled team members who are focused on learning & growing in the is fast changing market. We currently operate in Singapore, Indonesia, India and Malaysia and will increase our geographic footprint as we grow with our customers.
Cloud Comrade is a founder led subsidiary of STTelemedia Cloud, a fast growing enterprise grade, global full service cloud solutions provider. STTelemdia Cloud helps modernise enterprise tech systems, operations and culture with public cloud only solutions. Capabilities include Applications, Security & Data.
Key Challenges
Provide leadership and be a subject matter expert in the following areas: cloud infrastructure, security and native cloud applications.
