job_description:
At Horangi we're building Warden, a multi-cloud solution that enables continuous cloud security, compliance monitoring and risk management for AWS and GCP. Warden deploys in minutes, delivering actionable insights to help our customers identify, prioritize and fix security threats in their multi-cloud environments.
Horangi is looking for motivated full stack software engineers to join our team. You will be part of an engineering team designing and developing new and innovative visualization and analytics features for our Cloud Security platform.
Your team will undertake major research on reducing identity and access security risks in cloud infrastructure. You will build solutions that provide visibility into insecure cloud configurations and communicate cybersecurity risks to our customers, allowing them to reduce excessive cloud infrastructure permissions and streamline least-privilege access controls.
What you'll be doing
You will build a visual analytics system for IAM Management and Threat Detection
You will rapidly build prototypes to test and validate product features
You will communicate complex security problems through beautiful and easy-to-use visualizations
You will participate in architecture, design and development of features
You will solve complex web software development problems and build the necessary support on the backend
You will own end-to-end development for feature sets, from frontend implementation to backend API
What we're looking for
You have at least 4 years experience in software engineering with a proven track record as a full stack engineer
You have frontend development experience with frameworks like Typescript, React and NextJS
You are proficient in backend development using Python
You have experience in building GraphQL API and have a good grasp of asynchronous programming
You enjoy building complex graph visualizations and dashboarding
You are looking forward to designing and building products with AWS and serverless technologies
You write high quality code, that can be safely co-authored in a fast grown organization
You have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience
Bonus points if you have
You are familiar with serverless technologies and NoSQL databases
You have experience with Docker
Contributed to open source projects
At Horangi, we pride ourselves as Cloud Security Champions in Asia backed by a team of global cybersecurity experts and trusted by Industry Leaders such as Gojek, MoneySmart, PropertyGuru and Tiket.com.
We built our Cloud Security product using AWS technology and cloud best practices to provide the security, performance and reliability of our platform as we ship rapidly in our agile software development. We adopt an event-driven architecture and embrace serverless technologies that are backed with 100% infrastructure as code. We build our app using reliable tools and frameworks that our team knows and trusts, including Python, Docker, TypeScript, React and GraphQL.
Horangi has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture, and we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and get-things-done culture. Horangi is always looking to hire collaborative, humble and highly driven individuals who want to make a difference.
Level yourself up as a cloud security expert and do the best work of your life here at Horangi.

job_description:
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 500,000 Enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and cloud technologies, VMware simplifies complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, and the network, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace. Our team of 34,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back.
Communications Service Providers are adopting virtualization and cloud technologies to transform the delivery of their services and become providers of rich 5G, Edge, and IoT offerings. As the pioneers of virtualization and cloud technologies, honed over 20 years of delivering best in class solutions to the our worldwide customer base, VMware is well placed to be a leading vendor of Telco Cloud solutions for network and IT transformation in CSP environments, and already commands a leading market share in this segment.
The VMware Global Account Program serves approximately 100 of VMware's largest customers. These premier accounts are managed by a team of experienced Global Account Executives, with the objective to establish a significant VMWare footprint in the largest and most influential corporations worldwide. Our selling is focused on our customers primary business initiatives and connecting our value to our customers business value. Our Value Selling strategy is the investment of time, talent and technology from VMware and our partners to invent (transform) our customers business for their benefit. This strategic objective is being accomplished using highly focused and experienced account management, marketing, and engineering teams, as well as substantial executive level engagement.
Role Brief:
Reporting to the APAC Telco Head, and a key part of the Global Telco Sales vertical, this Global Account Director role will be dedicated to a single telco account and will have principle responsibility for the Singtel Group worldwide. This business leader will own the overall account strategy and management including the creation and execution of a business-outcome based strategic account plan, goal obtainment, and revenue growth. This will be achieved by leading a matrix management of sales, specialist, and partner resources, to ensure value-added benefits and deeper plus wider reach into the customer. The Global Account Director will serve as the executive contact across the customer on behalf of VMware, communicating VMware's unique value. They must maintain a peer-level relationship and trusted advisor status at the C-suite level of their customer.
Role Responsibilities:
Responsible for the master strategy for the global strategic account and ensures the strategy is executed
Oversees and implements business case and value selling strategies which align the customer's needs (up to the C-Suite/Board), to VMware solutions and services
Manages tactical business while investing in larger, longer term strategic opportunities
Constructs and sells large multi-product, integrated solutions and services utilizing strategic partnerships which drive business outcomes
Maintains high touch and trusted advisor status with the customer
Delivers operational excellence in the day to day running of the account, through owning the accurate forecasting of the Singtel business globally, opportunity management and pipeline build, and representing the Singtel account on sales cadence calls
Act as an inspired leader and sales coach for a large extended team of virtual resources, to ensure consistent and effective team engagement and ensuring optimal usage of resources across management, supporting and partner organizations
Required Skills and Experience:
At least 10-15 years of experience in technology sales, including software / SaaS
Previous experience in regional sales roles across multiple geographies and time zones
At least 10 years of experience selling to Service Providers with meaningful relationships towards a range of key decision makers across the customer organization
Proven sales leadership in a global software organization with matrixed sales management responsibility, experienced in driving and closing large complex deals
Sales of Service Provider related technologies and offerings including 5G, Core, RAN, Edge, IoT, SD-WAN, SDN, SASE, Security, Orchestration, Assurance, etc.
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Our team looks for candidates who embody our EPIC2 values - Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers and Community. Team members who are logically curious, interpersonal, customer focused and able to find the humour in situations tend to thrive at VMware.
A history of selling to Singtel in Singapore, and its affiliates internationally
Established and referencable relationships with key customer contacts
An understanding of, or experience with, VMware technologies
Familiar with Target Account Selling or another established sales methodology
Highly trusted individual who maintains and expects high standards for self and team
Self-starter with a high level of commitment and energy

job_title: AWS Managed Services (AMS) Business Development Lead, ASEAN
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. Whether customers are new to AWS, or already operating at scale, AWS Managed Services (AMS) is focused on helping customers accelerate and scale their value realization through the provision of best practice cloud operations capabilities that reduce complexities and cost, and transforms their operational and financial business models.

AWS is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) team in ASEAN. The role will be responsible for working with both in-country AWS sales & cross functional teams, to (i) define and deliver internal AMS enablement & sales collateral (ii) drive continued growth of the AMS partner network (iii) implement effective and targeted customer acquisition programs (iv) win new AMS customer and assist with the growth of existing AMS customers. Collaboration with local and regional cross functional teams such as AWS partner team, professional services, and sales will be essential to success. In addition, this role will support ongoing internal product and process improvement, manage all associated regional reporting requirements, support key customer and partner engagements, and act as the regional point of contact for internal and external escalations.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and IT background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels of large Enterprises and Enterprise partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of cloud computing and managed cloud services to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses and the business process changes required to adopt cloud technology at scale. The ideal candidate will be a strong sales hunter with will be familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, Enterprise applications, ITIL, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, and has a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to Enterprises and Enterprise Partners.

Key job responsibilities
. Work with the AWS sales leads & teams to define, build and deploy targeted sales campaigns around the AMS offering
. Support existing AMS partners, and lead the recruitment and activation of new AMS partners
. Support all aspects of the customer engagement and AMS sales cycle, meeting with senior level (CxO) customer contacts to discuss their business issues and explore how AMS can address and resolve these issues.
. Serve as an evangelist for the new service within AWS, and externally
. Establish metrics to measure and track related to adoption of the service, and field seller awareness with a continual focus on improving the approach based on those measurements.
. Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and metrics
Basic Qualifications :
. Business or technology degree / qualifications
. 10+ years of sales / program / product management experience
. Demonstrated strong communications skills, as well as leadership skills
. Experience selling cloud services and platforms (IaaS / PaaS / SaaS)

Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience in selling technical cloud services or software technology products
. Experience in selling outsourcing and or managed services
. Experience working with CXO and selling large strategic projects
. Previous experience working for a global technology company

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow.

You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship.

You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Cloud Computing is revolutionizing Information Technology. Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS customers can requisition compute power, storage, and other services-gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as their business demands them. Customers pay only for what they use, with no up-front expenses or long-term commitments, making AWS the most cost-effective, flexible way to deliver their applications to their customers and clients.

Since 2006 AWS is the leader in the global IaaS cloud computing space and is continually growing. Would you like to be a central part of a Talent Acquisition team that is responsible for fuelling the rapid growth of AWS globally Are you a builder Do you thrive in high growth ambiguous environments Are you a process oriented data driven techncial recruiter / talent partner who loves to dive deep to fix complex operational challenges allowing for greater scalability and global impact

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Recruiting team is seeking a talented, customer-focused Techncial Talent Specialsit to identify and assess top technical talent for AWS Professional Services / Technology Consulting teams across APJ but with a specific focus on the Japanese market. As a Talent Acquisition Specialist will partner closely with their hiring managers to provide guidance on addressable talent pools and market conditions, create customized sourcing strategies, build pipelines, and source top candidates for complex customer facing technical roles. The candidate must be able to successfully manage, prioritize and close searches against a timeline and have experience setting benchmarks, metrics, and understand how to prioritize to hit all customer SLAs. They thrive in an innovative, fast-paced environment, can roll up their sleeves, work hard, have fun, and get the job done. They will draw on extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition and functional areas of the business, forging dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners. They have a reputation for being exceptional at candidate generation, client/account management, organization, possess strong verbal and written communication skills, have an ability to prioritize their time, demonstrate pushback and a sense of urgency, and understand the value of providing amazing customer service.

Core Responsibilities: -
. Partner with hiring teams to build effective sourcing, assessment, and closing approaches with an ability to manage customer/partner expectations through a deep understanding of the market.
. Must be able to understand how to recruit passive candidates and possess the mentality to profile people and gauge chemistry of candidates for fit and understand their motivation rather than sell a role.
. Build and maintain network of potential candidates through pro-active market research and on-going relationship management conducts in-depth interviews of potential candidates, demonstrating ability to anticipate hiring manager preferences through high offer-to-interview ratios.
. Drive simplification and contribute to increase productivity across the team
. Agility to adapt the portfolio according to the capacity planning to ensure the team is adequately staffed to prevent drops in productivity or support
. Support and drive the roadmap for the AWS APJC Talent Acquisition team and partner with teams outside of the APJC region to make sure we are aligned in supporting the global AWS businesses
. Recommend ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within AWS/Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer.
. Participate in special projects/recruiting initiatives, including assessment of best practices in interviewing techniques, leveraging of internal sources of talent and identification of top performers for senior-level openings.

Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of corporate/in-house and or search firm recruiting experience including sourcing and full life cycle recruiting with a focus on technnical roles.
. Native or Business fluent Japanese & English (both written & spoken) language skills.
. Experience building and utilizing a variety of sourcing plans and tools, including proactive phone and internet research.
. CTS/ATS experience with sourcing, tracking and managing candidates - MS Office - including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
. Experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and client relationships.
. Self-sufficient and able to work with little direct supervision.
. Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, as a team leader and member.
Preferred Qualifications :
. Strong client focus and commitment to continuous improvement ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, must pursue conscious cost-containment efforts in recruiting, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customers.
. Possess strong analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team.
. Leadership experience managing recruiters and coordinators.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

company: Seagate Singapore International Headquarters Pte. Ltd.
tech_stack: requirement gathering  Cloud  Integration Testing  hris database management  Maintenance  HR Project Management  systems configuration  Project Management  production deployment  Hris
job_description:
About our group:
The Seagate HR Information Systems Team develops and implements information system plans that meet our HR automation, data and digital records requirements. Using a cloud-based HR systems, we provide an integrated technology platform with simple self-service and reporting capability.
We manage our global HR management system and perform system configuration. We work closely with HR product and Service Centers and act as technical liaison between HR, our internal IT teams and HR systems vendors.
About the role - you will:
Participate in the execution of requirement gathering, testing and production deployment for global HR cloud-based human resource system.
Participated in HR cloud-based human resource system test cases data entry and integration testing.
Perform configuration changes in HR cloud-based human resource system and deploy the changes into production using SLDC methodology.
Provide HR systems interface related maintenance and support such as form configuration, system setup and mass updates.
Developing reports to support troubleshooting, data analysis and mass update activities.
Plan and setup periodic programs and plans for human resource system.
Work with software vendors, internal and external stakeholders and ensure the development of proper requirements, testing, training, project timeline documentation for system use and maintenance.
Project manage system changes from requirements gathering to production deployment.
Possesses strong knowledge of Project Management Skills.
Possesses strong knowledge of MS Office Skills.
About you:
Able to develop and manage relationships with software vendors, internal and external stakeholders and ensure the development of proper requirements, testing, training, project timeline documentation for system use and maintenance.
Must be self-motivated, independent and a team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills, both oral and written.
Bachelor's degree: IT, Computer science or other Engineering majors.
Your experience includes:
Have at least 5 years experience in IT/HR system analyst gathering system requirements, performing HR related and/or system configuration, testing, production interface deployment for cloud base HR management system.
Experience with HR transformation project and participated actively in integration testing and production deployment for HR cloud-based human resource system configuration changes.
Have at least 5 years experience in providing HR systems interface related maintenance and support. Possess strong technical knowledge of HR cloud base management systems.
Have at least 5 years experience in managing, supporting and directing all phases of a HR cloud base system program/project or direct integration/interface from inception to completion.
Ability to conduct knowledge transfer and sharing sessions with junior members and peers of the team.
Have strong knowledge of general IT principles related to development changes, testing cycles, and deployment strategies.
Strong project management skills in both HR and IT related payroll projects, configuration changes, interface changes and HR transformation projects.
Possesses strong knowledge of MS Office Skills.
SAP SuccessFactors
Location:
The Shugart site (named after Seagate's founder, Al Shugart) is a research and design center. Easily accessible from the One-North MRT station, many employees choose to take mass-transportation to work. Ample free on-site parking is also available. Being a purpose built building, The Shugart has excellent employee recreational facilities. Take an active break at our badminton courts, table tennis tables, in-house gym and recreation rooms. Our yogo and zumba classes are very popular. We also offer classes and interest groups in photography, gardening and foreign languages, and have various on-site celebrations, and community volunteer opportunities.

job_title: Strategic Partnership Lead, Global System Integrators, Google Cloud - Singapore
tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Solutioning  Partner Management  Professional Services  Leadership  Investments  Risk Management  Channel  Financial Markets  Strategy  Digitization  Advocate  Talent Assessment  Regulatory Requirements  strategic partnerships  Africa
job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Strategic Partnership Lead, Global System Integrators, Google Cloud - Singapore
Google Cloud teams work with schools, companies, and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile, and collaborative. On this team, you will drive Google Cloud business relationships by analyzing partner business performance, identifying methods of increasing partner and Google returns, pitching ideas to and identifying opportunities within partners, and coordinating across Google teams to deliver. You will educate our partners on the power of Google Cloud and enable them to be successful in driving innovation to our customers.
Additional Role Description:
As a Strategic Partner Manager focusing on Deloitte, you will hold a holistic view of channel business and you will collaborate with different teams within the Google organization. You will also establish and maintain business execution with Google's partners.
Responsibilities:
- Orchestrate various resources within Google's organization to support capacity planning and partner recruitment activities to create and maintain a long-term, scalable channel model.
- Develop and maintain business plans with focus partners to establish clear, mutual commitments around marketing, skills development, and sales, incorporating the rhythm of the relationship.
- Grow implementation of commitments and goals established in the business plan and maintain a clear view of the business goals.
- Work and review with partners to maintain pipeline as indicated by velocity and coverage ratio versus the established business goals. Hold reviews with Partner Sales teams to identify best practices.
- Implement broker internal resources, tools, references and/or investments on the business plans in order to help partners work towards business goals.
Minimum qualifications:
- 8 years of experience in a business-to-business (B2B) sales, software vendor, or consultancy role.
- 5 years of experience managing professional services engagements and working with resellers/partners on cloud projects.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience working with cloud platforms in Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS).
- Experience in managing partner businesses, by working through pipeline, sales, and deployment cycle.
- Experience advocating business software, with the ability to advocate cloud computing platforms and services.
- Ability to navigate in ambiguous work environments.
- Effective communication, leadership, and presentation skills, with the ability to collaborate in a multi-regional, dynamic team.

Job Description :

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. AWS elastic compute (EC2) platform is at the core of what most AWS customers are using today to change their business models and solve complex business challenges.

AWS is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) to drive the AWS Graviton business and Go-To- Market (GTM) strategy. Graviton is a highly strategic initiative for AWS, as developing our own silicon in-house provides AWS with additional flexibility to deliver new instances at a faster cadence, providing customers with more choice, targeted performance, and cost optimizations as their workloads continue to evolve. The BDM will be responsible for defining, building, and deploying effective and targeted programs to accelerate broad based sales and business development activities for Graviton instances. The BDM will facilitate the enablement of business development, sales and solution architecture with specific customer centric value propositions and will directly interface with product management and development teams regarding customer and partner requirements. The BDM will synthe data and information gathered from these engagements into succinct findings, derive strategic insights, and persuasively communicate findings and perspectives to product and sales teams, including senior management.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and IT background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels of large Enterprises and Enterprise partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of AWS compute resources, platforms and frameworks in the AWS cloud to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, Enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, business operations, and has a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to Enterprises and Enterprise Partners.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Defines, builds and deploys enterprise focused sales and business development campaigns around the AWS Core EC2 offerings
. Engages, supports and scales business development and sales teams across AWS to be capable of delivering the EC2 value proposition to enterprise customers and partners
. Engages and drives scale at engaging enterprise customers and partners about the AWS EC2 value proposition
. Exhibits proactive ability and expertise in setting customer discussions via AWS sales and partner teams
. Exhibits expertise and drives field and partner readiness for enterprise customers
. Engages in senior level customer meetings to discuss customer's business issues and explores how the AWS EC2 platform can help address and resolve these issues
. Serves as an evangelist for the AWS EC2 platform within AWS, and externally
. Develops a standard market intelligence framework and dynamic analytic model to be utilized by the AWS Sales, Business Development and marketing teams
. Brings the various stakeholders together to help build collective mindshare in augmenting the service
. Establishes ways to measure and track metrics related to adoption of the AWS EC2 instances and services, and to make improvements to the approach based on those measurements
. Prepares and gives business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and metrics.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of experience with cloud computing technologies at scale and engaging with customers from start-ups to large fortune 100 enterprises
. Experience with cloud computing and or related fields (IT, software, etc.) - Experience with CPUs and Enterprise servers
. Solid enterprise negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key

Preferred Qualifications :
. Good understanding of ARM CPU Architecture & software ecosystem
. Experience with data center implementations

job_title: Head of Data Analytics Solutions Architect, APJ
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

AWS is looking for an experienced and motivated technical leader to build and manage a team of technically skilled, customer facing Solutions Architects focusing on Analytics in APJ. You will help develop the industry's best cloud based solutions architects by enabling and coaching them on best practices, specialized solution selling, presentation and speaking skills, as well as how to create and present architectures of widely varying and complexity for our specialized services. Working closely with our engineering teams, you will help enable new capabilities for our customers to develop and deploy workloads on AWS.
In this role, you will need to be technically capable and credible in your own right as well as effective in shaping the customer and solutions focused skills of your team. You must enjoy learning and introducing new technologies in order to help colleagues and customers embrace and adopt new solutions. Furthermore, thought leadership in terms of looking beyond the technology and considering the value technology creates for our customers, and helping to change how technology is viewed are important aspects of the role. You will need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other Specialized Organization teams within AWS such as services teams, field solutions architecture, sales, marketing, partner organizations, business development, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management. You should be passionate about helping companies/partners understand best practices for operating on AWS.

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:
. Enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You will have a passion for educating, training, and enabling cloud solutions experts for a diverse and challenging set of customers
. Have a strong understanding of emerging technology solutions. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a Solutions Architect or similar role and managing a team of Solutions Architects and Solution Architect Managers. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions.

Roles and Responsibilities:
. In partnership with the specialized sales teams, formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives
. Hire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions Architects and Managers
. Coach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
. Step into a Solutions Architect role when required to support our customer base
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community
. Guide and motivate the development of whitepapers, data sheets, and other high-value customer facing guidance and best practices

Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree
. Leadership experience in a technical, customer-facing role in the technology industry

Preferred Qualifications :
. 10+ years of technical design/implementation /consulting experience in the technology industry
. MBA/Technical Master's Degree
. Commitment to promoting a diverse and inclusive culture where all Amazonians and customers are able to participate fully, and enjoy respect and dignity
. Exceptional people-management skills able to inspire and foster the right behaviors in others through leading by example (Player/Coach)
. Experience working with new product/service development teams
. Experience leading leaders
. Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS
. Achieved Associate and/or Professional AWS certifications
. Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
. Experience deploying large-scale production quality systems
. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, developers, and at large events
. Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
. Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
. Track record of building rapport with senior customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO)
. Motivated self-starter, proactive and action-oriented
. Strategic problem solving and collaboration skills
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrix organization (leveraging multiple functions and teams)
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_title: Japanese Speaking Tech Recruiter - 1 Year FTC
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Cloud Computing is revolutionizing Information Technology. Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS customers can requisition compute power, storage, and other services-gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as their business demands them. Customers pay only for what they use, with no up-front expenses or long-term commitments, making AWS the most cost-effective, flexible way to deliver their applications to their customers and clients.

Since 2006 AWS is the leader in the global IaaS cloud computing space and is continually growing. Would you like to be a central part of a Talent Acquisition team that is responsible for fuelling the rapid growth of AWS globally Are you a builder Do you thrive in high growth ambiguous environments Are you a process oriented data driven techncial recruiter / talent partner who loves to dive deep to fix complex operational challenges allowing for greater scalability and global impact

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Recruiting team is seeking a talented, customer-focused Techncial Talent Specialsit to identify and assess top technical talent for AWS Professional Services / Technology Consulting teams across APJ but with a specific focus on the Japanese market. As a Talent Acquisition Specialist will partner closely with their hiring managers to provide guidance on addressable talent pools and market conditions, create customized sourcing strategies, build pipelines, and source top candidates for complex customer facing technical roles. The candidate must be able to successfully manage, prioritize and close searches against a timeline and have experience setting benchmarks, metrics, and understand how to prioritize to hit all customer SLAs. They thrive in an innovative, fast-paced environment, can roll up their sleeves, work hard, have fun, and get the job done. They will draw on extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition and functional areas of the business, forging dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners. They have a reputation for being exceptional at candidate generation, client/account management, organization, possess strong verbal and written communication skills, have an ability to prioritize their time, demonstrate pushback and a sense of urgency, and understand the value of providing amazing customer service.

Core Responsibilities: -
. Partner with hiring teams to build effective sourcing, assessment, and closing approaches with an ability to manage customer/partner expectations through a deep understanding of the market.
. Must be able to understand how to recruit passive candidates and possess the mentality to profile people and gauge chemistry of candidates for fit and understand their motivation rather than sell a role.
. Build and maintain network of potential candidates through pro-active market research and on-going relationship management conducts in-depth interviews of potential candidates, demonstrating ability to anticipate hiring manager preferences through high offer-to-interview ratios.
. Drive simplification and contribute to increase productivity across the team
. Agility to adapt the portfolio according to the capacity planning to ensure the team is adequately staffed to prevent drops in productivity or support
. Support and drive the roadmap for the AWS APJC Talent Acquisition team and partner with teams outside of the APJC region to make sure we are aligned in supporting the global AWS businesses
. Recommend ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within AWS/Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer.
. Participate in special projects/recruiting initiatives, including assessment of best practices in interviewing techniques, leveraging of internal sources of talent and identification of top performers for senior-level openings.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of corporate/in-house and or search firm recruiting experience including sourcing and full life cycle recruiting with a focus on technnical roles.
. Native or Business fluent Japanese & English (both written & spoken) language skills.
. Experience building and utilizing a variety of sourcing plans and tools, including proactive phone and internet research.
. CTS/ATS experience with sourcing, tracking and managing candidates - MS Office - including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
. Experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and client relationships.
. Self-sufficient and able to work with little direct supervision.
. Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, as a team leader and member.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Strong client focus and commitment to continuous improvement ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, must pursue conscious cost-containment efforts in recruiting, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customers.
. Possess strong analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team.
. Leadership experience managing recruiters and coordinators.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_description:
Our team, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, is looking for impact-focused, entrepreneurial engineers ready to bring their ideas and make a difference. We apply our engineering skills and business savvy to solve challenges at the intersection of business and innovation in many of today's most exciting industries and products. These include Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Games, Workplace, AI and many more.

We are engineers, and we write scalable, high performance code across Meta's products to ship new solutions that address partners opportunities and challenges. We also design and deliver technical solutions critical to our partners success. In doing so, we help partners realize the full value of working with the Meta family of apps focusing on helping them grow their business with us while reducing the effort and investment to leverage our platforms.

As a Partner Engineer, you will get the opportunity to see the business impact of the solutions you build with our partners. You will get to learn and build on different tech stacks and languages. You will use your entrepreneurial passion and the freedom that the role provides to create your own opportunities and choose how you make an impact. In short, it's like being the engineering lead in a startup.

Partner Engineer: This role includes a combination of partner-facing time to understand their technical and business needs and then code solutions to address those needs. That coding output can be in the form of APIs, product integrations or tools to help partners and Meta achieve mutually beneficial outcomes.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Deeply understand Meta apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation
Deeply understand Meta apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Guide workflow changes, and gain consensus from stakeholders while driving toward solutions
Respond and maintain effective communication with industry partners and internal stakeholders
Work with partners to develop a long- term strategic plan, grounded on business objectives, and manage partners during integrations with Meta's platform products and ensure value creation
Represent Meta and our products, APIs and tools in partner meetings and industry events including F8
Understand organisational structure and cross functional team dynamics and is able to get support from those teams as needed
Build and manage strong working relationships with technical counterparts. Mentor and share knowledge with peers, creating positive atmosphere amongst team
Willingness to travel approximately 20% of the time
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of experience as a software engineer building and shipping products or equivalent experience
Experience with open source languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin, Rust, Go or C#
Knowledge of the Web technology stack (for example HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS) on front and backend
Experience with software design and architecture
Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Write and ship reliable, scalable, and efficient code
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Client/partner-facing and/or experience communicating to an audience is preferred
Experience with REST APIs, developer platforms and SDKs
Experience working on multi-person code bases including open source or personal projects
Experience with open source contributions (especially as part of larger projects)
Experience contributing to developer and platform documentation
Experience working with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience working in Android codebases.
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible todaybeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

job_description:
We are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our Technology Architecture & Policy team to participate together with operations and development in the entire development lifecycle, from design through the development process to productions support.
This incumbent will make use of the many techniques and tools typically characterized by operations and development functions, to positively impact our end-users.
We also recognize that each individual has a unique blend of skills. Whether your strength is in web application, architecture implementation or cloud computing, we want to talk to you.
Responsibilities
You will bring in new ideas, change, evolve, improve and simplify our infrastructure and services
You will develop and optimize existing features, as well as prototype and implement new projects
You have leverage knowledge in DevOps leading practices across platforms, systems and applicable use cases in influencing other teams and broader Engineering groups
You will guide and support less-experienced team members as mentor and improving the team productivity across teams
You will work with multiple engineering teams and supporting the development, build, test, release, and operations phases through innovative use of the latest technologies
You will work in an Agile environment (Scrum, XP), and be part of the continuous improvement of the Digital Operation Team
You will architect, design, and implement new sections/features/content/ improvements for existing digital channels
You will build and maintain scalable and high performing web sites and solutions, consistent with our quality and branding guidelines
You will design and develop automation workflows, perform unit tests and conduct review to make sure work is rigorously designed, elegantly coded, and effectively tuned
Requirements
You will need a Bachelor's in Computer Engineering or equivalent
You will need minimum 4 years of experience in DevOps
You should have knowledge of web applications, architecture implementation (HTTP, Middleware, Micro-services,), NoSQL technology (set up, deployment and maintenance) and content delivery and virtualization
You should have knowledge in HTML and client-side scripting libraries and framework (Javascript, Jquery, AngularJS, etc)
You should have experience in cloud computing services e.g. Microsoft Azure and server side Javascript environment (NodeJS, Express, Gulp, Grunt, Sails, Strongloop)
You should have strong analytical skills to provide support on applications within scope
Benefits
Competitive salaries
Flexi Benefits
Staggered working hours
Medical Insurance
Corporate Mobile Plans
Singapore Pools welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, helping us in contributing back to the society. So, feel free to express who you are, and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!
Singapore Pools was established by the Government on 23 May 1968 to provide safe and trusted betting to counter illegal gambling. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of Singapore Pools surplus is channeled to Tote Board to fund a wide range of causes in social service, community development, sports, the arts, education and health. Currently, Singapore Pools contributes about $2 billion annually to the Government in the form of taxes and duties, and for the funding of good causes.

tech_stack: Mac  adobe creative cloud  Cms  Press Releases  Designer  Adaptive  Strategy Development  Social Media  Listings  usps  Entrepreneurship  Content Marketing  Writing  wellbeing  Content Development  Storyboarding
job_description:
JOB TITLE: Content Writer
Links to: Marketing Manager
WHO ARE WE
Nexus is an empowering, learning-focused community. We strive to create an honest, open and innovative community with our learners, parents and peers. We believe that we have something unique and special here, we are proud to be different in the way we work; and how we teach and learn.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR
At Nexus, we do things differently. Each member of staff is valued and recognised as a unique individual collaborating as part of a supportive community, to elevate one another with innovative ideas. Our strategies emerge from the collective positive mindsets of our colleagues. You will experience high levels of ownership and empowerment in your role.
JOB DESCRIPTION
The Content Writer will work in one of the busiest and most dynamic teams within the school. The Marketing team works closely together and are passionate in putting ideas forward and watching their projects flourish. Team members are expected to be innovative, collaborative and creative. You must be supportive and helpful, with a can-do attitude.
The Nexus School environment requires you to be highly flexible and adaptive to meet the demands of the business. We are looking for someone with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and manage the content marketing plan to promote all aspects of the school in line with the strategic marketing direction, objectives and KPIs
Proactively research story ideas to promote all aspects of the school life, stories that would work as editorial/advertorial content, social posts or videos
Collaborate with relevant academic staff members and other school community members to keep informed of the latest happenings and events to promote the school.
Liaise with key academic stakeholders to gain support in writing article content
Research relevant external sources where it would prove valuable for Nexus to communicate its brand message to its prospective parents i.e. listings & parents sites
Video storyboarding - develop content storyboards for all internal & external video shoots in creating new video content to promote the school. In line with the content marketing plan.
Take ownership of creating the new Nexus News, Blog & Podcast initiative to engage with our prospective parents. Manage the content plan to ensure it remains active
Develop & write relevant e-guides as lead magnets to get prospective parents details to nurture them as new admissions leads
Take ownership of the entire content development process from concept idea, research, writing, editing, approvals from key stakeholders to submission.
Ensure that all content on the Nexus website and other external websites remains current, relevant and accurate
Liaise with the designer to create supporting visuals to elevate the content
Write and proofread content for all marketing collaterals i.e., website, social media posts, prospectus, newsletters, emails, digital ads and documents and send to relevant media channels and external parties etc.
Manage all social media handles to post content as per the content plan
Research and analysis the content communicated by our competitors to look for gaps to promote our USPs
Support the Marketing Manager in writing press releases when appropriate and manage the relationship with the media to disseminate information
Support the Marketing Manager in updating the Monthly Management Report with the relevant updates i.e., content executed that month.
Contribute to annual marketing planning and strategy development
Recording budget expenditure in a timely manner to track budget spend
Involvement in whole school events and activities as required
Setting, communicating and maintaining timelines and priorities on every project
Managing supplier relationships
Undertake other ad hoc projects/tasks as yet by the marketing manager or other relevant stakeholders.
A TYPICAL DAY
It's Monday morning and our team is kicking off with our weekly briefing. We use this time to catch-up, feedback and ensure that we are sharing the workload of the department. This is an exciting week as we are creating a video so we are just putting on the finishing touches to our set and ensuring the staff and children are confident with what we will capture. My busy morning ends with wrapping up a press article for one of our media partners that we have written about a learner's entrepreneurship programme.
My afternoon is dedicated to cross-checking our campaign performance with our media agency data and our Social, Google Console and Analytics data. We are looking for gaps and make slight improvements to ad word copy and refreshing some creatives. I will then review, plan and schedule the social media posts for the next few days. I've set some time with the team at the end of the day to brainstorm an event idea for our upcoming Global Goals Week.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
A minimum diploma/degree in Marketing/Business Communications/Public Relations
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience and knowledge of content marketing or as a writer for any publication/media.
Excellent written and oral communication and oral presentation skills
Significant marketing/public relations/event management experience
Adobe Creative Cloud knowledge an advantage
Knowledge of CMS systems
A high command of the English language
Be highly creative
Be able to be self motivated
Have a passion for marketing and social media
An eye for detail
Be able to work in a fast paced environment, meeting deadlines
Good IT skills and knowledge for example, proficient in Mac and Microsoft applications
A demonstrated and genuine liking and appreciation of children
Excellent financial analytical skills
Ability to function in a fast-paced environment and embrace the company's corporate philosophy
Excellent and established leadership and organizational skills
Professional and flexible attitude towards change and continuous improvement is essential
Good sense of humour
An understanding of the needs and demands of all stakeholders.
Nexus International School (Singapore) is committed to the safety and wellbeing of our children and families.
Nexus endorses the Convention on the Rights of the Child, which Singapore ratified on 11 December 2008, and establishes a clear policy and guidelines to protect our learners from maltreatment by any person or persons who come in contact with them in any environment.
Nexus International School (Singapore) is an equal opportunity employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and value the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our school.
Whilst every effort has been made to explain the main duties and responsibilities, the role may be revised from time to time.
If you are interested, please submit your application through the following link: https://careers.taylors.edu.my/job/Content-Writer/7470144/

tech_stack: Cloud Security  Computer Networking  Customer Success  Network Security  Relationship Management  Cross Functional Relationships  Program Management  Portfolio Management  Customer Service  Excellent Interpersonal Communication Skills
job_description:
About Us
At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.
We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!
What you'll do
You will work alongside our Partner, Area Sales and Customer Success leadership to ensure we successfully scale Cloudflare's strategic partnerships across APJC to benefit our existing customers and growth goals. You will bring strong partner building & relationship building experience, alongside proven organizational & program management skills, and an appropriate level of product knowledge and understanding of the APJC region.
Working hand in hand with the regional partner leads, you will build and ensure a deep ongoing understanding of the Partner's business and be an internal champion of the requirements, features, functions and services most critical to their specific business needs. You are ultimately responsible for the dollar net retention (DNR), enabling growth, and the NPS for your partner led book of business; this is driven through demonstrating the value of the products and services provided to the partner's business via quarterly reviews and ensuring we are continually improving the partner experience on an ongoing basis against any identified areas of for the benefit of of our Enterprise customers, and ensuring the partner's satisfaction with Cloudflare's services.
This is a pivotal leadership function within our APJC Customer Success organization and the role reports directly to the APJC Vice President for Customer Success, as well as being a member of the APJC CSLT.
Additional responsibilities will include:
Manage the partnership life cycle which includes initial launch and technical integrations or enablement, maintaining a healthy steady state, quarterly product roadmaps and executive alignment, and renewal of the partnership.
Work with your partner account team to plan and execute long term account plans to facilitate retention and growth via product and new business unit expansion.
Develop and maintain long-term relationships with stakeholders in your account portfolio.
Work cross-functionally with Partnerships, Product, Engineering, SRE, Marketing and other teams to resolve partner business issues and work towards their stated goals.
Manage partner feedback and product needs by providing feature requests to internal teams.
< 25% travel
Skills, knowledge and experience
5+ years of experience in a Partner Management/Partner Success role servicing large service partners and experience of partner implementation and management best practices.
Experience with program management and partner/account portfolio planning and prioritization.
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and perform effectively under pressure.
Strong relationship management and interpersonal communication skills (verbal and written) as well as executive presence.
Track record of successful planning and execution of Executive Business Reviews.
Basic understanding of computer networking and how the internet works.
Curiosity to learn about the cloud security and performance industry.
Understanding of application, server, and network security is a plus.
What Makes Cloudflare Special
We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.
Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.
Athenian Project: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.
Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.
1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.
Sound like something you'd like to be a part of We'd love to hear from you!
This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.
Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.
Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at [HIDDEN TEXT] or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

job_description:
Technology Auditor AVP
Singapore
As a Barclays Technology Auditor AVP, you will report to the Director of Technology Audit in India. You will be responsible for collaborating and supporting the Technology Audit Lead in Singapore to define the appropriate coverage strategy and the audit plan for Barclays Asia Technology and Operations. You will take into consideration the Audit Risk appetite, current and future business environments, regulatory requirements and resourcing levels within the function.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.
What will you be doing
Supporting the execution of audit work and delivering quality outputs within the defined timelines
Working with business audit teams to map out the key technology controls within business processes and testing them using data analytics
Supporting and at times performing continuous monitoring of relevant areas in technology, information and cyber security
Supporting the follow-up and assessment of the resolution of audit issues and providing complete, accurate and timely information for audit reporting
Contributing to evaluating the management control approach and control environment of relevant business areas
Taking on additional tasks as requested by Tech Lead/Director / Managing Director in APAC
Building and developing ongoing relationships with clients on each engagement and developing wide networks across the business
Performing Line Manager responsibilities to motivate and help develop and grow direct reports and wider team members
What we're looking for:
Bachelor's Degree or Masters in Computer Science
Familiar with one or more topic in data analytics, cyber security, business continuity and resiliency, outsourcing, cloud computing or infrastructure platforms
Good understanding of electronic trading platforms supporting the Global Markets business as well as Investment Banking platforms
Practical knowledge of technology risk and control, including application controls and/or technology processes (e.g. SDLC or ITIL)
Skills that will help you in the role:
A professional qualification relevant to technology and information risk management (e.g. CIA, CISA, CISM, CISSP)
Knowledge on new and emerging financial products and services, especially in the Markets business
Knowledge about new and emerging technologies such as cloud infrastructure, cryptocurrencies and AI / machine learning
Experience or knowledge of performing data analytics using Python (Pandas module) and SQL. Proficiency in VB scripts, PowerShell is an advantage
Where will you be working
Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a city in a garden. Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

job_description:
Business Function Overview:
Microsoft's Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+IDatacenter Site Operations Manager,you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform.
Empower Billions!
Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.
With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of ourdatacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-classcloud provider.
Be at the forefront of the action in CO+Ias part of our global datacenter operations.
#COICareers #Buildthecloud #Changetheworld #WeSeeYou #RepresentationMatters

The Site Operations Manager (SOM) will act as the Microsoft single point of contact for all site operations issues and escalations. The SOM will work closely with the Microsoft appointed operational partners and vendors to deliver best in class services to our onlinecloud services customers. As such, the SOM will act as the on-site Microsoft representative and will provide guidance and direction on all Microsoftdatacenterpolicies, procedures, and operational requirements. Occasional regional and international travel will be required.
Core responsibilities will include but not limited to:
Technical leadforall IT queries and issues relating to site logistics, deployments and break/fix activities.
Organize and prioritize IT tasks and projects within their data center(s).
Develop and maintain proactive relationships with the leased facility landlord, IT service providers, and partner support teams at the datacenter.
Planning and supervision of all supporting physical infrastructure, logistics, and resources required to provide cloud capacity to our internal customers.
Supervision and quality control of ongoing IT maintenance support for all service lines to meet pre-defined SLAs.
Single point of contact for incidents at their datacenters that impact Microsoft cloud services and the proactive and timely resolution of such incidents.
Implementing and overseeing all security and compliance policies for their datacenters to ensure all local systems meet the requirements set down by Microsoft internal security and compliance teams.
Contribute to regional and global improvement programs as required.
Assist with the review and approval of OPEX and CAPEX budgets, spend, vendor resourcing models, and reconciliation of same.
