job_title: Head of Data Analytics Solutions Architect, APJ
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

AWS is looking for an experienced and motivated technical leader to build and manage a team of technically skilled, customer facing Solutions Architects focusing on Analytics in APJ. You will help develop the industry's best cloud based solutions architects by enabling and coaching them on best practices, specialized solution selling, presentation and speaking skills, as well as how to create and present architectures of widely varying and complexity for our specialized services. Working closely with our engineering teams, you will help enable new capabilities for our customers to develop and deploy workloads on AWS.
In this role, you will need to be technically capable and credible in your own right as well as effective in shaping the customer and solutions focused skills of your team. You must enjoy learning and introducing new technologies in order to help colleagues and customers embrace and adopt new solutions. Furthermore, thought leadership in terms of looking beyond the technology and considering the value technology creates for our customers, and helping to change how technology is viewed are important aspects of the role. You will need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other Specialized Organization teams within AWS such as services teams, field solutions architecture, sales, marketing, partner organizations, business development, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management. You should be passionate about helping companies/partners understand best practices for operating on AWS.

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:
. Enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You will have a passion for educating, training, and enabling cloud solutions experts for a diverse and challenging set of customers
. Have a strong understanding of emerging technology solutions. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a Solutions Architect or similar role and managing a team of Solutions Architects and Solution Architect Managers. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions.

Roles and Responsibilities:
. In partnership with the specialized sales teams, formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives
. Hire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions Architects and Managers
. Coach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
. Step into a Solutions Architect role when required to support our customer base
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community
. Guide and motivate the development of whitepapers, data sheets, and other high-value customer facing guidance and best practices

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree
. Leadership experience in a technical, customer-facing role in the technology industry

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of technical design/implementation /consulting experience in the technology industry
. MBA/Technical Master's Degree
. Commitment to promoting a diverse and inclusive culture where all Amazonians and customers are able to participate fully, and enjoy respect and dignity
. Exceptional people-management skills able to inspire and foster the right behaviors in others through leading by example (Player/Coach)
. Experience working with new product/service development teams
. Experience leading leaders
. Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS
. Achieved Associate and/or Professional AWS certifications
. Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
. Experience deploying large-scale production quality systems
. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, developers, and at large events
. Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
. Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
. Track record of building rapport with senior customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO)
. Motivated self-starter, proactive and action-oriented
. Strategic problem solving and collaboration skills
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrix organization (leveraging multiple functions and teams)
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_title: Principal Business Development Manager, SAP on AWS, ASEAN
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.
AWS and SAP have been collaborating since SAP became a customer in 2008. Together, we have certified AWS to support most SAP solutions, brought purpose built EC2 instances to market to support SAP customer needs, and helped SAP leverage AWS services to power a number of their SaaS and PaaS offerings like Concur, SuccessFactors (for government agencies), HANA Enterprise Cloud (HEC), and SCP. AWS has been supporting SAP workloads for customers longer than any other cloud provider (since 2011), has more customers (5,000+ across all segments) than any other cloud provider, is certified to support the largest public cloud (native) SAP S/4HANA (48TB) and BW/4HANA (100TB) deployments, and has more SAP HANA cloud native certifications than other cloud providers (24 HANA certifications vs. 18 for Azure and 11 for GCP).

The SAP on AWS team engages SAP customers through 3 routes to market (RTM): the AWS field, consulting partners, and SAP. We are seeking an accomplished Business Development (BD) leader to build out a high performing BD team globally. The leader will contribute to the overall performance of the business globally measured by revenue growth, net new customers, and reference wins. The successful candidate will have overachieved throughout their career and built strong, deep relationships with F1000 and/or G2000 organizations. This leader will have a broad role - part market maker, part operator, and part general manager - and will build a strategy focused on winning new customer segments and growing existing customer segments for the long term. As a self-starter willing to operate in a multifaceted way, you should also have experience in market development of cloud infrastructure and/or enterprise applications. The right candidate must possess top of the line leadership skills with the ability to execute on key business initiatives. The role will require working with the overall ecosystem to help secure lighthouse customers for new use cases, build scalable go-to-market programs, and develop strategic partnerships. This is an exciting opportunity to drive the go-to-market definition and execution of AWS's strategy for SAP on AWS globally.

Our BD team drives strategic oversight of the GTM plan, sales plays (Migration, SAP Extend, S4HANA, Innovation), compete content, sales tools to build pipeline, field coordination of new service and feature launches, thought leadership white papers, act as the voice of the customer to the service teams, win lighthouse customers in key industries and geos, and support the field on the rapid close of complex deals.

Your responsibilities will include:

. As the voice of the customer, your findings will influence product teams to help them evolve the products and address issues, concerns, and requests from the field
. Analyze and determine key customer insights from business drivers, market trends and customer feedback, and operating metrics

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.
AWS and SAP have been collaborating since SAP became a customer in 2008. Together, we have certified AWS to support most SAP solutions, brought purpose built EC2 instances to market to support SAP customer needs, and helped SAP leverage AWS services to power a number of their SaaS and PaaS offerings like Concur, SuccessFactors (for government agencies), HANA Enterprise Cloud (HEC), and SCP. AWS has been supporting SAP workloads for customers longer than any other cloud provider (since 2011), has more customers (5,000+ across all segments) than any other cloud provider, is certified to support the largest public cloud (native) SAP S/4HANA (48TB) and BW/4HANA (100TB) deployments, and has more SAP HANA cloud native certifications than other cloud providers (24 HANA certifications vs. 18 for Azure and 11 for GCP).

The SAP on AWS team engages SAP customers through 3 routes to market (RTM): the AWS field, consulting partners, and SAP. We are seeking an accomplished Business Development (BD) leader to build out a high performing BD team globally. The leader will contribute to the overall performance of the business globally measured by revenue growth, net new customers, and reference wins. The successful candidate will have overachieved throughout their career and built strong, deep relationships with F1000 and/or G2000 organizations. This leader will have a broad role - part market maker, part operator, and part general manager - and will build a strategy focused on winning new customer segments and growing existing customer segments for the long term. As a self-starter willing to operate in a multifaceted way, you should also have experience in market development of cloud infrastructure and/or enterprise applications. The right candidate must possess top of the line leadership skills with the ability to execute on key business initiatives. The role will require working with the overall ecosystem to help secure lighthouse customers for new use cases, build scalable go-to-market programs, and develop strategic partnerships. This is an exciting opportunity to drive the go-to-market definition and execution of AWS's strategy for SAP on AWS globally.

Our BD team drives strategic oversight of the GTM plan, sales plays (Migration, SAP Extend, S4HANA, Innovation), compete content, sales tools to build pipeline, field coordination of new service and feature launches, thought leadership white papers, act as the voice of the customer to the service teams, win lighthouse customers in key industries and geos, and support the field on the rapid close of complex deals.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 7+ years of experience in BD customer facing roles in infrastructure or cloud technology

Job Description :
Job summary
AWS Cloud enables customers of all s and industries to run their applications on Amazon's cloud computing infrastructure, and to drive innovation which helps transform their businesses. The APJ SMB (Small-Medium Business) segment team is one of the most exciting, fast moving and diverse customer segments within AWS. Our role is to develop programs and drive initiatives across Sales, Partner and Marketing to support the growth objectives of our SMB customer segment across APJ.

The AWS Program Management team defines, builds, launches, and delivers the programs our global customers use every day. We are looking for an individual with experience in program strategy, roadmap development, prioritization and getting things done. S/he should be a self-starter that thrives in ambiguity with the ability to influence multi-functionally and the willingness to roll up sleeves to operate in a dynamic environment. The ideal candidate is someone with a demonstrated history of successfully owning and managing large, complex problems and engaging with cross-functional teams, and numerous stakeholders up to senior levels, directly and through influence.

As a Program Manager for APJ SMB, you'll be expected to focus on envisioning, experimenting, creating and operationalizing programs that will impact the APJ SMB customers at scale. You'll be responsible for anticipating bottlenecks, making tradeoffs, and welcoming an acceptable level of risk to maximize business benefit. You will own the execution and program management of strategic initiatives by collaborating with cross-functional work stream owners and reporting progress, updates, challenges, and solutions to leaders.

If you enjoy creating and managing programs that will have big impact on an organization, this is the role for you.

job_description:
The Challenge
The Inside Sales Representative (ISR) position is for a high-energy, result-oriented individual to support our Account Executives build strong customer relationships while driving net-new deals and growth on mid-cycle and renewing contracts with Territory Accounts in the Mid-market segment. The assigned solution sets are Adobe Document Cloud including Adobe Sign, Adobe Creative Cloud including Adobe Stock, and Adobe's eLearning/Publishing solutions.
We look to welcome upbeat and dedicated individuals to our team giving a fair and equal opportunity to all.
What You'll do
Conduct targeted outbound selling, articulating the Digital Media value proposition to mid-level and senior executives
Work with channel partners and multiple internal collaborators to support deal closure and customer happiness
Support the AEs in constructing deals in line with Adobe's target business goals, including coordinating relevant demos, building impactful presentations, crafting and following up contracts, legal terms, and acquiring required internal approvals
Establish and gain agreement around pricing by communicating compelling value-based justification for proposals
Qualify and follow up inbound leads and ad hoc requests from customers and prospects
Reflect deal progress and risks through the ongoing opportunity forecasting process and suggest alternative approaches.
What you need to succeed
Build and balance multiple relationships, customers at a time, paying attention to detail and representing Adobe in a professional manner to the customer. Work efficiently with aligned Territory Account Executives and other team members, including Sales Specialists, Solution Consultants, Customer Success Managers, Marketing, Sales Operations, Deal Desk and Channel Partners
Conduct effective research in order to understand customer industries/priorities. Produce high quality written communications and articulate the value proposition for all Digital Media solutions. Accurately assess and forecast all opportunities in a detailed, timely manner via Salesforce.com, contact all new leads in Salesforce within 24 hours, and qualify them.
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
If you're looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.
Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

job_description:
Job Description
Sprinklr is looking for an experienced security analyst with 5 years of work experience within the cyber security domain. You will work with key stakeholders across Sprinklr i.e. sales, success, legal and compliance teams to assist with cyber security, data privacy and compliance needs. Headquartered in New York City, with a development team based in India, you will be expected to work across time zones to drive a cohesive, world-class security operation.
Job Requirements
Respond to security RFPs and assessments in a timely manner.
Review security terms and collaborate with the legal team for contract execution.
Deliver security presentations to customers and upper management.
Evaluate security solutions to ensure they meet security requirements for processing classified information.
Perform risk assessment, customer on site audits and analysis to support certification and accreditation.
Prepare and review documentation to include system security plans, risk assessment reports, certification and accreditation packages.
Work with the security team and others in technology management to document priorities and structure project team activities to align with those priorities.
Maintain timely and proactive communication with management and other parties.
Prepare and present status reports, results, and presentations as required.
Develop an understanding of key company business processes and success drivers.
Maintain a solid understanding of cybersecurity principles and concepts.
Experience with compliance frameworks such as SSAE 18; PCI-DSS; ISO 27001; NIST, GDPR etc.
Skills & Competencies
3-5 years of experience within the cyber security domain in a high-tech/SaaS high-growth environment
Excellent verbal and written communications skills; comfortable to present to business and technical leadership at all levels
Experience with responding to customer RFPs/RFIs and questionnaires with efficiency and accuracy.
Knowledge of security certifications such as SOC, ISO27001, FedRAMP, PCI etc.
Experience with creating and maintaining security policies and procedures
Knowledgeable with cloud computing and cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure and GCP
Experience working with multiple time zones especially the US and India
Knowledge of OWASP and NIST is preferred
Any security accreditations such as CISSP, CompTIA+ would be good to have
Lastly but most importantly, you are methodical, detail oriented and a great teammate

job_description:
Do you want to join an exciting, fast paced and innovative team If you're excited about technology and helping Customers, Partners and external communities learn, if you like to see that lightbulb moment in others, come join us and put your skills to great use!
Skilling has never been more important than it is right now technology is changing every second of the day and companies need skilled employees to enable them to innovate and succeed.
Come join Worldwide Learning's Microsoft Technical Trainer team we help our customers realize their potential through their employees. Help guide our approach and be ready to join a group where all ideas are heard and providing technology education is job one.
In this role, you will spend your time educating employees from companies all over the world on our cloud services. We'll help you become a best-in-class technical trainer; you'll help us drive the right skills that enable our customers to succeed.
If you're already passionate about technology and motivating others and you relish the opportunity to help revolutionize what it means to skill and be skilled, then all that's left is for you to apply and help us empower every organization and individual to achieve more.
Responsibilities
In this role, you will motivate, engage and skill students on all our cloud services.
You should enjoy continually skilling yourself on the most innovative technologies relating to cloud computing.
You will provide feedback that improves and innovates our technical training content, lab exercises, presentations, and accompanying materials.
Through all the above, you will be a Microsoft Cloud Platform evangelist with customers, partners and external communities.
Qualifications
You will hold a Bachelor's degree or have equivalent work experience in computer science, engineering, or related technical fields.
Ideally you will hold a current Microsoft Certified Trainer qualification, but this is not required. If you don't and you're a great fit, we'll help you get one.
You will have conducted classroom training related to technology (can be in a non-work-related setting)
You will have a basic understanding of cloud computing concepts and solutions.
If you have hands-on experience with Microsoft's Cloud Solutions, then that's a bonus.
You will be a motivating communicator, able to help students turn abstract concepts into reality.
You should enjoy meeting people from all backgrounds, and have the ability to travel to engage them (0-25%)
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Job Description :
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, industrial equipment, automotive, aerospace, and others sectors. The rapid pace of innovation is driven by more and better access to computing resources, allowing unprecedented amounts of data to be analyzed in near real time on nearly infinite computational resources. Will the cure for cancer come out of a lab or out of a remote computing cluster Emerging technology like AI/ML, IoT, quantum computing, and autonomous systems are making new discoveries possible every day. Our job is to facilitate and support the innovators making those discoveries.

We are looking for a Senior Specialist, Autonomous Computing to join the Autonomous Computing (AC) go to market team. The AC team enables the at-scale development of autonomous systems that seek to improve productivity, safety, and customer operations in some of the most challenging use-cases. Examples of autonomous systems include mobility (autonomous vehicles, aerial taxis), smart electricity grids (demand response), robotics (situational awareness), supply chain (intelligent inventory management), and Industrial Internet (continuously learning digital twins of industrial equipment), and healthcare (diagnostic imaging, precision medicine, drug discovery).

In this role, you will work closely with customers to understand the requirements and complexities involved in developing their autonomous systems, with a particular emphasis on the use of simulations, machine learning, and/or accelerated computing (GPUs, FPGAs, custom ASICs) technologies. You will help define the next AC workloads to pursue, define go-to-market strategies and lead cross-functional initiatives to expand existing markets, develop adoption programs and identify new opportunities. These activities include sizing the market opportunity, identifying a pipeline of potential customers, working with customers to understand technical requirements for proof-of-concepts, creating content to train the field teams, leading external workshops to drive industry thought-leadership, working with product teams to define new features, and identifying partners or potential acquisitions.

The ideal candidate will have deep-domain expertise in one or more domains such as aviation, automotive, power & utilities, renewable energy, financial services, health care, life sciences, or other industry which benefits from autonomous systems. You have business experience to drive an engagement at the CxO/VP level, and have demonstrated program/product go-to-market expertise that will help you work with customers to identify use-cases that take advantage of the power of AWS storage, compute, networking, big data, machine learning, and IoT technologies. Additionally, the candidate will have demonstrated some level of hands-on experience either developing autonomous systems, creating and running simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, accelerating computing workloads on GPUs (or ASICs), and/or developing accelerators. The candidate has the technical depth to communicate the benefits of simulations to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives, while working backwards from customer requirements to suggest scalable solutions and architectures. The candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and being scrappy is a must.

Roles & Responsibilities
. Serve as a key team member of the Autonomous Computing team to identify, define and prioritize the AWS market segments, customer base, and industry verticals we target to achieve the most impactful outcomes
. Develop strategic go-to-market plans for target markets and ensure it is in line with the AWS strategic direction
. Execute the strategic go-to-market plans while working with key internal stakeholders (e. g. solutions architects, product service teams, sales teams, legal, support, etc.)
. Identify specific prospects/partners to approach while communicating the specific value proposition for their business and use case
. Engage with prospects, partners, cross functional teams, and key customers
. Work with customers to understand their Autonomous Systems workflows and how AWS technologies can enable their use-case
. Identify and promote repeatable use cases and case studies to build AWS internal and external market awareness
. Collaborate with internal teams to understand the technical requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings
. Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of our key markets
. Handle high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market

Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of business development, management consulting, strategic partnerships, enterprise sales, technology development, or program/product management experience
. 2+ years working experience developing and deploying simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, and/or developing accelerators
. Experience building Go-To-Market (GTM) plans that scale across an organization
. Deep knowledge of one or more industries that represent potential autonomous computing use-cases
. Experience interfacing with customers (Enterprise, SMB, and Startups) and solution building ability
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight that drives customer adoption and recommendations to the business
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must. Experience speaking at technology conferences, as well as communicating across the organization from technical staff to VP/CxOs.
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key in a matrix environment
. Business and/or technical degree required

Preferred Qualifications :
. M.S., PhD, MBA or other higher degree in a business or technical field
. Solid negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
. Meticulous attention to detail ability to juggle many tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar
. Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, innovative, and rapidly evolving industry and business organization
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

job_description:
Job Description
Sprinklr is looking for an experienced security analyst with 5 years of work experience within the cyber security domain. You will work with key stakeholders across Sprinklr i.e. sales, success, legal and compliance teams to assist with cyber security, data privacy and compliance needs. Headquartered in New York City, with a development team based in India, you will be expected to work across time zones to drive a cohesive, world-class security operation.
Job Requirements
Respond to security RFPs and assessments in a timely manner.
Review security terms and collaborate with the legal team for contract execution.
Deliver security presentations to customers and upper management.
Evaluate security solutions to ensure they meet security requirements for processing classified information.
Perform risk assessment, customer on site audits and analysis to support certification and accreditation.
Prepare and review documentation to include system security plans, risk assessment reports, certification and accreditation packages.
Work with the security team and others in technology management to document priorities and structure project team activities to align with those priorities.
Maintain timely and proactive communication with management and other parties.
Prepare and present status reports, results, and presentations as required.
Develop an understanding of key company business processes and success drivers.
Maintain a solid understanding of cybersecurity principles and concepts.
Experience with compliance frameworks such as SSAE 18; PCI-DSS; ISO 27001; NIST, GDPR etc.
Skills & Competencies
3-5 years of experience within the cyber security domain in a high-tech/SaaS high-growth environment
Excellent verbal and written communications skills; comfortable to present to business and technical leadership at all levels
Experience with responding to customer RFPs/RFIs and questionnaires with efficiency and accuracy.
Knowledge of security certifications such as SOC, ISO27001, FedRAMP, PCI etc.
Experience with creating and maintaining security policies and procedures
Knowledgeable with cloud computing and cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure and GCP
Experience working with multiple time zones especially the US and India
Knowledge of OWASP and NIST is preferred
Any security accreditations such as CISSP, CompTIA+ would be good to have
Lastly but most importantly, you are methodical, detail oriented and a great teammate

job_description:
Do NOT use the auto-apply feature. Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.
We are looking for a highly self-motivated individual who has a passion for graphic design, illustration and content creation along with a strong sense of design aesthetic and effective visual communication to join our growing Creative department.
Responsibilities:
Graphic content creation:
Use your creativity to execute fun and engaging graphic content for The Smart Local (TSL)s media platforms, including but not limited to infographics, photo manipulation, illustrated photo albums and comic strips
Ideate and propose graphic ideas that are on-brand and have viral potential
Draw content inspiration from social media platforms like Facebook, TikTok, Instagram, etc.
Conduct research and curate factual, relevant information that supports the content creation process
Take ownership of your entire creative process, from ideation and planning to execution and post-production
Collaborate with team members to produce graphic assets for other creative deliverables such as feature videos, short films, drama series and live streams.
Other graphic design related responsibilities:
To support the whole The Smart Local (TSL) Media Group with graphic design related tasks, including but not limited to:
Spearhead and develop the creative direction of branding campaigns as well as marketing collaterals in both physical and digital formats
Ideate, propose, and execute visual branding assets for companies under TSL Media Group
Monitor and maintain TSL Media Group's visual consistency
Requirements:
2+ years of graphic design experience
Experience working in creative agencies and/or high-growth startups (preferred)
Outstanding portfolio of completed design projects
Strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud Software (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
In-depth knowledge of the latest design styles and trends
Ability to work in an environment that is fast-paced and constantly changing
Good command of English
What sets you apart:
You have strong design aesthetics
You have outstanding design and illustration skills
You are self-driven and able to work independently with little supervision and assistance
You are highly organised and detail-oriented
You have data analysis and research skills
You are proficient in Motion Graphics
You spend way too much time on Facebook, TikTok and Twitter and have a strong understanding of social media content
You are not looking to be spoon fed
You are not a complain king/queen and have grit
You solve problems, not cause them
How to apply:
Your email application is essentially the first stage of your interview, so think of a way to make yourself stand out through your application. Use an informal conversational writing style and tell us over 3 paragraphs about yourself, background, why you think you're suitable, and your social media accounts. Be concise.
Attach your resume and send your email to Miss Athene at [HIDDEN TEXT]. It is absolutely essential to send in an email.

Job Description :
Enterprise Negotiator, AWS, Singapore

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking an experienced contracts negotiator to support the growing volume of complex cloud services agreements with large enterprise customers. The AWS Enterprise Negotiator is a hybrid legal and business role that will support the field sales team through the entire deal cycle of a cloud services agreement, from developing internal strategy through negotiation and closing.

You will be the lead negotiator for leading complex negotiations with enterprise customers, including creating proposals and collaborating with internal stakeholders (such as the legal, finance, security and compliance teams). To be successful, you will be required to facilitate smooth negotiations that strengthen customer relationships and eliminate friction.

You will need to understand and be able to explain contract terms to customers and identify ways to meet customers needs. You will lead the effort to resolve all customer questions and concerns in contract negotiations, including collaboration with cross-functional teams on specific areas of concern. You will be an expert in bringing the account teams and the customer to final closure on cloud services agreements, including obtaining required approvals, creating final agreements, and managing their delivery and execution.

To be successful, you must be inquisitive, enthusiastic about technology, enjoy working hard and being continually challenged, and demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations.

Basic Qualifications :
. Ability to lead customer-facing negotiations
. Ability to explain standard agreement terms to counterparties and negotiate fallback positions to those terms where appropriate
. Ability to act as a trusted advisor to business teams to support the strategy, negotiation and execution of enterprise agreements
. Bachelor's Degree
Preferred Qualifications :
. 5+ years of experience reviewing, drafting and negotiating a broad range of commercial contracts
. Experience at a technology company or in a private practice technology group
. Strong written and oral communication skills
. Law degree is a plus

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

tech_stack: Software Engineer  Web Infrastructure - VP
job_description:
Job Description :

The Athena Platform team are seeking an experienced Full Stack Engineer to join the Athena Web Infrastructure team. The team are responsible for the maintenance and modernisation of the Web Infrastructure that underpins 1000s of mission critical web services at JP Morgan. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will have hands-on experience with developing and managing modern Web application stacks and public Cloud platforms (preferably AWS), and will play a key role in the modernisation, performance enhancement, and cloud adoption of the Web Platform.
OurAthena Web Platform provides developers with a streamlined way of deploying and hosting Athena based web services whilst abstracting away the underlying infrastructure complexities.
Athena is a cross-asset platform transforming technology at JP Morgan. It delivers innovative and efficient applications to a wide range of the firm's business, including sales, trading, operations, risk and research. Athena combines the best of open source technologies with innovative components developed internally, which gives you the ability to contribute to wide a range of exciting projects. Our developers enjoy working with front office, quants and other technology teams across several lines of businesses.
In conjunction with these exciting responsibilities, youwill also have the opportunity to contribute to the broader modernisation agenda for the Athena Platform, including adoption of cloud native design patterns and migration to public and private cloud platforms.
Responsibilities:
Partnering with a global team of engineers through a transformation of the Athena Web Platform to a resilient and scalable cloud based architecture.
Optimizing the experience for developers building and deploying web applications in Athena.
Aligning technical strategy with other partner teams across the bank to deliver a complete and coherent experience for web developers.
Partnering with the global Athena SRE team to uplift monitoring and telemetry of the web stack.

Skills required to be considered for this role:
Bachelor degree
Working knowledge of load balancing and service orchestration, both on-prem and in public cloud environments.
Hands-on experience with configuring and managing Web server and proxy products such as Apache, NGINX, Haproxy or Envoy.
Experience with one or more back end Python frameworks such as Bottle or Tornado.
Experience with monitoring technologies like Prometheus, Grafana, and/or ELK.
Proficient in one or more general-purpose programming languages such as Python, Ruby, Go, C/C++, Java.
Minimum 5 years software engineering experience.

Preferred skills:
Working knowledge of Docker/containers and Kubernetes.
Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code products, preferably Terraform.
Good understanding of web and authentication protocols.
Experience in designing and building scalable and highly resilient services.
Experience in one or more public cloud platforms (ideally AWS).
Experience with using one or more front end frameworks/languages such as React or Typescript.
Experience in DevOps will be considered an advantage.

job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Enterprise Negotiator, AWS, Singapore

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking an experienced contracts negotiator to support the growing volume of complex cloud services agreements with large enterprise customers. The AWS Enterprise Negotiator is a hybrid legal and business role that will support the field sales team through the entire deal cycle of a cloud services agreement, from developing internal strategy through negotiation and closing.

You will be the lead negotiator for leading complex negotiations with enterprise customers, including creating proposals and collaborating with internal stakeholders (such as the legal, finance, security and compliance teams). To be successful, you will be required to facilitate smooth negotiations that strengthen customer relationships and eliminate friction.

You will need to understand and be able to explain contract terms to customers and identify ways to meet customers needs. You will lead the effort to resolve all customer questions and concerns in contract negotiations, including collaboration with cross-functional teams on specific areas of concern. You will be an expert in bringing the account teams and the customer to final closure on cloud services agreements, including obtaining required approvals, creating final agreements, and managing their delivery and execution.

To be successful, you must be inquisitive, enthusiastic about technology, enjoy working hard and being continually challenged, and demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Ability to lead customer-facing negotiations
. Ability to explain standard agreement terms to counterparties and negotiate fallback positions to those terms where appropriate
. Ability to act as a trusted advisor to business teams to support the strategy, negotiation and execution of enterprise agreements
. Bachelor's Degree
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of experience reviewing, drafting and negotiating a broad range of commercial contracts
. Experience at a technology company or in a private practice technology group
. Strong written and oral communication skills
. Law degree is a plus

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. AWS elastic compute (EC2) platform is at the core of what most AWS customers are using today to change their business models and solve complex business challenges.

AWS is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) to drive the AWS Graviton business and Go-To- Market (GTM) strategy. Graviton is a highly strategic initiative for AWS, as developing our own silicon in-house provides AWS with additional flexibility to deliver new instances at a faster cadence, providing customers with more choice, targeted performance, and cost optimizations as their workloads continue to evolve. The BDM will be responsible for defining, building, and deploying effective and targeted programs to accelerate broad based sales and business development activities for Graviton instances. The BDM will facilitate the enablement of business development, sales and solution architecture with specific customer centric value propositions and will directly interface with product management and development teams regarding customer and partner requirements. The BDM will synthe data and information gathered from these engagements into succinct findings, derive strategic insights, and persuasively communicate findings and perspectives to product and sales teams, including senior management.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and IT background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels of large Enterprises and Enterprise partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of AWS compute resources, platforms and frameworks in the AWS cloud to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, Enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, business operations, and has a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to Enterprises and Enterprise Partners.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Defines, builds and deploys enterprise focused sales and business development campaigns around the AWS Core EC2 offerings
. Engages, supports and scales business development and sales teams across AWS to be capable of delivering the EC2 value proposition to enterprise customers and partners
. Engages and drives scale at engaging enterprise customers and partners about the AWS EC2 value proposition
. Exhibits proactive ability and expertise in setting customer discussions via AWS sales and partner teams
. Exhibits expertise and drives field and partner readiness for enterprise customers
. Engages in senior level customer meetings to discuss customer's business issues and explores how the AWS EC2 platform can help address and resolve these issues
. Serves as an evangelist for the AWS EC2 platform within AWS, and externally
. Develops a standard market intelligence framework and dynamic analytic model to be utilized by the AWS Sales, Business Development and marketing teams
. Brings the various stakeholders together to help build collective mindshare in augmenting the service
. Establishes ways to measure and track metrics related to adoption of the AWS EC2 instances and services, and to make improvements to the approach based on those measurements
. Prepares and gives business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and metrics.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of experience with cloud computing technologies at scale and engaging with customers from start-ups to large fortune 100 enterprises
. Experience with cloud computing and or related fields (IT, software, etc.) - Experience with CPUs and Enterprise servers
. Solid enterprise negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Good understanding of ARM CPU Architecture & software ecosystem
. Experience with data center implementations

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Are you a Leader that can help Singapore Public Sector customers transform their business using the cloud

Can you work equally well with senior executives and technologists, leading high-visibility, high-impact e-government projects that are broad and deep

Do you have experience leading diverse teams to driving change and deliver business value at scale for Public Sector customers

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring a Principal Solution Architect to work with our top-tier Public Sector customers and their partners as they work to transform the enterprise IT landscape. The candidate will engage with customers to understand business drivers, assess application portfolios, design reliable and cost-effective cloud & hybrid infrastructures, create transition plans and develop business cases to justify the programs. Our engagements include projects for the government covering thousands of applications across tens of thousands of servers and involve developing a shared vision, leading the customer through the challenges of cloud adoption, demonstrating the reality of the vision and then enabling them to achieve full operational integration.

Amazon aims to be the most customer centric company on earth. Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers critical applications for hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world.

Key job responsibilities
We are looking for someone who Is passionate about:

* Proactively engaging with C-level executives to define technology vision- and enterprise cloud strategies that unlock enterprise challenges
* Defining enterprise transformation roadmaps and driving buy-in across complex organization structures
* Creating overarching technical thought leadership internally and externally and deliver high profile public speaking engagements, such as keynotes for AWS Summits, as well as influence analysts and help with media or press engagements.
* Provide architectural advice in deep technical engagements with customers
* Evangelizing AWS Services and the impact on customers. Share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public speaking events such as AWS Summit and AWS re:Invent as well as leadership at industry bodies/events.
* Identification of technology patterns and practices that can be scaled across Whole of Government to rapidly deliver digital services in the cloud.
* Identification and creation of compelling business cases for cloud adoption and modernizations.
* Collaborating with consulting and managed services partners to build and execute migration & modernization plans.
* Advocate on behalf of customer requirements to AWS service development teams.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 15+ of years of experience delivering technology solutions to Public Sector customers that have a transformative impact
* A Bachelors degree Masters/MBA/PhD degree preferred.
* IT consulting experience as a technical specialist in Customer-facing roles covering most senior executives from public sector customer in Singapore
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including group leadership and executive presentations
* Managing executive Customer relationships and key business stakeholders.
* Delivering IT Strategy and consulting services at the highest level
* Familiar with Enterprise Architecture and IT management frameworks and identifying the relationships between business services, information, applications and infrastructure assets.
* Broad Enterprise systems experience including SAP, Oracle, MSFT and custom Java/.NET applications.
* Designing, building, and operating large scale IT infrastructures.
* A proven track record of managing and delivering large-scale enterprise IT projects.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience architecting, migrating or transforming customer requirements to the cloud
. Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS
. One or more AWS certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate
. Demonstrated thought leadership through public speaking and / or publications
. Fluent written and verbal communication skills

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY
At AWS, we don't mind being called peculiar. We see beauty in simplifying the complex, and we're comfortable being misunderstood. That might sound unorthodox. We believe in removing obstacles so builders can build which is why our people enjoy working in AWS.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Want to Come Build the Future with us Don't wait, apply today!

VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 500,000 enterprise and mid-market customers to thrive in the Cloud Era by simplifying, automating and transforming the way they build, deliver and consume IT. We enable people and organizations by radically simplifying IT through software virtualization with a focus on three core missions: End-User Computing (EUC), Hybrid Cloud and Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC). Join our community - instigators of innovation and transformers of technology - as we envision and create what's next in IT. Get connected to an engine of opportunity fueled by the transformative products and solutions we bring to market, the passion and trust we inspire in our customers, and our collaborative drive to imagine, define and deliver the future of IT. With 13,000+ employees and 50+ locations worldwide, we are passionately driven to make an impact while contributing back to the community. Learn more at vmware.com/careers today!
The Commercial Account Manager will be responsible for selling the company's products and services in Singapore. The account coverage will be focused on a set of named accounts in the Financial Services Industry plus others. The ideal candidate should possess a Bachelor's Degree and should have 8 years of industry background with at least 4 of those in enterprise software sales. The candidate should be a self-starter with excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively present to both technical and executive audiences. This position will report to the Director of Sales, Commercial Sector.

Responsibilities:
- Primary driver for VMware business within a territory of Named Accounts.
- Solution selling to existing customer base and new prospects.
- Forecasting and account/opportunity detail in SFDC.
- Need to be a high-energy, motivated self-starter.
- Responsible for developing the executive relationship with C-suite in the assigned accounts.

Requirements:
- 8 years of experience in enterprise/software sales
- Strong written and oral English ability
- Expertise in both channel and direct sales
- Strong ability to lead sales engagement as a team
- Significant track record of accomplishment selling in the Commercial market
- Proven track record in exceeding quota and selling mega deals
- Strong knowledge of consultative sales that gets results
- Knowledge in selling complex solutions
Sales: VMware's Sales team focuses on two primary goals: helping customers solve their biggest business problems and hitting our bookings targets to keep our company growing and strong. We begin by forging deep relationships with our customers, so we can truly understand their business challenges and opportunities. We help drive their digital transformation by bringing VMware solutions that provide the speed, agility, and efficiency needed to compete and grow in the Internet economy. We also try to make the world a better place by hosting and participating in community activities. Are you inspired by the chance to solve your customers biggest challenges You can make that kind of difference with VMware's portfolio of industry-leading solutions. Join our team, and you can grow your career and share in the success of an industry pioneer that's turning companies into truly digital enterprises.

VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

job_description:
Design, implement, and deploy high availability automated tools in application, database servers, private and public cloud environment. Collaborates with technical leadership, development, system engineers, and business stakeholders to augment solutions that will meet operational goals for high availability, performance, stability, security, and cost efficiency.
Act as a gatekeeper to ensure all PRD deployments have met the required criteria before actual deployment, in compliant to the SDLC and Technology Risk framework.
Support 24 x 7 shift operations, work flexible hours and be on-call to respond appropriately to requests and ensure Service Level agreement are met.
Perform reviews to ensure SDLC controls are adequately governed.
Perform problem solving and root-caused analysis on any errors during the process of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and provide audit and compliance support when required.
Key Accountabilities
Responsible for software code promotion and deployment governance activities across multiple platforms, technologies and Application/LOBT teams.
Partner with Engineering, LOBTs and Change Management teams in building Launch Control systems to better manage infrastructure and applications changes through automation.
Perform periodic review of required SDLC controls - liaising closely with internal SDLC Process Mgmt team as well as the LOBT Application Teams.
Collaborate with SDLC Governance and Risk team to ensure smooth transition to effect new or changes to governance requirements, automating manual checks where possible.
Works closely with Platform Tech Ops and Engineering Platform Services units on issues resolution, improve the Release Management process and support major Deploy projects when required.
Requirements
At least 2-3 years of experience of general on DevOps/Middleware/DB/Application development/infrastructure with Change and Release Management process understanding (e.g. code deployment, data centre operations, asset management, production support or change control)
Deployment and management processes for both infrastructure and application components
Background in large-scale system administration and familiarity with open source technologies, Jenkins, JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket, Nexus etc.
Any programming knowledge and scripting is an advantage e.g. (Unix shell, Windows batch/Perl, Python), creating automated build and deployment scripts and Java programming. Knowledge on App servers, Database, JBOSS also a plus.
System Engineering: This is a technical position that requires you to have advanced Linux System Administrator skills, fluency with Amazon Web Services, and advanced configuration management systems skills.
Familiar with SDLC framework and exposure to audit and compliance review will be an added advantage.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Do you have a passion for helping customers design large distributed systems Would you like to do this using the world's most advanced cloud computing technologies Do you have a knack for helping an organization to understand application architectures and integration approaches, to architect advanced cloud-based solutions, and to help launch the build-out of those systems Are you one of those rare technologists with the communications, consultative, and leadership skills to help guide major projects to success The AWS Solutions Architecture team is hiring!

In this role, you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon's utility computing web services (Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB & RDS databases, Amazon CloudFront CDN, etc.) within large strategic accounts. Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects, working cross-organizationally to facilitate widespread use and adoption of the AWS platform, and developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform.

Key job responsibilities
Candidates should have experience in most of the following areas:
. Speaking and presentation skills - Presentations, white boarding, large and small group speaking.
. Technical - Web services development/deployment experience, and IT systems and network engineering experience.
. Operations and Security - Website/web services as well as traditional IT operations, management, and security and compliance experience.
. Economic and business - RFP/Acquisition support market analysis cost benefit analysis, etc.
. Experience in engaging enterprise class environment and complex architecture designs.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Location is flexible to ASEAN countries - Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam.
. The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess 5+ years of current solutions architecture (implementation/consulting) experience with C-Levels in large companies.
. Experience architecting infrastructure solutions using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, & storage architectures.
. Experience architecting or deploying Cloud/Virtualization solutions in enterprise customers.
. Experience working within the Enterprise software market or Internet industries is highly desired.
. Deep knowledge of Infrastructure Security, Security Compliance and Operations is highly desired.
. Enterprise application and database architecture a bonus.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English is a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Technical degree required Computer Science or Math background highly desired.
. Working knowledge of software development practices and Internet-related technologies highly desired.

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic, growing business unit within Amazon.com. Since early 2006, AWS has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure platform in the cloud. Using AWS, companies can requisition compute power, storage, and other services - gaining access to a global computing infrastructure that is the backbone of Amazon.com's multi-billion dollar retail business. Today, AWS provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers millions of active monthly customers from start-ups to multi-national corporations to governments. This role can be located in Singapore or Australia.

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our AWS APJC Compensation team as a Compensation Consultant. The individual will be an integral part of the Compensation team and will report to the APJC Compensation Leader, based in Singapore. We expect the individual to be a strong logical thinker, with fantastic project management abilities, strong data analytics abilities, who can demonstrate teamwork, communicate effectively and handle multiple priorities and projects. This role works closely with the Leadership Team and in collaboration with various HR stakeholders within AWS.

Responsibilities:
. Designing and implementing the organisations compensation strategy so that outcomes meet current and future business needs and are consistent with the desired internal and external market position
. Actively engages with senior leadership on compensation matters
. Understanding and contributeing to annual regional strategy and business performance measurements and how compensation strategy supports them
. Advocating for, designing and delivering mid- compensation plans for stand-alone business groups and or sub-regions
. Independently conceptualizing complex Amazon rules and apply them to a unique independent market with no rules in place - translate and apply Amazon specific philosophy to local practices and programs, by identification of right market source
. Providing and organizing/tailoring data and feedback on business strategy, advocates for the right outcomes with focus on execution
. Informing global/market expansion plans and site launch
. Using business knowledge to influence business management, inform and set Compensation goals for region

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

The ideal candidate should be able to:
. Identify issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth knowledge of organisational objectives.
. Implement strategic policies when selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
. Regularly interacts with senior management on matters concerning several areas, divisions, and/or customers.
. Have the ability to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance from others.
. Operate with significant autonomy and discretion.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelors degree in Economic or Mathematics with very strong orientation to analytics.
. Prior experience in a line role and consulting firm would be an advantage.

tech_stack: Saas  Negotiation  Customer Retention  Management Skills  Sales  Leadership  Customer Experience  Selling  Marketing  Strategy  Customer Acquisition  Project Management  Consulting  Business Development
job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Sales Manger, Google Workspace - Singapore
Additional Role Description:
As a Sales Manager, you will acquire and grow customers for Google Workspace.
You will be managing a team focused on acquiring and retaining customers within our Select, Enterprise, and Corporate business. You will form part of the Google Workspace APAC leadership team and sub-regional extended Google Cloud leadership team, giving you an opportunity for broad impact.
Responsibilities:
- Achieve and forecast quarterly goals, customer acquisition goals, and customer retention goals.
- Hire, mentor, and drive a team to deliver against assigned acquisition and growth goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience.
- Build a high-growth territory strategy and execute on it. Work with teams to maximize business results and open opportunities with large enterprise customers.
- Explore and understand complex customer requirements on both a business and technical level.
- Manage a team across acquisition and retention accounts across an assigned territory.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- 15 years of experience in sales, selling SaaS platforms in the technology industry.
- 5 years of experience managing and leading a team.
- Experience selling to C-level executives or consulting in cloud-based (SaaS) technologies in Southeast Asia.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience with marketing or sales support in developing product, solution messaging, narratives, and value propositions.
- Experience in reaching and exceeding business goals in the technology industry with SaaS products.
- Ability to adapt in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
- Ability to be detail- and goal-oriented, analytical, and motivated, take initiative, and plan for both long-term and short-term goals.
- Organizational and project management skills.
- Effective cross-functional leadership, collaboration, presentation, and written and verbal communication skills.

Job Description :
Job summary
Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures

As a Senior Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Technical studies or equivalent related job experience
. 6+ years IT experience that includes at least 4 years of hands-on .NET software development, Windows infrastructure, or SQL database architecture.
. 2+ years of internal or external customer engagement in an architecture role, pre-sales, or consulting.
. Some travel required up to 30% of the time
Preferred Qualifications :
. Strong verbal and written communication skills
. Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
. Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
. Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
. Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
. Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
. Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
. Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
. Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
. Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
. Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
. Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
. Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
. Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
