job_title: Senior Customer Solutions Manager, Global Financial Services
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
At Amazon Web Services (AWS) we are changing the future of IT. The Customer Solutions Manager (CSM) role is obsessed with supporting and accelerating our customers cloud journeys, to drive business value. You will work across AWS teams and apply your leadership and technical program management expertise to serve some of the largest and globally diverse enterprises in the world. You will play a key role in a global account team, partnering with AWS sales, professional services, and AWS service teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud solutions (spanning technology, people and process) with robust delivery plans, thereby accelerating the rate of adoption of AWS in the financial services vertical. In this role, you will partner with Financial Services ISVs to accelerate their adoption and time to value from AWS.
Roles and Responsibilities
You will have the opportunity to collaborate with customers, sales, solutions architecture and service teams to deliver technical solutions that solve some of the most complex and challenging technology problems of today. You will work with customer and internal stakeholders to scope work, set business goals, identify appropriate resources, track and report on progress and develop schedules. You will be a single point of contact to your customer and internal stakeholders on the progress of all the activities related to your customer. You will also need to assess risks, anticipate bottlenecks, provide critical issue management, balance trade-offs, and encourage risk-tasking to maximize business value. You will evangelise the value of AWS cloud and influence your customers to allocate the appropriate leadership and resources to achieve their goals.
At AWS we value critical thinking, self-motivation, and the ability to deal with ambiguity. You should bring a cool head, strong technical background, be detail oriented, have excellent problem solving abilities, and be an exemplary communicator. Your technical expertise and operational excellence will influence your team's decisions and help us drive secure and robust customer solutions. We love people who innovate, use data to make decisions, and can express themselves thoughtfully. We want you to be passionate about delivering a great customer experience, and love contributing to a team goal.
Basic Qualifications :
. Demonstrable experience leading and project/programme managing complex, large scale, IT/technical/platform programmes
. Prior experience working with or managing large technical programs, particularly at Fortune 500 companies
. Previous experience in a customer facing role (either as a supplier, or delivering in a supplier-customer relationship within an enterprise organisation)
. Deep understanding of software development lifecycle from conception to production operations, including experience of Design approvals/governance and Transition to Support processes in a large Enterprise organisation
. Experience of training/skills enablement of teams to support them through a technology transformation change
. Demonstrated ability to effectively deliver information and establish relationships at the C-suite/VP level
. Demonstrated leadership through influence . Experience working with current web technologies (especially Cloud), and/or in technology platform services
. Self-motivated problem solver able to thrive in a dynamic and customer-focused environment . Strong organizational and troubleshooting skills with precise attention to detail
. Demonstrated ability to maintain composure in stressful situations, responds to customer needs quickly and effectively, adapts to change . Highly analytical, technically proficient, and able to learn new tools and software quickly
. Strong listening skills demonstrated ability to ask effective questions Preferred qualifications
. Superior written and verbal communication skills
. Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Maths or equivalent experience
. PMP/Prince 2/PgMP (good) and/or Scrum/SAFe certification and practical experience (preferred)

Preferred Qualifications :
. Direct experience implementing AWS/cloud services
. Direct experience of Migrating applications/workloads from legacy platforms / data centres to Cloud or to new best of breed platform services (containers platform, application platform service...)
. Working experience as a Scrum Master or leading a SAFe program.

job_description:
Data Analyst
About Yojee
Yojee Limited (ASX: YOJ), is a cloud-based software as a service (SaaS) logistics platform that facilitates the flow of freight movements into a single ecosystem, making the complex process of managing land transport simple and accessible to all players whilst reducing carbon emissions for a greener planet.
About the Engineering team at Yojee
The backbone of Yojee focused on building the core platform and product using best in class technology. We love clean code, well-designed architecture and applying best practices. We build cool technology that lasts long and scales well.
About the role
Yojee is looking for a Data Analyst to dig deep into our master data set, create reports for both internal stakeholders and our growing user base, and create actionable insights.
Duties and Responsibilities
Engage, influence, communicate with stakeholders to support data analytics plan and strategies.
Identify actionable insights and recommend options for analysis and models.
Support the stakeholders with business reports build in Looker.
Cooperate with Product Management to build and improve reports embedded in our platform.
Research technologies for and build embedded dynamic dashboards.
May be required to perform other related duties as required.
Requirements
Bachelor in Computer Science/Data Analytics or related studies.
2 years of work experience in the Data Analytics area.
Strong understanding of key concepts, techniques and considerations in data analytics .
Experience in SQL, preferably PostgreSQL.
Experience using visualisation software (e.g. Tableau or Qlik, ideally Looker).
Proven ability to translate complex technical subjects into clear and concise communications to stakeholders at all levels.
Fresh graduates may apply
Reporting Structure - Who Will Help You Win
This role will be located in Singapore and will report to the Lead Data Engineer.

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic, growing business unit within Amazon.com. Since early 2006, AWS has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure platform in the cloud. Using AWS, companies can requisition compute power, storage, and other services - gaining access to a global computing infrastructure that is the backbone of Amazon.com's multi-billion dollar retail business. Today, AWS provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers millions of active monthly customers from start-ups to multi-national corporations to governments. This role can be located in Singapore or Australia.

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our AWS APJC Compensation team as a Compensation Consultant. The individual will be an integral part of the Compensation team and will report to the APJC Compensation Leader, based in Singapore. We expect the individual to be a strong logical thinker, with fantastic project management abilities, strong data analytics abilities, who can demonstrate teamwork, communicate effectively and handle multiple priorities and projects. This role works closely with the Leadership Team and in collaboration with various HR stakeholders within AWS.

Responsibilities:
. Designing and implementing the organisations compensation strategy so that outcomes meet current and future business needs and are consistent with the desired internal and external market position
. Actively engages with senior leadership on compensation matters
. Understanding and contributeing to annual regional strategy and business performance measurements and how compensation strategy supports them
. Advocating for, designing and delivering mid- compensation plans for stand-alone business groups and or sub-regions
. Independently conceptualizing complex Amazon rules and apply them to a unique independent market with no rules in place - translate and apply Amazon specific philosophy to local practices and programs, by identification of right market source
. Providing and organizing/tailoring data and feedback on business strategy, advocates for the right outcomes with focus on execution
. Informing global/market expansion plans and site launch
. Using business knowledge to influence business management, inform and set Compensation goals for region

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

The ideal candidate should be able to:
. Identify issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth knowledge of organisational objectives.
. Implement strategic policies when selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
. Regularly interacts with senior management on matters concerning several areas, divisions, and/or customers.
. Have the ability to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance from others.
. Operate with significant autonomy and discretion.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelors degree in Economic or Mathematics with very strong orientation to analytics.
. Prior experience in a line role and consulting firm would be an advantage.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Are you a seasoned technical program manager ready to support the largest and most complex customers in their journey to the cloud Azure is the fastest growing business in Microsoft's history and is the foundation of Microsoft's commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade cloud that has a true hybrid story. The Azure (Networking, Compute, Storage) Team is responsible for accelerating our most strategic customers adoption of Microsoft Azure by connecting our technical experience, along with our customers vision and challenges directly to the engineering product teams, and as a result help to ensure Azure is the most compelling solution on the market. We work across a broad range of Azure technologies understanding customer scenarios, cloud patterns and adoption blockers.

As we drive to be the leading cloud platform in the world, Azure Sovereign Cloud team is hiring an exceptional technical program manager to help support our most complex and challenging customers and engineering programs in the Government landscape. #aznetPM

Success in this role combines managing customer engagements, listening to and understanding customer use cases and scenarios, translating these into viable cloud network services and communicating this at an executive level. Responsibilities include program management of technical delivery teams on proof-of-concept implementations, as well as architecture design and review in a cloud-scale, cloud-pace environment. Close collaboration with generalists and specialists in the Microsoft field and delivery teams, peer teams within Microsoft Engineering and diverse customer teams is critical. The role is also responsible for communications related to our programs of work, including executive reporting and reviews with both customer and Microsoft stakeholders.
This position is located in Singapore and some travel will be required (0%-25%).
The successful candidate will have experience in cloud-scale network infrastructure projects, as well as direct customer engagement and be able to take a collaborative approach to solving problems. They will fit comfortably into an ambitious and challenging environment and have strong verbal and written communication skills. They will be objective, self-disciplined and possess excellent business and technical judgement, and be able to operate autonomously. A critical part of the role is the ability to conceptualize complex ideas quickly and convey those thoughts to others in a clear, effective, and motivating manner. Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
To contribute as a key member of the team, the successful candidate must be eager to take on and lead initiatives, be an open communicator, have a commitment to excellence and possess a strong sense of personal commitment in accomplishing both customer and Microsoft goals.

job_title: Business Operation Program Manager, Data Center Planning and Delivery
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
APJC Business Operations Manager

Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, and low-cost cloud platform that powers thousands of businesses in over 190 countries. AWS Data Center Capacity Supply Team works to deliver capacity supply options across multiple network footprint opportunities to meet the needs of customer demands. We are a team of highly motivated professionals who enable the capacity needed to support AWS customers and optimize the largest cloud services company on earth!

As a member of the Data Center Planning and Delivery Team, you will manage the processes and tools needed to support incoming supply opportunities to meet customer demand. This role's primary responsibility is to source opportunities for improvement across systems and processes, partner with teams to drive standardization, and implement solutions while improving the customer experience that delivers visibility to senior leadership.

Responsibilities:
. Develop, implement, and manage infrastructure supply chain strategies on a regional scale.
. Create and maintain reporting systems and processes to support the regional infrastructure supply pipeline.
. Understand demand and supply inputs and drive implementation of systems, tools, and processes to support changes in demand and supply schedule.
. Seek out ways to utilize Salesforce and other internal tools to improve processes and productivity and make recommendations to support an organization scaling at a rapid pace.
. Organize and lead requirement gathering sessions, work with regional teams to create reporting prototypes, and set expectations with stakeholders on tooling requirements.
. Manage a release and testing process, drive implementation with internal stakeholders, and implement mechanisms to measure success.
. Develop documentation on best practices for tooling and processes, develop training schedules, and follow up on customer feedback.
. Manage cross-functional projects and business reviews against operational plans and objectives to meet commitments and goals.
. Identify and drive opportunities for sustainable, scalable, and relative solutions to improving processes regionally and globally.
. Understand forecasting, demand planning, supply planning, and construction processes to evaluate and validate new ideas and innovate approaches.

Key job responsibilities
Manage Capital Appropriation Request
Collaborate, consolidate and facilitate business reviews
Prioritize tooling for the region
Track regional savings

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to help our customers understand and move quickly to deploy solutions for their end customers and achieve their businesses goals Would you like to pioneer the use of cloud services to help drive innovation Would you like to be part of building a fast-growing program to worldwide scale

As the APJ Innovation Business Development Lead, you will have an exciting opportunity to partner with AWS sales teams, specialist teams and end customer teams to define, ideate and invent new solutions that will lead to long lasting impact and influence in our customer's business. Your responsibilities include partnering with AWS teams to work backwards from industry challenges and customer needs and to define and package solutions powered by AWS that will be needle movers in their adoption of new technology. Your work will directly influence APJ go-to-market approaches, thought leadership and innovation offerings.

You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial enterprise technology sales environment, and working with cross-functional teams as many parts of the program will have interdependencies with other teams within AWS. Typically cross-functional collaboration includes sales teams, sales leadership, solutions architects, marketing, partners, professional services, and sales enablement.

The right candidate will have experience with positioning and packaging technology solutions as a business offering to our most common industry and customer challenges. The candidate will have developed scalable approaches and offerings that deliver high quality and high impact experiences to customers.

The right candidate will also have a proven track record of leading and driving multiple simultaneous projects to meet customer business objectives, excellent project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, a good understanding of cloud solutions, and a passion for helping customers transform using cloud technologies.

Key job responsibilities
. Understand industry challenges and customers opportunities, and partner with AWS teams to identify and prioritize solutions that will advance our customer's technology journey

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. The right person will be technical and analytical, and possess significant experience of business development enterprise sales, or program/product management experience.

. Operational excellence mind-set and experience. Data driven. Excellent problem-solving skills. Adept at simplifying complexity and developing scalable propositions
. Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Ability to effectively lead and work with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalities

Review the implementation of controls to improve Security posture for Cloud Native applications (including but not limited to microservices based architecture) conforming to the Bank's Global Information Security Policies and Standards

job_title: Sr. Account Manager, Aerospace and Satellite
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
We are looking for an experienced Enterprise Sales Representative to focus on developing new customers in Aerospace and Satellite in the region. The ideal candidate has sales experience in this vertical with a terrific reputation for overachieving quota while focusing on the customer. They should also be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on quarterly revenue targets, while maintaining a strategy which scales across a large set of customers.

The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical background that enables them to drive an engagement at the CXO level as well as with software developers and IT architects. The Enterprise Sales Executive will be an exceptionally strong and creative thinker who thrives in a team environment and embraces all aspects of selling, including prospecting, engaging partners, and leveraging all resources at their disposal to maximize breadth of impact. They must be able to work in fast-paced, dynamic environment and have very strong verbal and written communication skills.

Key job responsibilities
. Meet or exceed quarterly revenue targets.
. Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan.
. Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services.
. Accelerate customer adoption.
. Maintain a robust sales pipeline.
. Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption.
. Manage contract negotiations.
. Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.
. Ensure customer satisfaction.
. Moderate travel.

About the team
AWS Aerospace & Satellite (A&S) helps commercial and government customers build satellites, conduct space and launch operations, and reimagine space exploration. Our reliable global infrastructure and unmatched portfolio of cloud services position AWS to equip organizations in the private and public sector to process and transform space collections into data, make that data actionable and accessible to customers around the globe, and redefine how organizations transform the space market segment. With the AWS Cloud, customers are accelerating space missions, removing barriers to innovation on Earth, and inspiring future generations.

Our customer base includes: Earth Observation, GEO/MEO Satellite Service Operators, LEO Proliferated Constellations, Geospatial Analysis, Space Situational Awareness, Launch & Propulsion, and Human Space Flight & Exploration customers.

Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience, 7+ years sales experience working for technology vendors selling Enterprise Software and/or Strategic Cloud Platform solutions

Preferred Qualifications :
. Aerospace and Satellite Solutions Industry experience, with a track record of building C-Level consensus to adopt services and solutions.
. Experience selling to developing markets.
. Good customer network.
. Strong leadership skills including strong written and verbal communication.
. A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com, is the industry's leading cloud computing platform. The AWS Startup team is seeking a talented, experienced, self-directed Program Manager to join the ISV team that is responsible for driving adoption of the AWS platform by startups globally.
In this role, you will be responsible for owning and executing key ISV programs across Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ). You will be required to identify, develop and execute regional startup programs for APJ, in collaboration with the ISV and Marketing team. You must be able to directly understand and relate to the startup experience, have an innate understanding for entrepreneurs, company founders and technical decision makers at early stage companies, and be passionate about helping build new ideas for the startup community. Ideally, you are someone that has had experience designing and developing new products targeted at the startup community. You should be familiar and interested in driving innovation in customer facing products, and have a track record of owning successful, metrics driven development plans. You must be able to work with and influence different teams across organizations to work toward a common development goal.
The ideal candidate will have a strong program management background with experience leading medium to large projects. The candidate will also have a business development background with strong ability to earn trust with startup founders, as well as work cross-functionally across the Amazon organization. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.

Key job responsibilities
Work closely with customers, ISV Marketing, and specialist teams across the organization to understand the needs of entrepreneurs and how to help them meet those needs to achieve growth. Research and ideate potential solutions to process gaps and hurdles in the startup experience.
. Develop and execute on new ISV Programs at the country or APJ level.
. Implement customer usage metrics & reporting, with a strong focus on improving customer experience.
. Manage the entire lifecycle of the initiatives you are responsible for, including showing operations success and developing on further iterations.
Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree in any field
. 7-10+ years of program/product management or business development experience.
. Demonstrated understanding and savviness in the startup ecosystem, including common patterns of success for startup customers.
. Proven ability to launch successful, external experiences that are used and loved by customers
. Operational savviness, ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously, keeping focus on execution and delivering results consistently.
. Proven ability to work cooperatively with various internal teams, including business development, operations, sales and customer support
. Demonstrated ability to interact with startup executives to both understand their requirements, and to discuss proposed programs and engagements.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.
. Strong analytical skills, with excellent problem-solving abilities in the face of ambiguity.
. Vision to own and drive programs with long term development horizons.
Preferred Qualifications :
. MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
. Operational experience at a startup, preferably as a founder or in a business, operations or strategy role in the startup ecosystem
. Passionate about technology and with some exposure to AWS platform

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.
Customer Success:Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation, leveraging the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and support offerings. To this end, Microsoft invests in a dedicated Customer Success team that will help Microsoft customers successfully realize their business outcomes.

As a Customer Success Account Manager (Senior CSAM), you are the primary customer facing role responsible for customer success through the management of program deliveries and strong customer executive relationships at our most complex & strategic enterprise customers. The prevailing business priority is the customers successful adoption and productive use of Microsoft cloud technologies. You are front and center with our customers in support of their digital journey and empowering them to achieve more
The CSAM is a core member on the account team who partners with the Account Team Unit to programmatically align the consumption plan to the account plan, orchestrate technology onboarding in line with customer priorities, and ensures value realization of a customer's Microsoft investment through consumption, operational health and customer experience. The CSAM is accountable for the development and execution of the customer consumption plan and operational health, leveraging technical resources across all solution areas.?The CSAM provides delivery leadership, for our largest and most complex accounts, focused on ensuring delivery is driving the customer's success and consistently achieving our shared objectives and outcomes. They will oversee and ensure prioritized alignment of coordinated outcomes across Support Programs, Customer Success Engagements, and Consulting projects that will drive consumption, supportability, and operational health improvements.
Key Accountabilities include:
Partner with the Account Executive / Account Technology Strategist to build and execute the Account Plan
Leads the success & support team, aligning to prioritized customer solutions, managing the Strategic account plan at a global level.
Accountable for the Oversight of Critical Support Case Management
Accountable for provide oversight of critical support cases by partnering with Incident Management & Customer Support Services teams?. Ensures effective communications & escalation management to both internal & customer stakeholders. Ability to act as customer advocate and orchestrate with other extended teams (e.g., Product Engineering) to resolve critical situations & support issues for customers.
Accountable for the Consumption plan
Accountable for the development and execution of the internal and customer-facing aspects cross-cloud consumption plan, with support from the technical resources aligned to the account. Ensures prioritized Success Engagements progress from Validate through Commit with a Program Delivery plan and up-to-date milestones?.
Engages Customer Executive Sponsors
Establishes and nurtures strong executive sponsorship and manages the relationships with customer leadership to drive theexecution of the support coverage model, strategic account plan, consumption roadmap & delivery execution oversight.?
Engages Microsoft Executive Sponsors
Aligns with Microsoft Executive Sponsors to establish an engagement model and manage the communication & escalation strategies with customer leadership.
Leveragestechnology experience
Is experienced with real-world, hands-on experience designing, developing, deploying, and supporting large technologysolutions. Knowledgeable and experienced in creating solutions that leverage cloud technologies and that provide maximum business value, which sustain the test of time.?
Accountable for Delivery Orchestration & Support Outcomes
Provides leadership and orchestration across the Success & Support (Customer Success Unit) team, Microsoft technical specialists,customer technical teams, Microsoft and partner project teams, and Customer Success Account Managers as appropriate. Balances prioritization between implementing new capabilities and ensuringcustomer operational health.?
ProvidesSeasoned Delivery Leadership
Leads a team of Customer Success Account Managers and the overall global account support and success team to ensure the health of the customer's solutions,orchestrated prioritized modernization and transformation projects, which lead to customer outcomes.?
Accountable for Consumption Planning andExecution for Strategic Pursuits
Aligns the strategic account planning and cross-organization support coverage to driveconsumption planning and success engagement execution aligned to the desired customer outcomes.?

we are looking for a highly motivated and passionate csam to drive program & operations management (support & consumption) for our strategic enterprise customers that have a significant number of key cloud-hybrid workload engagements running concurrently. as the csam, you will provide oversight to support & critical issue management, drive consumption planning & execution, as well as the acceleration of cloud adoption from pilot/mvp to production for customer cloud engagements. this will be done by providing cross-engagement oversight, resource orchestration, and blocker escalation, all while operating in close collaboration with key account team unit members and business partners who are supporting customer success.
experience- 10+ years of success in senior roles attributing to technical engagement and delivery management and/or program management for large, complex, and global strategic customers is required. prior work experience in a technical account manager or technical program manager position focused on enterprise cloud and software/services solution preferred.
leadership- this role requires strong communication skills, as well as displaying executive presence and confidence in varying levels of customer situations. the csam must show leadership in teams comprised of microsoft, partner and customer resources who may be engaged in the delivery of complex solutions for overall customer success.
technical support management - proven track record of orchestrating support & escalation management with customer and internal technical support teams.
relationship building- proven track record of building relationships with senior customer executives in large or highly strategic accounts. experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solutions/engagements required.
program management- excellent skills in planning for a portfolio of engagements, cross-group collaboration, resource orchestration, communications, analytical capabilities, and attention to detail required. the csam will be accountable for the development and execution of a cross-cloud consumption plan, and operational health of the customer solutions deployed today and in the future.
collaboration and communication- proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts, and ensuring follow-through with verbal and written communication. strong presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences and various levels of management (cxo, senior executives, bdms).
technical- experience designing, developing, deploying and supporting large technology solutions. knowledgeable and experienced in creating solutions that leverage cloud technologies. experience leading large technology programs that involve multipletechnology areas, multiple stakeholders, are high risk, and highly visible across significantly d technical teams that includecoordination of multiple parties (e.g., partners, onshore and offshore resources).knowledge of market trends and competitive insights preferred

project management: acp, pmi, or equivalent project management certification
prosci or equivalent

Job Description :

As a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.
Our Cloud Services Group is teeming with passionate innovators like you who are rapidly designing, building and deploying groundbreaking internal and public cloud platforms. By putting your technological know-how to work on creating best-in-class cloud-aware applications, your efforts will help us work faster and smarter, not to mention reinforce our position as a global leader in fintech cloud services.
Responsibilities:
You'll be developing cloud native products to be used by engineers across the firm.
You'll be developing products that help test and measure the resiliency and availability of products and services.
You'll be developing products that help solve the problems associated with micro services orchestration.
You'll be part of a small and highly focused product team which is responsible for developing and running the product end to end.
You'll contribute in making architecture decisions and make suggestions to improve the current architecture of the product.

Requirements:
BS/BA degree or equivalent
Minimum 6 years of experience required
Passionate about new technologies and building a culture of innovation, continuous learning and improvement.
Proficiency in one or more modern programming languages. Java, python or Go is preferred.
Exposure to building frameworks and tooling for large scale engineering operations, resiliency patterns like circuit breakers, bulkheads, backpressure, etc.
Exposure to authentication and authorization protocols and solutions.
Experience developing cloud native applications on platforms like CloudFoundry, Kubernetes, Heroku, AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.
Exposure to effective operational patterns like SLOs, metrics, health checks, error budgets, distributed tracing, etc.

job_description:
DESCRIPTION

AWS is one of Amazon's fastest growing businesses, servicing customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. AWS customers include some of the most innovative startups like Netflix, Pinterest, Spotify, Airbnb, and Instagram as well as some of the largest global enterprises like Shell International, Unilever, Hitachi, Sharp, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Samsung. We help global and local enterprises to use cloud to remediate their legacy technology and build new innovative businesses.

As a member of APJ Enterprise team, you will incubate and implement strategic programs which are focused on helping new enterprises get started on their AWS cloud journey, driving new customer acquisition, revenue and market share for AWS. You will work across teams in both enterprise segment and partner organization to drive the planning and implementation of these transformational programs.

Your responsibilities will include developing the Greenfield Enterprise customer programs leveraging cross-functional resources at AWS, planning, developing/maturing cross-functional go-to-market execution mechanisms. You will collaborate with global and APJ level cross-functional teams including AWS Sales, Business Development, Marketing, Partner and Technical Field professionals to determine how to best accelerate growth and success in the Greenfield Enterprise customer market and monitoring progress against the business plan. You will use data and market signals to drive the quick experimentation that will most effectively serve AWS new customer engagements.

The right candidate earns trust through outstanding performance, effective communication skills, and a strong record of delivering results timely and effectively. You should have experience managing complex global programs in large, multi-national, and preferably tech organizations. You should have a track record of leading and driving multiple programs across a region like Asia to meet business objectives, excellent program and project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, and a passion for helping companies get started using the cloud to achieve business goals. Strong judgement and a demonstrated ability to influence without explicit authority are key to success.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of experience driving large initiatives with global organizations
. Track record of managing complex projects and programs while demonstrating exceptional judgement
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Strong oral and written communication skills - one to one, one to many, executive-level presentations
. Demonstrated ability to drive to quality decisions with teams, peers and leaders
. Team player with strong interpersonal and organizational skills
. Entrepreneurial and self-sufficient: work with little oversight delivering high-quality results and driving own agenda
. Effective problem-solving and mediation skills
. Strong planning, project management and problem-solving skills
. Customer-focused, results-oriented, with a high level of integrity
. Ability to adapt to fast-paced and changing environments
. Understanding of cloud concepts in general and/or specific technologies, platforms and solutions

job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures

As a Senior Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Technical studies or equivalent related job experience
. 6+ years IT experience that includes at least 4 years of hands-on .NET software development, Windows infrastructure, or SQL database architecture.
. 2+ years of internal or external customer engagement in an architecture role, pre-sales, or consulting.
. Some travel required up to 30% of the time
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Strong verbal and written communication skills
. Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
. Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
. Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
. Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
. Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
. Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
. Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
. Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
. Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
. Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
. Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
. Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
. Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud spans 84 Availability Zones within 26 geographic regions around the world, with announced plans for 24 more Availability Zones and 8 more AWS Regions in Australia, Canada, India, Israel, New Zealand, Spain, Switzerland, and United Arab Emirates (UAE). This makes AWS one of the fastest growing enterprise tech companies ever. Amazon's AWS Data Centers (DC) are a major component of worldwide cloud-computing infrastructure and are industry leading examples of mission critical facilities.

AWS Engineering is responsible for the design of all architectural, electrical, mechanical, structural and controls systems within all of Amazon DCs world-wide. The team works directly with operations, security teams, field engineering, and construction management to implement designs that are functional, practical and innovative.

The team is seeking a Document Controller to become part of our global engineering team.

Key job responsibilities
The Document Controller will be responsible for the following:
. Review all documentation being issued by the design team, including but not limited to narratives, drawings, sheets, etc.
. Controlling the numbering, naming, filing and formatting of all documents issued by the design engineering team.
. Developing and setting standards for engineering document control, and best practices. Drives process improvements across the organization.
. Developing document tracking processes
. Creating document lists
. Distributing and uploading all project documentation to assigned locations
. Ensuring all technical documents are uploaded
. Giving access to project folders for appropriate team members
. Acting as central point of contact for engineering drawings for APAC projects
. Keeping and managing database for all projects
. Other document administration related to engineering team
. Working with internal teams to understand project requirement

A day in the life
As a Document Controller you will be part of a highly creative and effective design team comprised of Architects, Civil, Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Controls, Information Communication and Telecommunications and Physical Security Engineers tasked with developing documentation tracking tools, reviewing every technical document, drawing or sheet being issued by the design team and storing it properly within the assigned document repository. You will be responsible for all of the project documentation being issued by the design team, and providing document guidance to all team members.

About the team
Engineers in AWS work to design resilient, cost effective DC facilities. We are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers and drive to develop a fleet of buildings emphasizing security, safety, and efficiency, while finding new ways to meet AWS's growing demand. We justify and communicate the technical decisions we make directly to AWS leadership and work hard to drive continuous advancements in our designs. Engineers on our team have the opportunity to impact changes in our current design, as well as establish design procedures and protocols for future systems.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Cumulative 3+ years of experience with document control
. Advanced experience with MS Office and MS Excel
. Data organization skills
. Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in engineering
. Understanding of technical documentation
. Understanding of project management
. Experience with AutoCAD or BIM
. Understanding of data centers and its critical components
. 2+ years of experience related to industry infrastructure or mission critical facility design

Amazon is a committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced candidate who will be responsible for innovating in the area of audit integration, control automation, scaling compliance, and next-generation risk management. This candidate will be charged to deliver on our regional audit programs, and developing innovative automated audit processes. This position requires a strong foundation in audit principles, as well as a diverse technology background. As an essential part of this role, you will be leading audit programs and will enable customers to build regulated workloads on AWS. Do you have a passion for applying cutting edge technologies and automation in traditionally manual processes Do you have experience in finding innovative solutions to scale security controls across diverse teams and technologies Do you have ideas about how the future of security assurance, privacy, and transparency programs will look
As a Senior Program Manager of AWS worldwide audit portfolio, you will be participating in a multi-functional and multi-disciplinary team that owns the worldwide portfolio of ongoing and new audits. You will drive the strategy for automating the end-to-end audit processes, including technical security requirement analysis, control implementation, auditor engagement and audit execution, enabling the program to scale with the business. You will help inspire, lead, and transform the programs through innovative process changes across multiple organizations and teams, engaging technical and non-technical people throughout the company. Your combination of technical and audit background will help bridge security, technology, and compliance, and facilitate the scale of the program. As a member of the AWS Security Assurance team, you will work to influence leaders across AWS Security, our field teams, auditors, and customers to deliver an innovative and global audit program.

Key Responsibilities
This position is responsible for:

- Developing and improving AWS comprehensive global audit program, including managing direct engagement with external auditors and customers
- Executing on a collaborative audit roadmap in conjunction with internal and external stakeholders
- Defining processes and tools to support a technical audit platform, extending automation throughout the end-to-end audit process
- Building key engagement mechanisms to engage service owners, to meet the growth needs of the business and of compliance, privacy, and transparency requirements
- Managing leadership relationships and communications to service teams and stakeholders of the audit programs

Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Mathematics, Accounting/Auditing, or other related fields
. 5+ years of experience of leading audit, risk and compliance programs
. 5+ years of experience with multiple compliance standards, such as: PCI DSS, SOC 1/2/3, ISO 27001/27017/27018/22301/20000, TIA-942, FedRAMP, HIPAA, IRAP, FISC, K-ISMS, MTCS, or C5
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience in technical security design, compliance consulting, or advisory work in support of a highly technical environment
. Technical background will some demonstrable understanding of cloud services/deployment architecture (ideally AWS cloud services offering)
. Experience with engaging teams who are building technology products or services and experience in working with engineering in defining technical requirements and seeing them through to development and release
. Experience auditing cloud environments
. The ideal candidate is a recognized professional and respected voice in the information security and compliance community

job_description:
We are living in dynamic times. Technology is reshaping how we live, and we want to use it to redefine how financial services are offered. Grab is the leading technology company in Southeast Asia offering everyday services to the masses. Singtel is Asia's leading communications group connecting millions of consumers and enterprises to essential digital services. This is why we are coming together to unlock big dreams, and financial inclusion for people in our region is just one of them.
The Identity and Access Management (IAM) team, as a function under the Information Security Office, is responsible for enterprise-wide access control operations and governance, identity services, and privileged access management for the Digibank. By doing so, the team seeks to provide the appropriate level of access to the right people, at the right time for all technology platforms and applications used by the Digibank. The IAM team is also responsible for enterprise-wide privilege access management operations, ensuring that privileged access is secured to prevent unauthorised access.
As an IAM/PAM Capability Lead, you will be responsible for managing system integration to SSO and enterprise IAM solutions as well as employees identity and access lifecycle management, including onboarding, access request management, provisioning, certification and reconciliation. You will also be involved in Privileged Access Management (PAM) activities, such as administration of the PAM tool, operating/developing/enhancing processes in the privileged access management space, and reviewing privileged access activities. For both areas, you are expected to maintain a high level of access control assurance for the Digibank.
The must haves:
At least 5 consecutive years of experience in IT with direct experience in implementation and/or administration of IAM products and services such as Cloud based ldP, enterprise IAMaaS, SSO, federation (e.g. SAML, OAuth, OpenID) across disparate cloud based identity providers, business applications and PAM products
Strong experience in dealing with technical and non-technical stakeholders from various levels and domains to improve state of access control across (e.g. business application role definition, recertification, approval workflows definition) managed technology platforms and applications
Demonstrated experience in employee lifecycle management i.e. on-boarding, account management, off-boarding, certification and reconciliation
Demonstrated experience in implementation of controls related to IAM and PAM activities, to meet industry best practices and controls objectives, as well as regulatory expectations (e.g. MAS TRMG, Cyber Hygiene Notice)
Demonstrated experience in implementing privileged access monitoring related controls
Able to design and develop standards for related to IAM and PAM
Experience working with cloud based access control systems (AWS IAM, AWS SSO) and how to manage roles and policies at scale using automation
Experience working with SAML2.0 for integrating third-party SaaS applications to the banks SSO provider
Experience working with cloud-native privileged access management systems that integrate with approval systems via API
Ability to automate the detection of deviations from identity & privileged access management policy to scale audits as part of continuous compliance programs
Possess broad knowledge of IT infrastructure and corresponding processes as well as in-depth and up-to-date experience of SaaS cloud only environment
Results oriented; ready to challenge the status quo for continuous improvement
Strategic thinking, and ability to draw lateral connections between subject areas
Capable of working in a collaborative team environment as well as being able to operate in a self directed capacity
Critical thinker with the ability to determine root-cause analysis, assess and articulate risk to organizational leaders
The good to haves:
Attained CISSP or relevant certification, as well as public cloud related certifications, preferably AWS Certified Security - Speciality
General knowledge of financial services concepts and products
Knowledge of automation such as scripting with PowerShell, Java, etc.
Demonstrates ability to adapt, embraces cultural diversity and work effectively with remote teams

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures

As a Senior Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Technical studies or equivalent related job experience
. 6+ years IT experience that includes at least 4 years of hands-on .NET software development, Windows infrastructure, or SQL database architecture.
. 2+ years of internal or external customer engagement in an architecture role, pre-sales, or consulting.
. Some travel required up to 30% of the time
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Strong verbal and written communication skills
. Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
. Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
. Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
. Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
. Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
. Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
. Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
. Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
. Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
. Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
. Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
. Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
. Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.
If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud spans 84 Availability Zones within 26 geographic regions around the world, with announced plans for 24 more Availability Zones and 8 more AWS Regions in Australia, Canada, India, Israel, New Zealand, Spain, Switzerland, and United Arab Emirates (UAE). This makes AWS one of the fastest growing enterprise tech companies ever. Amazon's AWS Data Centers (DC) are a major component of worldwide cloud-computing infrastructure and are industry leading examples of mission critical facilities.

AWS Engineering is responsible for the design of all architectural, electrical, mechanical, structural and controls systems within all of Amazon DCs world-wide. The team works directly with operations, security teams, field engineering, and construction management to implement designs that are functional, practical and innovative.

The team is seeking a Document Controller to become part of our global engineering team.

Key job responsibilities
The Document Controller will be responsible for the following:
. Review all documentation being issued by the design team, including but not limited to narratives, drawings, sheets, etc.
. Controlling the numbering, naming, filing and formatting of all documents issued by the design engineering team.
. Developing and setting standards for engineering document control, and best practices. Drives process improvements across the organization.
. Developing document tracking processes
. Creating document lists
. Distributing and uploading all project documentation to assigned locations
. Ensuring all technical documents are uploaded
. Giving access to project folders for appropriate team members
. Acting as central point of contact for engineering drawings for APAC projects
. Keeping and managing database for all projects
. Other document administration related to engineering team
. Working with internal teams to understand project requirement

A day in the life
As a Document Controller you will be part of a highly creative and effective design team comprised of Architects, Civil, Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Controls, Information Communication and Telecommunications and Physical Security Engineers tasked with developing documentation tracking tools, reviewing every technical document, drawing or sheet being issued by the design team and storing it properly within the assigned document repository. You will be responsible for all of the project documentation being issued by the design team, and providing document guidance to all team members.

About the team
Engineers in AWS work to design resilient, cost effective DC facilities. We are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers and drive to develop a fleet of buildings emphasizing security, safety, and efficiency, while finding new ways to meet AWS's growing demand. We justify and communicate the technical decisions we make directly to AWS leadership and work hard to drive continuous advancements in our designs. Engineers on our team have the opportunity to impact changes in our current design, as well as establish design procedures and protocols for future systems.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Cumulative 3+ years of experience with document control
. Advanced experience with MS Office and MS Excel
. Data organization skills
. Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in engineering
. Understanding of technical documentation
. Understanding of project management
. Experience with AutoCAD or BIM
. Understanding of data centers and its critical components
. 2+ years of experience related to industry infrastructure or mission critical facility design

Amazon is a committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :

*Applicants to this internship opportunity will need the work authorization for Singapore

**This could be a 3 or 6 months internship role

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and is the global cloud computing leader. To support our rapid growth, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and motivated people. If you'd like to help us be the best cloud services provider in the industry, this is your chance to make history. AWS HR is looking for dynamic self-starters graduating from MBA and master's programs in HR or related fields in 2023 to participate in our 2022 HR leadership development program (HRLDP) summer internship.

As an intern, you will spend 12 weeks working on a challenging and high-visibility project on one of the following teams: Builder Experience Team, Talent & Development, Compensation, Employee Relations, Workforce Planning & Analytics, Inclusion, Diversity & Equity (ID&E), or one of our HR Business Partner (HRBP) teams. You will have the opportunity to learn from senior HR leaders, receive mentorship and sponsorship, and build a network of peers, HRLDP alumni, and leaders. Upon successful completion of the internship, program participants will have the opportunity to receive a full time offer for the AWS HRLDP, a three-year rotational experience designed set you on the path to HR leadership roles in AWS. Internships will be based in Singapore.

Basic Qualifications :
. 3+ years of full-time industry work experience, which occurred between graduation from your undergraduate program and prior to starting your MBA or master's program, OR 3+ years of military work experience prior to starting your MBA or master's program
. Graduating in December 2022 or Summer 2023 from an MBA or master's degree program with studies in Human Resources or related fields
. Experience in human resources or related fields and/or knowledge of human resource theory (organizational effectiveness and dynamics, leadership, management theory, etc.)
Preferred Qualifications :
. Passion for building a career in Human Resources
. Experience working in a global or matrixed organization
. Strong business and HR acumen, including strong problem solving skills and critical thinking
. Project/Program Management Skills
. Experience in coaching senior leaders and managers
. Exceptional listening skills and ability to relate to, influence, and coach employees of all levels in the organization

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced candidate who will be responsible for innovating in the area of audit integration, control automation, scaling compliance, and next-generation risk management. This candidate will be charged to deliver on our regional audit programs, and developing innovative automated audit processes. This position requires a strong foundation in audit principles, as well as a diverse technology background. As an essential part of this role, you will be leading audit programs and will enable customers to build regulated workloads on AWS. Do you have a passion for applying cutting edge technologies and automation in traditionally manual processes Do you have experience in finding innovative solutions to scale security controls across diverse teams and technologies Do you have ideas about how the future of security assurance, privacy, and transparency programs will look
As a Senior Program Manager of AWS worldwide audit portfolio, you will be participating in a multi-functional and multi-disciplinary team that owns the worldwide portfolio of ongoing and new audits. You will drive the strategy for automating the end-to-end audit processes, including technical security requirement analysis, control implementation, auditor engagement and audit execution, enabling the program to scale with the business. You will help inspire, lead, and transform the programs through innovative process changes across multiple organizations and teams, engaging technical and non-technical people throughout the company. Your combination of technical and audit background will help bridge security, technology, and compliance, and facilitate the scale of the program. As a member of the AWS Security Assurance team, you will work to influence leaders across AWS Security, our field teams, auditors, and customers to deliver an innovative and global audit program.

Key Responsibilities
This position is responsible for:

- Developing and improving AWS comprehensive global audit program, including managing direct engagement with external auditors and customers
- Executing on a collaborative audit roadmap in conjunction with internal and external stakeholders
- Defining processes and tools to support a technical audit platform, extending automation throughout the end-to-end audit process
- Building key engagement mechanisms to engage service owners, to meet the growth needs of the business and of compliance, privacy, and transparency requirements
- Managing leadership relationships and communications to service teams and stakeholders of the audit programs

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Mathematics, Accounting/Auditing, or other related fields
. 5+ years of experience of leading audit, risk and compliance programs
. 5+ years of experience with multiple compliance standards, such as: PCI DSS, SOC 1/2/3, ISO 27001/27017/27018/22301/20000, TIA-942, FedRAMP, HIPAA, IRAP, FISC, K-ISMS, MTCS, or C5
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience in technical security design, compliance consulting, or advisory work in support of a highly technical environment
. Technical background will some demonstrable understanding of cloud services/deployment architecture (ideally AWS cloud services offering)
. Experience with engaging teams who are building technology products or services and experience in working with engineering in defining technical requirements and seeing them through to development and release
. Experience auditing cloud environments
. The ideal candidate is a recognized professional and respected voice in the information security and compliance community

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com, is the industry's leading cloud computing platform. The AWS Startup team is seeking a talented, experienced, self-directed Program Manager to join the ISV team that is responsible for driving adoption of the AWS platform by startups globally.
In this role, you will be responsible for owning and executing key ISV programs across Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ). You will be required to identify, develop and execute regional startup programs for APJ, in collaboration with the ISV and Marketing team. You must be able to directly understand and relate to the startup experience, have an innate understanding for entrepreneurs, company founders and technical decision makers at early stage companies, and be passionate about helping build new ideas for the startup community. Ideally, you are someone that has had experience designing and developing new products targeted at the startup community. You should be familiar and interested in driving innovation in customer facing products, and have a track record of owning successful, metrics driven development plans. You must be able to work with and influence different teams across organizations to work toward a common development goal.
The ideal candidate will have a strong program management background with experience leading medium to large projects. The candidate will also have a business development background with strong ability to earn trust with startup founders, as well as work cross-functionally across the Amazon organization. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must.

Key job responsibilities
Work closely with customers, ISV Marketing, and specialist teams across the organization to understand the needs of entrepreneurs and how to help them meet those needs to achieve growth. Research and ideate potential solutions to process gaps and hurdles in the startup experience.
. Develop and execute on new ISV Programs at the country or APJ level.
. Implement customer usage metrics & reporting, with a strong focus on improving customer experience.
. Manage the entire lifecycle of the initiatives you are responsible for, including showing operations success and developing on further iterations.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree in any field
. 7-10+ years of program/product management or business development experience.
. Demonstrated understanding and savviness in the startup ecosystem, including common patterns of success for startup customers.
. Proven ability to launch successful, external experiences that are used and loved by customers
. Operational savviness, ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously, keeping focus on execution and delivering results consistently.
. Proven ability to work cooperatively with various internal teams, including business development, operations, sales and customer support
. Demonstrated ability to interact with startup executives to both understand their requirements, and to discuss proposed programs and engagements.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.
. Strong analytical skills, with excellent problem-solving abilities in the face of ambiguity.
. Vision to own and drive programs with long term development horizons.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
. Operational experience at a startup, preferably as a founder or in a business, operations or strategy role in the startup ecosystem
. Passionate about technology and with some exposure to AWS platform

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
