job_title: Sr Sales Analytics Lead, Specialized Insights Team
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
For more than 15 years, Amazon Web Services, AWS has been the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 200 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world-including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies-to power their infrastructure. Within the AWS WWCO Commercial Sales organization, the Specialized Sales Operations team is responsible for supporting Leadership, Sales, and Operational teams in achieving organizational objectives and driving continuous improvements in field productivity. We drive effectiveness, predictability, and deliver a run the business cadence that allows for the field to serve customers in the way customers want to be served.

The AWS Specialized Sales Operations team is looking for a results-oriented Senior Sales Analytics and Insights Lead. In this strategic role, you will own defining, building, and scaling metrics and analytical insights that will support the WWSO (Worldwide Specialist Organization) leaders, proactively engage with senior Sales and Business Development leaders to define reporting priorities and to ensure we are tackling the most important business problems and surfacing the best data and information to make optimal business decisions across our global program. This person will establish relationships with key stakeholders such as Sales, Business Development, Sales Operations, Data Engineers and Business Intelligence Engineers to build self-service reports, develop meaningful KPIs, provide actionable findings/insights, and establish automated processes for large scale data analyses. Acting as a business partner to key stakeholders/customers, you will provide data expertise and Sales Insights to drive business results.

We are seeking a Senior Sales Analytics and Insights Lead to join our Insights team with a desire to lead who knows how to execute and deliver on big ideas. The team will use a wide range of technologies, tools, methodologies, and analytic practices to address business challenges and deliver results while keeping their toolbox updated with the latest practices.

Role and Responsibilities:
. Define & build the analytics roadmap across the WWSO organization
. Work closely with Sales & Sales Operations leaders to gather business requirements & deliver insightful analytics solutions. Translate business questions into actionable & insightful dashboards, analyses & decks
. Own the development and maintenance of new and existing reporting dashboards.
. Develop a consistent visual language for all WWSO dashboards that convey the insights in a simple & intuitive manner
. Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
. Identify and implement optimal communication mechanisms with the business stakeholders and supporting teams
. Build relationships across Amazon, working with other analytics and data teams for insights and best practice sharing
. Lead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisions
. Partner with the Business Intelligence and Data Engineering team to drive data requirements and infrastructure design decisions

About the team
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree
. 7+ years of Experience in Data Analytics
. 3+ years of Sales or Finance Analytics, Reporting and Operations Experience
. 5+ years experience w/Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Report Building, nested formulas, etc.)
. 2+ years experience with at least one Data Visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, QuickSight, or similar)
. Experience presenting Data to Director or C-level Audience (Senior Executives)
. Experience Building a Reporting and Metrics Strategy
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Project Management experience or experience working effectively across internal and external organizations and balancing multiple programs/projects & stakeholder groups
. Experience working in an agile development environment
. SQL Proficient
. Experience supporting sales organizations
. Experience defining customer requirements for complex products or systems
. Ability to develop solutions that utilize the highest standards of analytical rigor and data integrity
. Excellent analytical or problem-solving skills
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's Leadership principles requirements for this role
. Meets/exceeds functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

About the Job
As an iOS Mobile Developer, your responsibilities involve:
Designing, developing, and implementing mobile applications as well as continuous production of new versions
Identifying areas for modification in existing programs and subsequently developing these modifications
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define and design new features.
Taking ownership of application development lifecycle, through design, build, test, release, and maintenance.

To apply online please use the apply function, alternatively you can reach me at https://www.linkedin.com/in/RoystonLow. (EA: 94C3609 / R1871559)

DESCRIPTION

*Applicants to this internship opportunity will need the work authorization for Singapore

**This could be a 3 or 6 months internship role

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and is the global cloud computing leader. To support our rapid growth, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and motivated people. If you'd like to help us be the best cloud services provider in the industry, this is your chance to make history. AWS HR is looking for dynamic self-starters graduating from MBA and master's programs in HR or related fields in 2023 to participate in our 2022 HR leadership development program (HRLDP) summer internship.

As an intern, you will spend 12 weeks working on a challenging and high-visibility project on one of the following teams: Builder Experience Team, Talent & Development, Compensation, Employee Relations, Workforce Planning & Analytics, Inclusion, Diversity & Equity (ID&E), or one of our HR Business Partner (HRBP) teams. You will have the opportunity to learn from senior HR leaders, receive mentorship and sponsorship, and build a network of peers, HRLDP alumni, and leaders. Upon successful completion of the internship, program participants will have the opportunity to receive a full time offer for the AWS HRLDP, a three-year rotational experience designed set you on the path to HR leadership roles in AWS. Internships will be based in Singapore.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 3+ years of full-time industry work experience, which occurred between graduation from your undergraduate program and prior to starting your MBA or master's program, OR 3+ years of military work experience prior to starting your MBA or master's program
. Graduating in December 2022 or Summer 2023 from an MBA or master's degree program with studies in Human Resources or related fields
. Experience in human resources or related fields and/or knowledge of human resource theory (organizational effectiveness and dynamics, leadership, management theory, etc.)
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Passion for building a career in Human Resources
. Experience working in a global or matrixed organization
. Strong business and HR acumen, including strong problem solving skills and critical thinking
. Project/Program Management Skills
. Experience in coaching senior leaders and managers
. Exceptional listening skills and ability to relate to, influence, and coach employees of all levels in the organization

job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Come join the AWS Solutions Architecture team in Singapore as an DNB focused Senior Solutions Architect. In this role, you will engage with large DNB customers to understand their business drivers, assess application portfolios and develop blueprints for enterprise operating models, ultimately driving adoption of the AWS platform in the customer organization as well as their end-customers.
This role will work with a limited number of high-value DNB customers and typically lead enterprise transformation strategy in the customer organization, utilizing and coordinating a broader team of AWS cross functional resources. The SA leads the technology side of the transformation and partners with Specialist Solution Architects, AWS Professional Services as well as AWS Consulting Partners, while owning the overall engagement and the corresponding executive relationships (e.g., CTO, CIO, Director of Cloud Strategy, Director of Products, etc.). In addition, the SA would mentor new members on the team or other groups based their area of depth and expertise.
Ideally, the role would be involved in
. Educate and engage with C-level executives, technical and business professionals on organizational transformation challenges and best practices
. Identifying motivators for cloud adoption and unblocking challenges
. Introducing mechanisms for wide scale adoption such as Cloud and DevOps enablement functions, Centers of Excellence, Enterprise reskilling models
. Develop and deliver workshops to reskill the technology team of the ISV to address short term blockers and build action plans
. Defining and executing on the strategy by engaging highly technical teams (Specialist Solutions Architects, Technical Account Managers, AWS professional services consultants and consulting/managed services partners).

Basic Qualifications :
. Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
. Experience driving technical and/or organizational change of significant complexity
. Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
. Fluent written and verbal English communication
. Passion for technology and learning
Preferred Qualifications :
. Continued or advanced learning (Master, MBA, PhD or equivalent)

job_title: Network Deployment Manager, Global Network Build
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon's network is a key differentiator for Amazon Cloud Computing and Web Services (AWS), enabling the global operation of thousands of applications across a highly complex global infrastructure. The AWS Networking team develops and operates the network platform for all of Amazon including e-commerce products and cloud computing solutions. This platform is industry-leading for its efficiency, throughput and reliability, and it is critical to the success of hundreds of thousands of AWS customers.

Are you ready to own the end-to-end Infrastructure Delivery for the largest cloud network on the planet The Infrastructure Delivery Network Deployment Team (IDND) is responsible for structured cabling, hardware deployment, and hardware commissioning related to network deployment during the initial phase of a data center. The Manager is responsible for a medium, geographically diverse team of highly qualified network engineers. This leader will be responsible for end-to-end delivery of our Network Infrastructure, including Safety, Scheduling, Standards and Implementation for new builds across the APAC Region. This leader is expected to significantly enhance our speed, quality, and safety in deploying new capacity to our network in Data Center sites across the region. You will ensure the right resources/structure is in place to proactively stay ahead of our capacity demands while applying common sense around capital efficiency. Our leaders are deeply technical, understanding their environment to accurately represent issues and implement a strategy that continues to set new records for cycle time, quality and staff efficiency.

In this role, you will manage resources responsible for configuring and deploying all network infrastructure in new AWS data centers. This leader will drive the strategy to innovate and optimize our new scale deployment while instilling the highest level of operational excellence in tools and processes. The mission of the team is to deliver network capacity on time with zero rework. The manager will be responsible for a full-time team of technicians and Fly-In/Fly-Out remote support technicians whilst they are in region supporting build efforts.

This leader will be integral to the wider infrastructure management senior leadership team, collaborating with our engineering and operations teams on new solutions and designs. They will own all aspects of people management.

Our engineers, managers, and leaders are innovators at heart come join us and become integral to the technology company that is the past, present and future of real Cloud Computing.
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
. 3+ years of experience in a data center technology role
. 5+ years of experience in management/team lead function
. 3 + years of TCP/IP networking knowledge
. 3 + years of knowledge of network cabling, optic types, and test equipment
Preferred Qualifications :
. 6+ years in a data center technology role
. Experience with building physical data center such as copper/fiber cabling
. Experience developing operational metrics to drive efficiencies
. Experience representing your team/technical area to senior management
. Experience in contributing to the definition and implementation of automation opportunities within an deployment/build environment
. Experience with lean methodologies and Six-Sigma or similar qualification
. Organizational and planning skills
. Broad understanding of infrastructure technologies installation and design
. Knowledge of network cabling, optic types, and test equipment
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Job Description :
Job summary
Do you have a passion for helping customers design large distributed systems Would you like to do this using the world's most advanced cloud computing technologies Do you have a knack for helping organizations understand application architectures and integration approaches, architecting advanced cloud-based solutions, and launching the build-out of those systems Are you one of those rare technologists with the consultative leadership skills to help guide major projects to success Come join the Amazon Web Services (AWS) team as a Principal Solutions Architect in Singapore!

As an Enterprise Accounts Solutions Architect you will be responsible for creating and driving the technical strategy for strategic customer accounts with a complex and multi-faceted relationship with AWS. You will partner with customers, AWS partners and AWS teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that provide solutions to solve customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services.

The right person will possess C-Level customer facing skills that will allow them to represent AWS well within the customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, and risk mitigation. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges. He/she will have these attributes:

*Be fun to work with.* Our company credo is Work hard. Have fun. Make history. As the right candidate, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge.

*Enjoy working with customers of all shapes and s.* You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for a diverse and challenging set of customers.

*Have a strong understanding of large scale cloud computing solutions.* You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills and developing new ones, so that you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions around systems and applications in the cloud. You regularly take part in deep-dive education and design exercises along with technical deep dive drive technical discussions to create world class systems in AWS for your customers.

The right individual will have experience in most of the following areas:

* Business acumen - Leads confidently conversations at C-level and one-down (e.g. director, vice president) on strategic and transformational business subjects
* Architecture & design - Brings a proven track record in delivering enterprise and infrastructure architectures, application and service designs for distributed, business critical applications.
* Industry expertise - Is a subject matter expert in one of the areas including Financial Services, eCommence, Telco, Airlines, Manufacturing.
Basic Qualifications :
* 10+ years of experience in design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications
* Experience in infrastructure, compute, containers, database and networking architecture for large scale environments
* Hands-on experience in application development and modernization including micro-service, and API driven-architectures
* Working knowledge on a broad range of technologies including Serverless, Big Data and Analytics, Machine learning, Containers e.g. Kubernetes, etc.
* Strong business acumen and interest to understand business problems and ability to explain the technology value proposition
* Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
* Technical degree required Computer Science or Math background highly desired.
Preferred Qualifications :
* AWS or other public clouds hands-on experience and certification
* Experience working in a pre-sales consulting role within the enterprise software market or Internet industries servicing enterprise customers

job_title: Telecom Data & Analytics Business Development Leader, APJ
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to enable some of the largest telecom operators in the world transform the ways in which they use data for predicting customer needs, preventing inefficiencies and delivering personalized experiences Have you been a part of creating and delivering digital and analytics strategies for major Telcos

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and the leader in providing secure, reliable, scalable, and innovative cloud services that help businesses across the globe scale and grow. The AWS Telecom Business Development team is looking for an experienced candidate to lead Data Management and Analytics Go-To-Market, driving significant adoption of data, analytics and AI/ML solutions for our largest telecom customers.

This is a senior role, with an Asia-Pacific remit, to guide customers in accelerating their digital transformations by building data-driven organizations, and enabling business outcomes leveraging AWS database, analytics, AI and ML technologies. You will help our telecom customers accelerate this journey by engaging with the customers business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment helping them learn from examples of industry leaders, reference architectures and define what great looks like for their data-driven enterprise.

This role may be located in Sydney or Singapore, and will strive to create alignment among customer stakeholders, address resistance to change and provide a tangible, executable vision to transition to a cloud computing model. They will operate effectively at multiple levels of the organization and can address concerns across C-suite executives, marketing/LOB leaders, data science practitioners, and established platform teams.

You will represent the AWS telecom data strategy and be the leading voice for AWS telecom data-focused solutions. You will leverage worldwide programs, campaigns and work closely with the wider AWS business development, product management, marketing, solutions architecture, partner and professional services teams to position the AWS telecom data strategy for telecom customers and partners.

The ideal candidate will possess a telecommunications business- and data analytics background (preferably including machine learning), with a foundation of having directly led sales / pre-sales / consulting engagements and interactions at the highest levels of large telecom operators and technology partners. The candidate should have proven expertise at thought leadership, conceptualizing customer-centric solutions, convincing C-Level executives, line of business leaders and IT architects, and having seen through successful sales to delivery cycles.

Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, telecom enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation/shaping, with an awareness of field enablement techniques.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
* 15+ years of experience in client related interactions, including executive presentations, relationship management, deal structuring and commercials negotiation, including working with partners in a consortium framework
* 10+ years of related experience in data management and data architecture
* 3+ years experience in analytics roadmaps, including machine learning
* Experience managing / advising on data operations, data strategy, data governance, metadata management, or data quality management discipline
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or applicable field, or MBA
* Experience creating and executing organizational change management strategies as part of a larger transformation
* Program oversight experience in a Sales / Business Development capacity, including planning, prioritization, successful project completion and maintaining a focus on high standards and quality
* Experience with machine learning
* Experience with data architecture, data system and tools, related software, and data management policies and practices in a complex organizational environment
* Experience in evaluating on-premise vs cloud computing models
* AWS Cloud certifications

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

tech_stack: Azure  Vmware  Information Technology  Logging  Windows  Mobile Devices  Itil  Virtualization  Linux  Grocery  Hardware  Active Directory  rollout  Administration  Compliance  Articulate
job_description:
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.
Get to know the Team:
The Foundations team is a new team team responsible for cloud engineering and developer tools at Grab. We make an impact by building the automation and tooling that enable our platform and development teams to effectively and securely operate. Our team is made up of devops and infrastructure engineers. If you are looking for cloud infrastructure, devops, or devsecops opportunities, then you should join our team!
Get to know the Role:
We are looking for an engineer to automate management of cloud infrastructure and developer tooling. We believe a successful candidate has experience with one or more cloud environments, knowledge of devops concepts and practices, some scripting/coding ability and ideally some experience working in platform or CI/CD teams delivering functionality to developers, but if you believe you have what it takes then we'd love to hear from you either way. This role is required because we have a large developer community and an ever more sophisticated set of tools and automation requirements. In return, you will get an opportunity to expand your skills into a number of different areas - from systems administration through to backend coding, integration with vendor systems, cloud automation and security, SRE and more.
The Day-to-Day Activities:
You are responsible for automating common cloud operations - account/subscription creation and management
You spend time with security ensuring that their needs are built into automated guardrails for developer resources
You support the developer community in their needs, always with a view to self-service and automation where possible
You are responsible for the roll-out of new cross-cutting technologies - container clusters and service mesh, secrets management, monitoring and logging solutions and more
You are involved in the design and implementation of new configurations for cloud resource use
You bring a knowledge of new ways of doing things and can clearly articulate technical solutions both within and outside the team
The Must-Haves:
You have experience with one or more cloud environments (AWS, Azure preferred)
You are an experienced DevOps or DevSecOps practitioner, and have operated production services in cloud environments
You have experience with build and deploy tooling - jenkins, spinnaker, and similar You have experience with automation for infrastructure deploy/manage - terraform, cloudformation, resource manager or similar
You can easily pick up new technologies and are keen to expand your knowledge
You have experience with micro-service architectures
Our Commitment:
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.
About Grab:
Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries.
Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.

job_description:
As trustee of the nation's retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.
Information Technology
IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board's IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for the delivery and operations of a suite of technical services designed to enable application teams to build their systems on the Commercial Cloud and yet able to connect back to on-premise systems securely.
The area of your responsibilities include:
Manage, configure and maintain the technical services and infrastructure solutions deployed.
Actively analyze and derive operational insights from the monitoring metrics that are generated from the various Cloud services including recommending improvements to the operational dashboards.
Participate in continuous enhancement and automation of operational processes into templates, playbooks or other forms so as to enable consistency in security compliance and scalability of operations.
Provide technical support for infrastructure and operations which include change management, problem management, configuration management, capacity management and disaster recovery.
Respond promptly to system issues and incidents on 24x7 basis.
Provides specialist infrastructure support to project teams to enable them to onboard to Cloud.
Requirements
At least 6 years experience in the managing enterprise systems on Commercial Cloud platforms, systems integration, systems operations, network and/ or cyber security
Good proficiency in the use of Cloud provisioning tools such as Terraform for resourcing provision in the Cloud (AWS or Azure) on premise
Relevant expertise in virtualisation and container technologies, service based architectures, software defined networking and virtualised communications infrastructure components
Relevant expertise in the architecting of cloud security best practices using one or more of the Cloud Service Providers
Good working knowledge in one or more of the following
Cloud Automation tools
Scripting for provisioning
Management of Cloud Operations
Key systems management components
Security vulnerability assessments, security risk assessments, local and site recovery assessments, processes and mitigation measures.
Data analytics tools and methodologies or data science
Professional certifications in Cloud, Security and/ or similar credentials
Strong critical thinking, analytical and project management skills
Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with different stakeholders
Seniority of appointment will commensurate with relevant work experience
What you can expect
A challenging and rewarding career where you can contribute to national objectives
A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
A flexible schedule where work is not constrained to the office and 9-to-6 workdays
A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with flexible dress code where you are empowered to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
Position is on 2-year contract on commencement with possibility of renewal and conversion to permanent
Grow and gain valuable work experience where you can accelerate your career through promotion opportunities subject to individual performance
Comprehensive rewards package
Annual leave and pro-family leave
Medical and dental benefits
Access to recreational activities

Job Description :
Job summary
The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Security Operations Center (SOC) is expanding physical and security services operations to support the growth of our data centers and related security functions. The AWS SOC Security Services Team is seeking a self-motivated SOC Security Analyst with security technology experience, problem-solving abilities, analysis skills, and strong customer obsession.

Come join the team tasked with raising the level of security on a global scale, across new and existing AWS infrastructure. The AWS SOC Security Analyst will work with security leaders and partners, providing timely and accurate support within the physical security realm of the data center environment. This person will manage communications, facilitate operational needs, generate and/or manage trouble tickets, and provide additional services as required.

The AWS SOC is a 24/7/365 operation, you can expect operational hours weekday work and rotational on-call support over weekends. Here in AWS, we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key job responsibilities
. Investigate security findings, researches mitigation's, and analyzes potential security vulnerability related information from a variety of sources to remediate root cause
. Configure physical security devices including cameras, readers.
. Manage high security events, communicate risks to AWS stakeholders, and escalate to drive mitigation
. Utilize security mindset and judgement to assess security risks across the organization and escalate accordingly
. Works as an enabler to bring stakeholders together to address findings and risks until a formalized business owner is identified to take lead.
. Produce progress reports, briefs, and white papers regarding vulnerabilities, security concerns, and operations gaps that affect AWS data center operations and/or AWS reputation.
. Consults closely with the other Amazon security and service teams on issues related to AWS security posture.
. Interface with technical teams, stakeholders and leadership teams to translate security risk mitigation plans into actionable items to mitigate risk.

Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree in a security discipline, Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, (or) 3+ years equivalent security technology, data center operations, and or physical/technical security experience
. 1 year of experience working in an operations center or equivalent environment
. 2 years previous experience using MS Office Suite and other Microsoft products to include Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, SharePoint, etc.
. 2 years of experience demonstrating multitasking skills including the ability to communicate quickly and effectively, both written and verbally, while executing technical tasks or functions

Preferred Qualifications :
. Knowledge of security technology, risk assessment methodologies, policies, and processes.
. Familiarity with cloud architecture/infrastructure and general networking principles
. Experience in systems and/or network administration Experience with cloud security operations in AWS
. Experience demonstrating the ability to produce reports for senior managers, internal departments, and external stakeholders regarding physical security events, cyber threats, cloud security, and physical security infrastructure as they affect operations and customers globally
. Experience using automation to solve problems and reduce repetitive tasks
. Understanding of scripting languages, such as JS, Ruby, and HTML
. Experience engaging in project management, tracking timelines, and participating in planning and executing tasks within project milestones
roles: AWS SOC Support Engineer  AWS SOC Support Engineer

job_title: AVP/Senior Associate, SRE Engineer, Middle Office Technology, Technology %26 Operations

job_description:
Work Here. Transform Everywhere.
VMware software powers the world's complex digital infrastructure. You may be thinking that VMware is a company that is all about virtualization while we are still the market leaders in this platform with over 90% of corporate workload, VMware provides software that build, run, manage, connect and protect any app on any cloud and any device.

Insights to your role- Solution Engineer
Are you interested in shaping the future of our customer's technology strategy, architecture, and roadmap Do you want to be make a difference
In short, SE is the person who has the responsibility of working with our clients/customers, to understand their business imperative and technical requirements, and then to build out innovative and differentiated solutions and architecture that will help these organizations drive business outcomes.

Your Experience. Required Skills

VMware Solution Engineer (SE) is a technical role who works closely with the sales team, commercial territory manager and partner business manager to identify, develop, accelerate and win opportunities.

Demonstrate deep understanding of VMware solutions and their appropriate industries in order to drive synergy and maintain credibility with prospective clients.

Perform and support tasks such as technical sales calls, presentations, proof-of-concepts, capacity planning and technical ROI models.

Ability to effectively present to customers via remote conferencing technologies such as Zoom / MS Teams and more.

To be successful what other skills would you have
In addition to the above there are some skills and abilities that would really help you be successful. These are:

Passion - Passionate about technology and how it is changing the worldfor the better,be it cyber-security,Kubernetes container technology, cloud computing, application development platform and end-user computing.

Creative Problem Solver - Creativity is an important part to the success of the role, you must enjoy difficult challenges and know how to think out-of-the-box to formulate the best outcome for the customer.

Project Success - Provide limited post-sale support to key customers primarily to the project/implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction. Also support one-to-many sales and marketing events on-site and remotely.

Communication Skills - Being an excellent communicator with both business and technical people is an essential skill for the role, while working independently and participate in the sales processes.

Customer success - helping customers to succeed and solving their problems is where you need to strive in, when customers are successful, we are successful, and you will do your utmost best in your capacity to help them realize their goals in the organization.

Work Experience / Education / Certifications / Qualifications

Bachelors or Masters Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent, other background can be considered

Relevant experience / certifications in security, applications development, DevOps, cloud, storage, networking, security will be preferred

Technically sound and able to quickly grasp the architectural concepts (e.g., datacenter technologies, networking, DevOps, Kubernetes)

Demonstrates 3-4 successful initiatives/engagements leading small teams on small-mid-d deals

Proficiency in English as the main language is mandatory

As this is a regional role, secondary language for coverage would be a plus but is optional

Previous experience in working with channel partners on solution delivery would be advantageous

Interesting facts
Things like our developer platforms on Kubernetes (in fact 2 of the three founders of Kubernetes now work for VMware!), capabilities like our digital workspace which is transforming organizations employee experience for some of the biggest companies in the world, leveraging intrinsic security to secure your applications and data, or our more cutting edge cloud management and virtual networking capabilities which is bringing the cloud into everyone's private data centre.

You may also be surprised to learn that we are one of Amazon Web Services (AWS) biggest partners and are key development partners with the likes of Microsoft, Google and SAP. We work with over 4,000 other VMware Cloud partners from the very big to the boutique ones.
Sales: VMware's Sales team focuses on two primary goals: helping customers solve their biggest business problems and hitting our bookings targets to keep our company growing and strong. We begin by forging deep relationships with our customers, so we can truly understand their business challenges and opportunities. We help drive their digital transformation by bringing VMware solutions that provide the speed, agility, and efficiency needed to compete and grow in the Internet economy. We also try to make the world a better place by hosting and participating in community activities. Are you inspired by the chance to solve your customers biggest challenges You can make that kind of difference with VMware's portfolio of industry-leading solutions. Join our team, and you can grow your career and share in the success of an industry pioneer that's turning companies into truly digital enterprises.

VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

job_description:
Company Overview:
A leading one-stop, global Human Resource service provider, BIPO helps companies scale-up their HR operations with ease.
Our award-winning cloud and mobile-based Human Resource Management System (HRMS) platform simplifies complicated HR processes. We understand companies need to stay agile, efficient, and cost-effective. That is why we have designed a comprehensive suite of HR solutions Payroll Outsourcing, Attendance Automation, HR Consulting, Recruitment & Business Process Outsourcing, Flexible Employee Management to help digitise and transform HR.
Since 2004, we have built an extensive network spanning globally, spanning across 16 countries (and growing). To date, we have served 1,600+ clients, servicing 230,000+ headcounts, in over 12+ industries. Overall, our global reach means we can serve your needs in a more targeted and effective manner!
Key Responsibilities:
Work with clients on business issues, gather requirements and define a system solution design
Assessing, designing, developing, testing, deploying, and supporting system components to meet business requirements
Training and supporting sales in tender and RFQ process
Consulting on solution design for implementation of project requirements in accordance to the client's Enterprise Architecture
Ensure overall quality assurance for solution designs
Regular exchange and drive global alignment of solution design with other solution consultants in the regions
Meeting with stakeholders to identify solutions and areas of improvement
Translate business requirements to a feasible and sustainable design of the system
Ensure project deliveries are as per requirements and on time
Identify the requests, issues, risks and constraints from the users end and work out the possible evolutions and enhancements.
Requirements:
Degree holder preferably in Computer Science, Management Information System or similar qualifications;
5+ years of relevant experience as a HRIS manager, management information system manager, business analyst, solution architect or other consultant-like roles
Ability to work with cross organizational users HR, Finance, Sales, Supply chain and IT, etc. to identify opportunities and drive them to resolution translate client issues into solutions that address complex situations;
In-depth understanding in HCM business and management consulting
Manages projects and economics efficiently; planning and performing work in accordance with client requirements and professional standards
Strong business acumen to shape client potential requirements/pain-points into solid projects;
Excellent skills in proposal development from strategy to operation to implementation;
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
Proficiency in written and spoken English is essential

tech_stack: Microsoft Azure  Devops  Etl  Data Integration  data engineering  Sql  Python  Data Architecture  Power Bi  Data Visualization
job_description:
About NTT Data Singapore
We are a top 6 global IT services company with operations in 50+ countries. We offer an advanced portfolio of application, business process, cloud, and infrastructure services to businesses and governments worldwide.NTT DATA Singapore PTE Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTT DATA Corp, a part of NTT Group, the world's 65th Largest Company according to Fortune Magazine. The Singapore entity of NTT DATA is an S10 government-registered supplier and forms the core of NTT DATA's APAC operations and is positioned as a gateway of our global capabilities in Singapore and the APAC region.At NTT DATA SINGAPORE, we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunity employer that puts our people and clients first. We welcome different ideas, backgrounds and passionate individuals to join us in our inclusive environment to achieve stronger and better results through teamwork, foresight, and innovation. We pledge to create a harmonious and nurturing culture, where all individuals feel a sense of pride and belonging, regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity.
Responsibilities:
The Senior Data Engineer will lead the enterprise-wide data transformations projects. The person will involve in developing and automating data processing pipelines for financial and Investment data modelling, analysis, and reporting from various data sources systems; The primary responsibility of this position is to establish the enterprise data Lake architecture under Microsoft Azure Data Factory, Databricks and Synapse and lead a team to deliver data driven solutions.
Lead architecture design, develop, document, and implement end-to-end data pipelines and data-driven solutions.
Define roadmap to transform data architecture focusing on scalability, performance, and stability for the entire data lifecycle;
Build data flow for data acquisition, aggregation, and modelling, using both batch and streaming paradigms.
Perform data analysis, data profiling, data cleansing, data lineage, data mapping and data transformation.
Development of high-quality code for the core data stack including data integration hub, data warehouse and data pipelines under Azure service.
Recommend, execute and deliver best practices in data management and data lifecycle processes, including modular development of data processes, coding and configuration standards, error handling and notification standards, auditing standards, and data archival standards.
Implementing security and standards, documenting technical specifications and operating procedures.
Collaborate across developers as part of a SCRUM team, ensuring collective team productivity
Provide technical support for any data issues with recommendations and resolutions.
Requirements:
3-5 years professional experience as a data engineer, software engineer, data analyst, data scientist, or related role.
Experience with Microsoft Azure Data Integration Stack (Azure Data Lake Gen2, Azure Data Factory, Delta Lake, SSIS, SQL Server, Azure Data Warehouse), Databricks, Spark.
Working experience in Investment or Real Estate industry, preferably with business and functional knowledge.
Expertise building ETL and data pipelines on Databricks using data engineering languages Python and SQL on Azure.
Knowledge and experience working with Python & SQL;
Proven experience with all aspects of the Data Pipeline (Data Sourcing, Transformations, Data Quality, Etc).
Experience with visual modelling tools including UML
Proficient in using data visualization tool such as Power BI, Workiva and in standard office tools such as Excel.
Familiar with DevOps and Agile methodology.
This position is only open to candidates that is currently residing in Singapore. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, industrial equipment, automotive, aerospace, and others sectors. The rapid pace of innovation is driven by more and better access to computing resources, allowing unprecedented amounts of data to be analyzed in near real time on nearly infinite computational resources. Will the cure for cancer come out of a lab or out of a remote computing cluster Emerging technology like AI/ML, IoT, quantum computing, and autonomous systems are making new discoveries possible every day. Our job is to facilitate and support the innovators making those discoveries.

We are looking for a Senior Specialist, Autonomous Computing to join the Autonomous Computing (AC) go to market team. The AC team enables the at-scale development of autonomous systems that seek to improve productivity, safety, and customer operations in some of the most challenging use-cases. Examples of autonomous systems include mobility (autonomous vehicles, aerial taxis), smart electricity grids (demand response), robotics (situational awareness), supply chain (intelligent inventory management), and Industrial Internet (continuously learning digital twins of industrial equipment), and healthcare (diagnostic imaging, precision medicine, drug discovery).

In this role, you will work closely with customers to understand the requirements and complexities involved in developing their autonomous systems, with a particular emphasis on the use of simulations, machine learning, and/or accelerated computing (GPUs, FPGAs, custom ASICs) technologies. You will help define the next AC workloads to pursue, define go-to-market strategies and lead cross-functional initiatives to expand existing markets, develop adoption programs and identify new opportunities. These activities include sizing the market opportunity, identifying a pipeline of potential customers, working with customers to understand technical requirements for proof-of-concepts, creating content to train the field teams, leading external workshops to drive industry thought-leadership, working with product teams to define new features, and identifying partners or potential acquisitions.

The ideal candidate will have deep-domain expertise in one or more domains such as aviation, automotive, power & utilities, renewable energy, financial services, health care, life sciences, or other industry which benefits from autonomous systems. You have business experience to drive an engagement at the CxO/VP level, and have demonstrated program/product go-to-market expertise that will help you work with customers to identify use-cases that take advantage of the power of AWS storage, compute, networking, big data, machine learning, and IoT technologies. Additionally, the candidate will have demonstrated some level of hands-on experience either developing autonomous systems, creating and running simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, accelerating computing workloads on GPUs (or ASICs), and/or developing accelerators. The candidate has the technical depth to communicate the benefits of simulations to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives, while working backwards from customer requirements to suggest scalable solutions and architectures. The candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and being scrappy is a must.

Roles & Responsibilities
. Serve as a key team member of the Autonomous Computing team to identify, define and prioritize the AWS market segments, customer base, and industry verticals we target to achieve the most impactful outcomes
. Develop strategic go-to-market plans for target markets and ensure it is in line with the AWS strategic direction
. Execute the strategic go-to-market plans while working with key internal stakeholders (e. g. solutions architects, product service teams, sales teams, legal, support, etc.)
. Identify specific prospects/partners to approach while communicating the specific value proposition for their business and use case
. Engage with prospects, partners, cross functional teams, and key customers
. Work with customers to understand their Autonomous Systems workflows and how AWS technologies can enable their use-case
. Identify and promote repeatable use cases and case studies to build AWS internal and external market awareness
. Collaborate with internal teams to understand the technical requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings
. Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of our key markets
. Handle high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of business development, management consulting, strategic partnerships, enterprise sales, technology development, or program/product management experience
. 2+ years working experience developing and deploying simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, and/or developing accelerators
. Experience building Go-To-Market (GTM) plans that scale across an organization
. Deep knowledge of one or more industries that represent potential autonomous computing use-cases
. Experience interfacing with customers (Enterprise, SMB, and Startups) and solution building ability
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight that drives customer adoption and recommendations to the business
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must. Experience speaking at technology conferences, as well as communicating across the organization from technical staff to VP/CxOs.
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key in a matrix environment
. Business and/or technical degree required

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. M.S., PhD, MBA or other higher degree in a business or technical field
. Solid negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
. Meticulous attention to detail ability to juggle many tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar
. Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, innovative, and rapidly evolving industry and business organization
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

tech_stack: Kubernetes  Azure  Amazon Aws  AWS  Scripting  Logging  Python  Mobile Devices  Continuous Integration  Docker  Ansible  Java  Aws Lambda  Linux  aws cwi  Grocery  rollout  Administration  Articulate  Financial Services
job_description:
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.
Get to know the team
The Foundations team is responsible for cloud engineering and developer tools at Grab. We make an impact by building the automation and tooling that enable our platform and development teams to effectively and securely operate. Our team is made up of devops and infrastructure engineers. If you are looking for cloud infrastructure, devops, or devsecops opportunities, then you should join our team!
Get to know the role
We are looking for an engineer to automate management of cloud infrastructure and developer tooling. We believe a successful candidate has experience with one or more cloud environments, knowledge of devops concepts and practices, some scripting/coding ability and ideally some experience working in platform or CI/CD teams delivering functionality to developers, but if you believe you have what it takes then we'd love to hear from you either way.
This role is required because we have a large developer community and an ever more sophisticated set of tools and automation requirements. In return, you will get an opportunity to expand your skills into a number of different areas - from systems administration through to backend coding, integration with vendor systems, cloud automation and security, SRE and more.
The Day-to-Day Activities
You are responsible for automating common cloud operations - account/subscription creation and management
You spend time with security ensuring that their needs are built into automated guardrails for developer resources
You support the developer community in their needs, always with a view to self-service and automation where possible
You are responsible for the roll-out of new cross-cutting technologies - container clusters and service mesh, secrets management, monitoring and logging solutions and more
You are involved in the design and implementation of new configurations for cloud resource use
You bring a knowledge of new ways of doing things and can clearly articulate technical solutions both within and outside the team
The Must-Haves
You have Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility
You have experience with one or more cloud environments (AWS, Azure preferred)
You are an experienced DevOps or DevSecOps practitioner, and have operated production services in cloud environments
You have experience with build and deploy tooling - jenkins, spinnaker, and similar
You have experience with automation for infrastructure deploy/manage - terraform, cloudformation, resource manager or similar
You can easily pick up new technologies and are keen to expand your knowledge
You have experience with micro-service architectures
Our Commitment
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.
About Grab
Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries.
Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.

job_description:
Wipro Limited is a leading global information technology, consulting and business process services company. We harness the power of cognitive computing, hyper-automation, robotics, cloud, analytics and emerging technologies to help our clients adapt to the digital world and make them successful.
A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 220,000 dedicated employees serving clients across six continents. Together, we discover ideas and connect the dots to build a better and a bold new future.
Responsibilities
Responsible for the operational work within the whole Talent Acquisition process
Attract, source, interview, evaluate and lead our candidates through our process
Responsible for creating offers and negotiating the outcomes with candidates
Explaining and describing benefits packages
Liaise with hiring managers to schedule and organize interviews, provide updates and release offers.
Coordinating with onsite delivery teams and Workforce Management teams
Preparing reports, dashboards and participating in reviews with different Business units.
Be involved in TA projects and Employer Branding work
Contribute with improvement ideas and creative transformation work
Requirement
On going poly/ university students who is seeking for internship.
Minimum 3 months commitment of full time internship/traineeship programme.
Ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships.
Ability to continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to sourcing and delivering candidates.
Strong communication skills, organizational and negotiation skills.
We thank all applicants for your interest but regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, caste, creed, religion, gender, marital status, age, ethnic and national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, political orientation, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description:
Job Description:
The SAP Basis, Integration and GRC Consultant is responsible for the supporting, administering, and
monitoring of day-to-day activities of the SAP Systems and handling GRC requests.
? Responsible for SAP systems installation, configuration, maintenance, migration, and upgrade
? Working with Cloud providers and Business teams to troubleshoot application performances on
cloud environment and other business critical issues
? Provide SAP Cloud Platform Integration / Process Orchestration expertise on delivery of design
and build phase activities.
? Conduct regular reviews of the application portfolio and technical landscape to identify the
redundancy and operational inefficiency and to recommend and implement alternate solutions
? Manage routine patching and upgrades of operating system and databases
? Managing and monitoring SAP security, support packages, enhancement packages, SAP sizing,
system performance
? Support system hardening or system configuration change
? Involve in disaster recovery planning, testing, process implementation and audits
? Managing, provisioning, administration of SAP Cloud Platform accounts, sub-accounts and
tenants- SCP Account management, maintain Quotas, services entitlement and SCP update
planning
? Drive automation and scripting methodologies
? Ability to manage multiple tasks, work in a team environment, understand and be responsive to
project and stakeholder needs.
? Ability to adapt and function effectively in a fast-paced, changing environment while working
under deadlines.
? Build credible relationships with peers and stakeholders, and continuous professional learning of
SAP products.
? Support team in managing and handling GRC requests
Job Requirements:
? Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or other related disciplines
? Minimum 3 years experience in SAP Basis monitoring, installation, and configuration, supporting
SAP Systems landscape (ECC/ S/4HANA, BW, Portal, Content Server, Solution Manager, SAP
GUI and database)
? Technical proficiency with at least 1 to 2 full life cycle of S/4 HANA (1809) implementation and
HANA support projects experience.
? Hands on expertise in SAP Cloud products & related processes/ services.
? Expert knowledge of process integration tools, like SAP CPI, CIG and hands-on expertise in SAP
integration ALE, IDOCS and Web Services / RESTful required
? Good knowledge in AWS/Azure & cloud platform is an added advantage.
? SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP BTP Integration and extensibility solution experience
? Working knowledge of DevOps automation concepts, practices, and procedures.
? Knowledge of modern back-end technology stacks, tools, and standards, including relational and
non-relational databases, webservers, server-side frameworks such as Postgres, MongoDB,
Nginx, Node.js, restful APIs, and OAuth is a plus
? Experience on Cloud Architecture, DevOps and Cloud Software Development (experience with
React.js and Node.js is a plus)
? SAP Basis administration experience in private / public cloud-based environment
? Possess Database knowledge (Oracle, DB2, SQL, HANA, Sybase) and Operating System
knowledge (UNIX, Windows, Linux)
? Skilled in change management, system analysis, requirements gathering and production control
? Working knowledge in SAP GRC is an added advantage.
? Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills, proactive and ability to communicate progress and
outcomes, and provide clear recommendations
? Possess exceptional interpersonal and communication skills including verbal, written, listening
and presentation.
